With the second loan she is requesting, she plans to buy 30 tins of potatoes for 50,000FCFA, 20 tins of beans for 50,000FCFA, vegetables for 10,000FCFA, and cocoyams for 5,000FCFA.  This investment will help people in her community because she will sell her goods to the public, which will reduce their cost of transportation.

She says that she will use the profit generated from this investment to help her husband pay tuition fees for her two children and take care of their health. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Argentina Piedad

texts.es:
Argentina Piedad S. V., tiene 73 años.  Es viuda y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos,  German (45), Luis (60), Gloria (56), Maricela (45), Nancy (40)  y Gabriel (50). 

Argentina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Argentina  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra banano, cacao, café, maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad y los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de banano, cacao, café, maíz para sembrar y vender. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Argentina Piedad S. V. is 73 years old and lives with her sons in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She has 6 children: German (45), Luis (60), Gloria (56), Maricela (45) Nancy (40) and Gabriel (50). Argentina is a member of the communal bank 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are seeking from Cooperativa San José. Argentina works in agriculture, cultivating bananas, cocoa, coffee and maize. She makes her monthly purchases in Echeandia and sells in the same locations and surrounds. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of bananas, cocoa, coffee and maize to sow and sell. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity to improve their situation. Her dreams are to have her own business and increase her earnings. Preventing her from realising her goals is the lack of money and the plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Argentina likes to work in the countryside and spend time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana, cocoa, coffee and maize to sow/grow

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita E. is from the town of Surallah. She is 63 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Florita owns a business raising crops, primarily rice, for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 46 years.

Florita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Florita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Clavelina Estherlia

texts.es:
Clavelina Estherlia N. M., tiene 41 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos,  en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos,  Washintong  y Johana.
 
Clavelina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Clavelina  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad y los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  cacao y maíz para sembrar y vender. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Clavelina Estherlia N. M. is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She has two children, Washington and Johana. Clavelina is a member of the communal group 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are seeking from la Cooperativa San José. Clavelina works in agriculture, producing cocoa and maize. She makes her purchases in Echeandia each month and sells in the same place, and around the area. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of cocoa and maize to sow and sell. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to move forward. Her dreams are to have her own business and increase her earnings. Preventing her from achieving her goals is the lack of money and the plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Clavelina likes to working in the countryside.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa and maize to sow and sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be successful in her business, just like other entrepreneurs. She also wants her children to finish college and does her best to achieve it.

Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Anita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ayeah

texts.en:
Born in 1984, Ayeah L., is married to Mr. Isaac Jam and they have three children who are all younger than 15. Her motivation comes from the difficulties she faced, especially the death of her mother, poor health, her inability to continue education and the destruction of her cassava farm by wild fire. As a consequence of all this, she was unable to educate her children even at primary school level.

Encouraged by GHAPE borrowers she became a member of GHAPE and received her first loan of 40,000CFAF in 2009. Since then she has proven her ability to receive, invest and repay her loan. From previous loans she provided her community with food stuff like beans, corn and Irish potatoes. 
She is proud of her achievements, especially her success in owning and managing her own business. With profits from these loans, she has been paying her children’s school fees. 

With a new loan, she plans to continue in the same line of business. She plans to buy twenty tins of beans for 50,000FCFA, fifteen tins of Irish potatoes for 20,000FCFA, six tins of corn for 15,000FCFA and vegetables for 10,000FCFA  She will provide food stuff to the community and the business will succeed since she has many customers. Her intention is to use the profit to continue to educate her children and to take care of her health and her family. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, Irish potatoes and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Libia Noemi

texts.es:
Libia Noemi R. J. tiene 43 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos,  Rolando  y Holger. 

Libia es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Libia  se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de licores. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de venta de licores. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Ella espera incrementar los ingresos de su negocio con la ayuda de este prestamo. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.

Le gusta trabajar y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Libia Noemi R. J. is 43. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. Libia has 2 children: Rolando and Holger. Libia is a member of the communal bank 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first time that they are seeking a loan from Cooperativa San José. Libia works in commerce and has an alcohol store. She makes her monthly purchases in Echeandia and sells in the same location. She is seeking a loan to invest in her business and sees it as an opportunity to improve her situation. She hopes to increase her earnings with the help of this loan. Preventing her from achieving her dreams are the lack of money and plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Libia likes working and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Eunice D. is the mother of three children. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her mother away when still very young and when she finds it difficult to single-handedly pay tuition fees and provide the basic needs for her children. This is the first time she has requested a loan from GHAPE. As she was unable to get investment capital that would help increase her income, she was motivated to request a loan from GHAPE. 

With the loan, she plans to buy three tins of beans seedlings for 195,500FCFA and she will use 30,500FCFA to pay for labor on her farm. She will pay for clearing, hoeing and planting.

She thinks the business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time, she has a plot of land on which to operate and, also, her community will provide a ready market for her beans when they are ready. The profit obtained from this investment will be used to pay tuition fees and cover the basic needs of her children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy beans and pay for labor

loans.name: Edmarie

texts.en:
Edmarie D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 44 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Edmarie has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edmarie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

Edmarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edmarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Wilson Roberto

texts.es:
Wilson Roberto Y. D., tiene 34 años.  Es soltero y vive con los padres y un  hijo,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo,  Yesenia. 

Wilson es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Wilson  se dedica a transportar a la gente de la comunidad trabaja ya por 5 años. Realiza los fletes todos los días en la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de otra unidad de transporte. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener ingresos mayores para comprar una casa. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y los caminos estan dañados.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Wilson Roberto Y. D. is 34. He's single and lives with his parents and a child (Yessenia) in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Wilson is a member of the "Y" rural community bank that is about and hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 17 members most of whom work in agriculture. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San Jose. Wilson has made a living transporting people in the community every day for the past 5 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase another transport vehicle. He feel the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have a better income to be able to buy a house. He faces challenges such as a lack of money and roads in poor conditions. He likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another transport vehicle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Esther is married and has seven children. Four of the children are below the age of 15. She works hard and strives higher for herself and the family. The inability for her to have business capital and to be with people motivated her to join GHAPE in 2009. This is the first loan she is requesting from GHAPE. 

She knows she will succeed in her farming business because she knows all the farming techniques and her farm products are in very high demand in her community. Also, she will buy Irish potatoes in bulk in her area and resell in the urban areas of Bamenda and Yaoundé, which will give her a high income.

Esther F. plans to buy farmland for 30,000FCFA and to buy ten tins of Irish potatoes for 20,000FCFA. The profit obtained from this investment will be used to pay tuition fees for her children and basic needs. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy farmland and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 and 14. Marie makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop. These goods include soap, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for about two years. The hours of her business are from 8 am to 7 pm every day.

Marie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to allow her to start investing in the sale of more foodstuffs (rice, beans, wheat, peas, cassava, sugar, etc.) With the sale of these foodstuffs, Marie will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to start saving for the future of her family as well as her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, for sale

loans.name: Bertha Piedad

texts.es:
Bertha Piedad V. G., tiene 45 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos,  Jhony y Julio. 

Bertha es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Bertha  se dedica al comercio, tiene un bar donde vende jugos. Las compras las realizan a diario en el mercado de la localidad, vende en un bar en la misma Comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio e incrementar con ropa y viveres. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para arreglar la casa y aumentar el negocio. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Bertha Piedad V. G. is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her sons in Ventanas, a town in the province of Los Ríos. She has two sons, Jhony and Julio. Bertha is a member of the "Y" communal bank, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has 17 members, mostly working in agriculture. This is their first loan through the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. Bertha is a merchant. She has a bar where she sells juice. She buys her ingredients daily at the local market. Her bar is also there. She applies for a loan to invest in her business and purchase more clothes and groceries. She believes that the loan will provide an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to have enough money to repair her house and expand her business. Lack of money is a challenge she has to face. Bertha enjoys listening to music.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and purchase more clothes and groceries

loans.name: Ten Sticks Group

texts.en: Satta N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ten Sticks. She is 60 years old, married, and has seven children between 23 and 39. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. For 20 years, she has been selling lappas in Chicken Soup Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 58,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more lappas. She describes herself as a determine woman. Her dream is to improve her business. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa S. is inset a the lower left because she was not present during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more lappas

loans.name: Olga Rebeca

texts.es:
Olga Rebeca R. P., tiene 57 años.  Es divorciada vive solo,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Rocio, Eduardo, Alberto y Jina. 

Olga es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Olga  se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de naranja, yuca, café y maiz . Las compras las realizan cada vez que sale la cosecha en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y vende sus productos en la misma localidad y en los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para incrementar la producción. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para viajar a Italia para encontrarse con sus familiares. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero.

Le gusta trabajar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Rebeca R. P. is 57 years old. She is divorced and lives alone in Ventanas, a province in Los Ríos. She has 4 children: Rocio, Eduardo, Alberto and Jina. Olga is a member of the “Y” rural bank, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total who, for the most part, work in agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking with Cooperativa San José. Olga dedicates herself to farming, such as the planting of oranges, yucca, coffee and corn. She makes her purchases at harvest time in Guayaquil and Babahoyo, and sells her products in the same cities and in neighboring areas. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, so she can increase her production. She believes the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to be able to travel to Italy to meet her relatives. She faces challenges related to lack of funds. She likes to travel, and to go on trips with the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds so she can increase her crop production.

loans.name: Osvaldo Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Osvaldo V. es cliente recurrente, vive en casa propia. El titular es fotógrafo independiente hace mas de 5 años, realiza trabajos para todo tipo de eventos , (cumpleaños, casamientos, colaciones de colegios, etc.). 
Solicito dicho préstamo para la compra de una nueva cámara digital de tal forma a realizar mejor sus trabajos.
 El titular opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2010  abonando en fecha su préstamo,  que a  la vez  le ha ayudado para su inversión y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Osvaldo V. is a repeat client who lives in his own house. He is a freelance photographer and has spent the last five years photographing all kinds of events (birthdays, weddings, graduation ceremonies etc.). He is requesting a loan to buy a new digital camera to improve his work. Señor V. has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2010, paying back his loans on time, which has helped him with his investment and improved his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new digital camera

loans.name: Djumapili

texts.en:
Djumapili is 47 years old and married with three children. Djumapili is well known for his shop where he sells a variety of goods. Djumapili has been in this business for a long time. The hours of his business are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Djumapili needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Djumapili will start selling foodstuffs such as cassava flour, rice, beans, peas, etc. With this sale of foodstuffs, Djumapili will hopefully earn a lot of money and this will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to start saving for the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as cassava flour, rice, beans, peas, etc.

loans.name: La Juquilita Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Maydet A. Ramírez originaria del pabellón en el Estado de Guerrero es la presidenta del Gpo. La  Juquilita, es una persona que trabaja vendiendo zapatos por catalogo, ella  sustenta a   su familia, pues  es madre de un niño de 2  años y 6 meses, ella esta casada y tiene la edad de 26 años su máximo sueño es incrementar su negocio, como nos comenta que  este ultimo préstamo lo invirtirá en la compra de zapatos y dice que esta agradecida con la Fundación por que la apoyo con su negocio y que le gusta mucho la forma de trabajo de la Fundación a si como su tasa de interés y su bonificación y el trato del personal, también  menciona que ojala  Fundación les siga apoyando por mucho mas tiempo para que ellos puedan sacar adelante su negocio, el nombre del grupo es debido a que tienen una creencia muy arraigada en el pueblo por la virgen de Juquila haya en el estado de Oaxaca, en este grupo hay 10 integrantes trabajadoras que luchan por Salir adelante  y todas agradecidas con fundación realidad, por su confianza que les han brindado y la comprensión.
Las integrantes son Clara M. J. que se dedica a la venta de  pollos, Evangelista Hernández M. elabora tamales, Yazmín Alicia Ríos García vende de ropa,  Yanina M. J. se dedica  a la venta de comida,  Maricruz A.  C.  venta de comida, Gloria M. C.  se dedica a la venta de  tamales, Luz Maydet A. Ramírez  venta de calzado por  catalogo, Dayna Yánez M. ella se dedica a la venta de  perfume, Ángel Yair García A.  se dedica a la albañilería y Florentino L. Rodríguez que se dedica a la venta de agua de garrafón.
Ellos están muy contentos por el crédito que se les financio para el incremento de sus ingresos y comentan que su grupo esta muy unido  trabajando  en equipo.
texts.en:
Luz Maydet A. Ramírez is a native of the state of Guerrero. She is the president of the group “La Juquilita”, and works selling shoes by catalog to support her family. She has a 2½-year old child, is married and 26 years of age. Her greatest dream is to grow her business, and she tells us that this latest loan will help finance the purchase of shoes. She is thankful to the Foundation for the support of her business. She says that she very much likes how the Foundation works, as well as her interest rate, the rewards and the personal treatment. She also mentions that, hopefully, the Foundation will continue to help support her efforts for a long time so the group can grow their businesses. The Foundation got its name due to the town’s deep-rooted religious belief in the Virgin of Juquila. There are 10 hard-working members in the group, and they are all grateful to the Foundation for its confidence and understanding. The members are: Clara M. J., who sells chickens; Evangelista Hernández M., who makes tamales, Yazmín Alicia Ríos García, who sells clothing; Yanina M. J. and Maricruz A. C., who sell food; Gloria M. C., who sells tamales; Luz Maydet A. Ramírez, who sells shoes by catalog; Dayna Yánez M., who sells perfume; Ángel Yair García A., who is a bricklayer; and Florentino L. Rodríguez, who sells bottled water. They are very glad for financing to grow their businesses, and comment that the group is united and working as a team.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for women, men and children by catalog.

loans.name: Ronald Luis

texts.es:
El sr. Ronald D. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, cuenta con un  almacén en su domicilio, es muy conocido en la zona de la ciudad de Villarrica.
Empezó hace mas de 1 año en su actividad con la ayuda de su madre la Señora Tranquilina B., la misma cuenta con un comercio en el mercado de abasto de la Ciudad de Villarrica, quien a la vez firma el crédito como la codeudor de Sr. Ronal.

Solicitó dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra al por mayor de (arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.) para su almacén.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronald D. is 24-years-old. He's single and has no children. He has a shop in his home which is very well known in the area of Villarrica. He began his business more than a year ago with the help of his mother, Mrs. Tranquilina B., who has a business in the wholesale food market in Villarrica. She also acts as co-debtor for Ronald. He's asking for this loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc. wholesale for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as rice, flour, corn, noodles, canned goods, hardware, and dairy products

loans.name: Maria Lida

texts.es:
Maria Lida A. Y., tiene 50 años.  Es casada,  vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Jesenia (26), Patricia (20), Carlos (25) y Jeny (13).
 
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maria  se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de café y maíz. Las compras las realizan cada vez que sale la cosecha en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y vende sus productos en la misma localidad y en los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para incrementar la producción. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las enfermedades de la plantación.

Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Lida A. Y. is 50 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. She has 4 children: Jesenia (26), Patricia (20), Carlos (25) and Jeny (13). Maria is a member of the “Y” rural bank, located 1½ hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, who primarily work in agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking through Cooperativa San José. Maria dedicates herself to farming, specifically the planting of coffee and corn. She makes her harvest purchases in Guayaquil and Babahoyo, and also sells her products there and in neighboring communities. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, so she can increase her production. She believes this credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own stable business, in order to improve her standard of living. The challenges she faces are lack of funds and diseases of her crops. She very much enjoys working.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Jesús Andres

texts.es:
Jesús Andres P. E., tiene 19 años.  Es soltero,  vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijo. 

Jesús es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jesús  se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa.  Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús Andres P. E. is 19 years old. He is single and lives in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has no children. Jesús is a member of the rural bank “Y”, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with the San José Cooperative. Jesús works selling clothes. He makes the purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and sells them in a locale in the house he lives in. He is asking for a loan to invest in purchasing clothes to grow his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have his own stable business to improve his quality of life. His challenges are the lack of money and the competition in the area. He likes sports and working in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in purchasing clothes to grow his business

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati K. is 32 and married with two children aged 14 and 10. In 2008, she established her poultry business. Working 6 days a week, 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, 8 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase chicks. In the future, Saraswati plans to send her children to private school. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: purchase chicks

loans.name: German Alberto

texts.es:
German Alberto E. S., tiene 46 años.  Es soltero,  vive con la madre, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1hijo, Niurka (6 años). 

German es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

German  se dedica al comercio, a la venta de banano.  Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
German Alberto E. S. is 46 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has one son, Niurka (6 years old). German is a member of the rural bank “Y”, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they have taken out with the San José Cooperative. German sells bananas. He makes the purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and he sells them in a locale in the house he lives in. He is asking for the loan to grow his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have his own stable business to increase his quailty of life. His challenges are the lack of money and the competition in the area. He likes sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow his business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old and married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old.  Beatrice is in the business of selling Irish potatoes and this is her second successful year in this business. The business hours are from 7 am to 4 pm every day.

Beatrice, after realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully to satisfy her customers, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With the use of this loan, Beatrice will increase her sales as well as profits.  With these profits, Beatrice will keep reinvesting in her business for better growth until she becomes a wholesaler to the retailers from her environmental area.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Laxmi Gautam. She is married and has no children. In 2010, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase chicks. In the future, Laxmi plans to earn her own livelihood. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: http://www.kiva.org/partners/62

loans.use: Purchase chicks

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 48 años, es viuda y vive con  el menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años tiene su tienda, ubicada en su misma casa, en donde sus hijas la apoyan en la atención, por lo que diariamente trabaja, descansando solo los domingos. Procura siempre que su tienda esté siempre abastecida con la mayor variedad de productos, ya que de eso depende de que sus clientes retornen nuevamente a comprar y eso es lo que le agrada de su trabajo. También disfruta ser independiente en sus ingresos, es por ello que se ha propuesto la meta de crecer en su negocio y tener a futuro una  tienda amplia. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad en su tienda.
texts.en:
Vilma, 48, is widowed and lives with the youngest of her three children in her own home. For the past 8 years she has had a store located in her home, where her daughters help her so that she is able to work daily, resting only on Sundays. She tries to always keep her store stocked with a wide variety of products since whether customers return again to shop depends on this. This is what she likes about her job. She also enjoys being independent in her income, which is why she has set the goal of growing her business and having a large store in the future. This is Vilma’s twelfth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always been responsible with her payments. In addition, she likes to be part of her community group because all of its members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those that will be managing the loan that she requests. It will be very helpful to the progress of her business. With the loan that she requests, she will invest in the purchase of more staples for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staples

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
Ana Beatriz G. B., tiene 67 años.  Es divorsiada,  vive sola, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Margota (43), Beatriz (40), Verónica (33) y Fernando (29). 

Ana es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ana  se dedica al comercio, a la venta de pollos.  Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños dinero para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta leer y trabajar.
texts.en:
Ana is 67 years old. She is divorced and lives alone in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has four children, Margota (43), Beatriz (40), Verónica (33) and Fernando (29). Ana is a member of the “Y” rural bank, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking with Cooperativa San José. Ana works in trade, selling chickens. She makes purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and sells her products in the these cities and in room in the house where she lives. She requests this loan in order to invest in the purchase of chickens to grow her business. She believes that this loan is an opportunity to get ahead. She dreams of money to improve her standard of living. The challenges that she faces include lack of capital and competition in the area. Ana likes to read and to work.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of poultry to grow business

loans.name: Handerson Marcelo

texts.es:
Handerson Marcelo A. E., tiene 22 años.  Es soltero,  vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tienen  hijos. 

Handerson es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Handerson  se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de café y maíz. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de café y maíz para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños dinero para incrementar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la variedad del clima las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Handerson Marcelo A. E. is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. He does not have children. Handerson is a member of the “Y” Communal Bank, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in all, and most of them are farmers. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San José. Handerson is a farmer, and he grows coffee and corn. He makes his purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo. He sells in the same town from a place in his house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. He dreams of having the money to increase his production. He faces challenges; which are the lack of money, the change of climate, pests, and illnesses. He likes to play sports and work in the field.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 31 years old and married with four children between 4 and 12 years of age. Angelique owns a small business selling shoes in the Kigali city where it is profitable because most of the people wear shoes. Angelique has 2 years of experience in her business. Angelique employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.

Angelique is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more shoes for sale. With this expansion, Angelique will be able to attract more customers, which will allow her to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline was born in 1970. She is married with two children. One of the children is 13 years old, and one is 9 years old. Jaqueline owns a business selling various products in Kigali city. She has seven years of experience in her business. Jaqueline employs one person from her community as a helper.

Jaqueline is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing large quantities so that her business satisfies everybody. The profit that Jaqueline expects to earn will allow her to save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities to products to sell

loans.name: Habinshuti

texts.en:
Habinshuti was born in 1982 and he is single. Habinshuti lives with his parents and he has to contribute to his home. Habinshuti is one of the family members who is old enough to provide some of the needs of the family. Habinshuti owns a small business selling bed sheets and other products in Kigali city. This business is well organized and profitable because he gets what he needs from this business. Habinshuti has two years of experience in his business and he employs one person from his community as a helper. The shop hours are from 7 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Habinshuti is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business. Once his business expands his monthly profit will increase, which will allow him to buy land where he will build his own house so that he can get married.

loans.use: To purchase more bed sheets and other products

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 31 years old and married with two children. One child is 6 years old and the other one is 4 years old. Anitha owns a small business selling shoes in Kigali city. Her business is profitable and known in the city. Anitha has one year of experience in her business. Her shop is open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Now, Anitha is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of shoes. This loan will help her to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of shoes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 34 years old and married with three children. The first one is 14 years old, the next is 6 years old and the last is 3 years old. Nelly is a businesswoman as is her husband. This family is serious about her daily activities. Nelly owns a small business selling shoes. Nelly employs one person from her community and the hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday. Nelly has one year of experience in her business.

Nelly is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more shoes to sell. This loan will help Nelly satisfy her customers, which is one way to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 27 years old and single. Clarisse lives with her parents, where she has some responsibilities at home. Clarisse has to contribute in her family to provide all their needs. Clarisse owns a business selling eggs. This business is profitable. Clarisse works hard and she works every day except on Saturday.

Clarisse is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing large quantities of eggs. With this loan, Clarisse will be able to earn more profit, which will allow her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Oscar Ivan

texts.es:
Oscar Ivan  E. L., tiene 32 años.  Es soltero,  vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tienen 2 hijos. 

Oscar es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de café y maíz. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de café y maíz para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños dinero para incrementar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la variedad del clima las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y criar animales.
texts.en:
Oscar Ivan E. L. is 32 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Riós province. He has two children. Oscar is a member of the “Y” Communal Bank, which is one and half hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in all, and most of them are farmers. This is their first loan with Cooprativa San José. Oscar is a farmer, and he plants coffee and corn. He makes his monthly purchases in Guayaquil and Babahoyo. He sells in the same town in a place in his house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee and corn seeds in order to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have the money to increase his production. He faces challenges; which are lack of money, the change in climate, pests, and illnesses. He likes to play sports and raise animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying supplies for preparing ice cream and paying the vendors for their work

loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
Organización y responsabilidad es lo que caracteriza a L. Alcancía "Comunal Juntos para el Éxito", ahora lo conforman 12 socios que cursan el segundo ciclo. 
L. Presidenta Mónica se dedica al rubro D. L. venta D. prendas D. vestir (reparte sobre pedidos), desD. hace tres años y seis meses, es algo que le gusta hacer, aunque elL. nos manifiesta que este año no ha tenido muchas ventas en comparación con el año pasado pero eso no L. desanima ya que siempre busca las circunstancias para poder ofrecer sus productos, ya piensa en el bienestar D. sus hijos, se inicio en este negocio ya que tuvo L. oportunidad D. juntar unos ahorros gracias al trabajo D. vendedora al cual se dedicaba anteriormente. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado comprar un televisor y un equipo D. sonido, su gran sueño es tener una tienda propia.
El reciente préstamo será destinado para L. compra D. mercadería. Los socios están conformes con el crédito y desean continuar trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.
texts.en:
Organization and responsibility are what characterize the “Juntos para el Éxito” (Together for Success) communal bank which has 12 members currently in its second cycle. Group president, Mónica, sells clothing based on prior orders. She has been in this line of work for three and a half years. This is something she enjoys doing although she tells us that this year sales have been less compared to last year. However, this doesn’t discourage her because she always looks for sales opportunities for her products because she’s always thinking of her children’s wellbeing. She started out in this business when she had the opportunity to save a bit of money from her previous sales job. With her daily effort she has managed to purchase a television set and a sound system. Her great dream is to own her own house. The current loan will be used to buy stock merchandise. The group members are satisfied with the loan and wish to continue to collaborate with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 56 años, vive con  su hija en su casa propia. Vende comida desde hace 4 años, desde entonces cocina todas las mañanas en su casa y  los lleva al centro educativo que queda cerca de su casa, en donde los profesores y alumnos son los que consumen su deliciosa sazón. Es así que se genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hija. Siempre disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar, además que le ayuda cubrir los gastos educativos de su hija, que ya es universitaria. Afirma que este negocio es rentable y siempre esta dispuesta a continuar trabajando, en adelante desea tener un restaurante grande. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz por sacos, menestras, azúcar y fideos.
texts.en:
Esther is 56 and lives with her daughter in her own home. She's been selling food for the past 4 years. Every morning since then she cooks at home and then takes it to a nearby school where teachers and students enjoy her delicious food. This is how she makes a living to support her daughter. She enjoys her work because she likes to cook and because it helps pay for her daughter's university education. She says the business is profitable and she is willing to keep working, hoping to have a large restaurant in the future. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She has always been punctual with her payments and is happy to be a part of the community group since all the other members are responsible and supportive. She is thankful to all those people who will help with the loan since it will be very useful for her business. She will use the loan to buy basic ingredients for her food such as: rice in bulk, vegetable stew sugar and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his truck.

loans.name: Dolores Alexandra

texts.es:
Dolores de 33 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una tienda de víveres llamada "3 hermanos" en donde vende legumbres, enlatados, canes etc. 

Ella tiene la tienda desde que se separo de su esposo para poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando verduras y vegetales. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para mantener a sus dos hijos de 1 y 9 años, vendiendo toda clase de víveres. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, lácteos. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 33, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a mountainous periuban area with dirt roads and hills). She has a grocery store called “3 Hermanos” (3 Siblings) where she sells vegetables, canned goods, and meats, etc. She has had the store since she separated from her husband. She did this to be able to have her own income. She started buying greens and vegetables. From that time on she continues working to support her two children, a one year old and a nine year old. She sells all kinds of groceries. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to be able to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and dairy products. In the future she wants to expand her store and stock it more. She wants to do so in order to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, and dairy products

loans.name: Denise Delhia

texts.fr: C. Denise Delhia est née le 09 Octobre 1961 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NADOHOU Steeve, Denise Delhia est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Denise Delhia s'est installée depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Agla à Cotonou, où elle réside avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Denise Delhia a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis cinq ans, Denise Delhia vend divers produits (sucre, lait, piles, papier hygiénique, vinaigre, charbon de bois, etc.) et de façon secondaire, Denise Delhia vend des vêtements dans sa boutique. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé, pays voisin du Bénin, que Denise Delhia achète ses produits. Denise Delhia est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, Denise Delhia souhaite agrandir son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients ; raison pour laquelle Denise Delhia sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Denise Delhia C. was born 9 October 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Steeve Nadohou, Denise Delhi is mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. She settled some 20 years ago in the Agla borough of Cotonou, where she resides with her husband and children. The couple share family expenses. Denise Delhia interrupted her schooling at secondary level. For the past five years she has retailed various products (sugar, milk, batteries, toilet paper, vinegar, charcoal, etc.), and as a side business, she sells clothing in her shop. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and from Lomé in a country neighboring Benin. Denise Delhia is a regular ALIDé client, having been granted two previous loans, both reimbursed in full. Facing increasing customer demand, she wishes to expand her activity and improve customer satisfaction, which is why she is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 3 cartons of sugar, milk, batteries and clothing

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: M. Odette est née le 15 Mai 1981 à Adja au Mono. Mariée à SIDI Basile, un militaire, Odette est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Odette vit depuis trois ans avec son mari et ses enfants à Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Odette vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges familiales. N'ayant jamais fréquenté l'école, Odette mène comme activité la vente de maïs en gros et en détail à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Odette s'approvisionne à Adja au Mono. C'est la deuxième fois que Odette sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle. Odette a bien effectué le remboursement du premier prêt. Plus tard, Odette désire ouvrir une baraque et y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Odette M. was born 15 May 1981 in Adja, Mono (a region of Benin). Married to Basile Sidi, a serviceman, she is the mother of two children, both in school. Odette has been living for the past three years in Cocotomey, part of the Abomey Calavi municipality. She assists her husband in sharing family expenses. Having never attended school, Odette’s commercial activity is selling corn (wholesale and retail) from her home and through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Adja in Mono. This is the second time Odette has approached ALIDé for financial support, to strengthen her activity and better respond to increasing customer demand. She fully reimbursed the first loan. At some point Odette wants to open a stall to sell her products.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 bags of corn

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción” actualmente se encuentra en el XVI ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa de la socia Benedicta que está ubicado en la comunidad de Compone, Anta. La comunidad de Componte se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedica  a la agricultura y la ganadería.

Benedicta, tiene 35 años y tiene dos hijos, ella nació y vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Izcuchaca provincia de Anta. Hace dos años atrás, Benedicta abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en su domicilio, donde vendía comestibles a sus vecinos. También vendía maíz, papa, chicha de jora, yogurt y queso y lL. sus productos a vender a la ciudad del Cusco.
 
Ahora, Benedicta cambio de negocio y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Utilizo el pequeño capital que tenía para capacitarse en la crianza de animales, para construir un pequeño galpón y empezó a criar 7 cuyes. En la actualidad tiene 15 cuyes y le estan capacitando los especialistas de la municipalidad de Anta. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Benedicta espera recibir S/. 1000 soles. Por el momento, su galpón esta modestamente de implementado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero para sembrar pasto en su chacra que esta a lado de su domicilio: El pasto es un buen alimento para los cuyes. El sueño de la socia es convertirse en una empresaria en el comercio de venta y crianza de animales de menores. 
 
Benedicta es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal y la escogieron como la presidenta porque es una persona puntual y responsable. Ya son tres veces que está en el cargo y le va muy bien gracias al carisma y buena voluntad que tiene.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) Communal Bank is currently in its 16th cycle. It is comprised of hard-working and enterprising people who always look for opportunities to get ahead. With their daily effort they are looking to give their children a better future. The communal bank’s meetings are every 30 days. They meet in Benedicta’s house. She is a member, and her house is located in the Compone community in Anta. The Componte community is 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and with livestock. Benedicta is 35 years old, and she has two children. She was born in and lives in the Compone community in the Izcuchca district, Anta province. Two years ago Benedicta opened a grocery store in her home, and she sold food to her neighbors. She also sold corn, potatoes, “chicha de jora” (a traditional beverage of the area that is made of corn), yogurt, and cheese. She took her products to the city of Cusco to sell. Now Benedicta has changed businesses. She raises small animals like guinea pigs. She used the small amount of capital that she had to prepare to raise animals and to build a small shed. She started raising seven guinea pigs. She currently has 15 guinea pigs. The specialists in the Anta municipality are training her. The next loan that Benedicta hopes to receive is for 1,000 soles. At the present time the shed is modestly set up with the basic necessities. She would like to use the money to plant grass on her farm, which is at the side of her house. Grass is good food for the guinea pigs. Benedicta’s dream is to become an entrepreneur in the business of raising and selling small animals. Benedicta is a founding member of the communal bank. They chose her to be the president because she is a punctual and responsible person. She has had this position three times. It is going very well thanks to the charisma and good will that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant grass on her farm

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su madre y sus hermanos. Desde hace 3 años decidió  emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, en un inicio fue en un local que arrendó en una calle comercial de su ciudad, tuvo su primer negocio, pero fue victima de robo, ante esto le motivaron a establecer su negocio en casa de sus  padres. Desde entonces atiende en su establecimiento, dando el servicio de  llamadas a celular con un maquina que calcula el tiempo y la tarifa que se utilizó en ese tiempo de llamada. Por otro lado su negocio lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y algunos artículos de bazar como regalos y detalles para el arreglo personal, de esta manera su negocio este más surtido y atractivo para su clientela. Afirma que le gusta trabajar de manera independiente porque puede disponer de su  dinero y es por esta razón que esta planeando  adquirir mejores equipos pasa su negocio. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de un maquina más actual y electrónica que le permitirá tener un control más exacto en el costo de las llamadas que realicen sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pilar, 24, lives in her parents’ house with her mother and siblings. Three years ago she decided to start her own business to generate her own income. At the beginning, she rented a space in one of the city’s commercial streets. She had her first business there but was robbed. This motivated her to move her business to her parents’ house. Since then, she has tended to her business there. Her business consists in offering cell phone calls using a machine that calculates call duration and charges. In addition, she also sells snacks and some general merchandise like gift items and items of personal adornment. This makes her business better stocked and more attractive to her customers. She states that she enjoys working independently because she can dispose of her income. She is planning, therefore, to acquire better equipment for her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support. In addition, she enjoys team work because all her fellow group members are responsible and unified people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan which will be very useful to her business. She will use the requested funds to buy a more up-to-date, electronic machine that will allow her to have better control over the costs of calls placed by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new machine in order to have improved ability to calculate customer call charges.

loans.name: Rolando Francisco

texts.es:
Rolando de 43 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene un puesto de venta de pollos en un mercado de Fortín. 

Empezó hace 15 años en (1995) en un pueblo llamado “Balzar” (habitan agricultores), el compraba los pollos y se encargaba de matarlos y pelarlos, los vendía  en el pueblo, pero como quería mas ingresos decidió vivir en Guayaquil y comenzar con su negocio en un mercado, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio puesto y ahora vende pollos por libra, se levanta a las 05h00am a faenar los pollos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar gavetas, pollos, un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando is 43 years old and lives in the Fortín neighborhood of Guayaquil. It is on the hilly outskirts of the city and has dirt roads. He has a stand in the Fortín market where he sells chickens. He started this business 15 years ago in a rural town called Balzar. He would buy chickens and slaughter and pluck them before selling them around town. However, he decided that he wanted to earn more profits, so he moved to Guayaquil and began his business in the market. Little by little through his hard work he was able to buy his own stand and now he sells chicken by the pound. He wakes up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare the chickens. With the loan he will purchase drawers for his stand, chickens, and a freezer. In the future he hopes to have his own store and make improvements on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drawers, chickens, and a freezer

loans.name: Sika Opportune Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Sika Opportune Clarisse est née le 09 Août 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Opportune Clarisse est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui sont tous à sa charge. Opportune Clarisse n'est plus avec son mari. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Opportune Clarisse vit à Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Opportune Clarisse vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Opportune Clarisse n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses charges, Opportune Clarisse est gérante d'une cabine téléphonique, où elle vend en plus, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Opportune Clarisse s'approvisionne dans une maison GSM à Cococodji. Opportune Clarisse exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. C'est la deuxième fois que Opportune Clarisse sollicite auprès de ALIDé un appui financier, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et d'accroître son revenu. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Sika Opportune Clarisse A. was born August 9, 1976 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is the mother of two children in her care, and both in school. She is no longer with her husband. For the past twenty years or so, Opportune Clarisse has been living in Cocotomey, in the commune of Abomey Calavi. She lives with her children and provides for their needs. Opportune Clarisse only attended primary school. To meet her expenses, she runs a telephone booth and sells mobile phone recharge cards. She gets her stocks at a GSM branch in Cococodji. Opportune Clarisse has been carrying on this activity for five years. She is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time to boost her activity and increase her income. The first loan was repaid without incident.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración de bellos bordados en su misma casa, que junto a su hija la ayuda en esta tarea. Juntas producen bellos y coloridas prendas de vestir que luego son ofrecidas a los clientes. Con el paso del tiempo se ha vuelto una persona reconocida en  la producción  de bordados, quien ahora tiene clientes que proviene de diversos sitios que la buscan para comprarle su mercadería. Considera que esto es un gran logro además de que este trabajo tiene una buena recompensa. Adicionalmente a esta actividad los fines de semana vende zapatos recompuestos a precio de segunda mano y esto también le genera las ganancias. Ante esto desea mejorar su producción de bordados para tener mayor capital y  una tienda de zapatos y prendas típicas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, invertirá en la compra de materiales para sus bordados como tela pana e hilos de diversos colores y calidades.
texts.en:
Placida is 44 and lives with her husband and daughter in their own home. For the past 15 years she has made beautiful embroideries from home with her daughter's help. Together the produce beautiful and colorful dress clothing that is then offered to customers. Over the years she has become well known as an embroiderer and is sought by buyers from various places. She feels this is a great achievement aside from the fact that the work is lucrative. Additionally, she sells repaired second hand shoes on weekends which also generates income. She hopes to increase her embroidery production and have greater working capital, as well as a shoe and typical clothing store. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to know she has financial backing. She is also happy to be a part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. She's thankful to all the people helping with the loan since it will be helpful to the business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of embroidery material such as corduroy, and thread in various color and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for embroideries

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 44 years old and married with eight children who are between 7 and 24 years old. Of her older children, one is a money collector on a bus and another is a tailor. She is unable to afford school fees for her children who are of school age.  Her husband works for a church and earns a small income.   In addition to her children, Asia supports orphans and elderly people in her family.  

Asia has a hair salon where she cuts and styles hair.  She plans to use the loan to start a shop that sells milk, soft drinks and snacks. With the profits she hopes to buy a sewing machine to support her child who is a tailor.  

Asia attributes the success of her business to the fact that she is social and hardworking, which her clients appreciate. Eventually, she hopes to make enough money to have a small cattle and chicken farm.

loans.use: To start a shop that sells milk, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Mahutin Gilles

texts.fr: A. Mahutin Gilles est né le 21 Juillet 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gilles vit depuis une trentaine d'année à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Gilles est marié à YEHOSSOU  Armelle, une commerçante. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gilles vit ensemble avec sa famille à Lokokoukoumè. Gilles a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir aux différents besoins de ses enfants et faire face à ses charges, Gilles vend des racines et plantes médicinales dans sa boutique. Gilles  s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Gilles exerce cette activité depuis seize ans et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'il a bien remboursés. Gilles désire agrandir plus son activité et mieux répondre aux différentes exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Gilles sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Mahutin Gilles A. was born on 21st July 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gilles has lived for around thirty years in Lokokoukoumè, in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. He is married to Armelle Yehossou, a trader. The couple has four children who are all at school. Gilles lives with his family in Lokokoukoumè. He left school at secondary level. In order to provide for the various needs of his children and to cover his expenses, Gilles sells medicinal roots and plants in his shop. He gets his supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. He has been carrying out this activity for the past sixteen years and has already had two loans from ALIDé, both of which he repaid in full. Gilles would like to expand his business and respond better to the various demands of his customers; for this reason he is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal leaves, plants and bark

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old and pregnant with her first child.  She and her husband have a stand in the local market and a shop in their neighborhood, both of which carry general household items such as salt, sugar, and matches as well as a variety of flours, including millet and maize. Their clients appreciate this variety of products which Marie and her husband are able to acquire more cheaply when purchased in quantity, allowing them to earn profits in both of their two locations.
