Marie is requesting this loan to increase the number of items she sells, including different flours and charcoal.  Eventually she hopes to buy land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her store

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en:
Marie Claudine is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is four years old and attending school, while the other is only 6 months old. She and her husband, a veterinarian, both work hard to improve their family's standard of living.

Marie Claudine sells fertilizers for a variety of plants including wheat, carrots, and some fruits. She has been in this business for over five years and plans to use this loan to expand the types of fertilizers she carries, including fertilizers for cabbage. She also plans to buy seeds and insecticides to sell to local farmers. The seeds Marie Claudine will purchase are sealed in tin cans and last for a long time. With the profits she hopes to purchase a cow to ensure a constant supply of milk for her family, and eventually she anticipates buying a house so she no longer has to rent.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides to sell

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence has a boutique where she sells cosmetics and general household items such as candy, matches, and biscuits. She also has a small bar located on the side of the boutique where she serves drinks. Gaudence believes her business is successful because she sells a variety of items and her shop is the only one of its kind in the area. Her aspiration is to expand her shop to six times its current size after another year of operation. With the profits from her enterprise, Gaudence eventually hopes to open a restaurant.

Gaudence is a 28-year-old mother of an eight-month-old child. Her husband works in a bank.

loans.use: To purchase items for her general store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijas en casa de su hija mayor. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a vender quesos y demás productos alimenticios como trucha y  maíz seco a las diferentes zonas urbanas de la ciudad donde radica. Lleva sus productos en baldes bien hermético que le ayudan a mantener en buen estado sus productos, en cuanto al queso, para abastecerse de este producto ella misma los prepara cuando va de viaje a su pueblo natal en donde consigue leche de vaca y por el lapso de 3 días vuelve a su rutina de siempre. Le agrada ejercer este negocio porque considera que su trabajo es mejor compensado cuando vende directamente sus quesos, es por eso que esta pensando a futuro industrializar su forma de fabricar quesos. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará quesos ya preparados para que pueda incrementar a su propia producción y cubrir con mayor éxito los pedidos que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, lives with her life partner and two daughters in her oldest daughter’s house. For the last 8 years she has sold cheeses and other food items like trout and dry corn in various urban areas of the city where she lives. She transports her items in hermetically sealed tubs that help her keep her products in good condition. With respect to the cheeses, to stock up on them she herself makes them when she goes to her native city to get the cow’s milk and after three days returns to her usual routine. She enjoys this business because she considers her work to be well compensated when she sells the cheeses directly. For this reason, she is thinking of a way to industrialize her cheese production in the future. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and cooperative people. She is grateful to all the people that will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy already prepared cheeses to augment her own production so that she can better fill pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses.

loans.name: Unidas Por Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SARA TIENE 34 AÑOS D. EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS MENORES. HACE CUATRO MESES ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "UNIDAS POR UN FUTURO", ÉSTE GRUPO TIENE 11 INTEGRANTES, LA MAYORÍA D. ELLOS VIVE EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS UBICADO AL NORTE D. LIMA. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.

LA SRA. SARA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ANTICUCHOS, TODAS LAS NOCHES UBICA SUS MESITAS Y PARRILA EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILI0. INICIÓ VENDIENDO TAMALES, ARROZ CON LECHE Y MAZAMORRA, LA GANANCIA QUE TENÍA LO JUNTÓ PARA PODER ADQUIRIR UNA PEQUEÑA PARRILLA CON LA CUAL INICIA SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ANTICUCHOS. 
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN GASTOS ESCOLARES COMO LOS ÚTILES Y PAGO DEL COLEGIO.

ELLA TRABAJA CON LA META D. AHORRAR PARA LOS GASTOS UNIVERSITARIOS D. SUS HIJOS EN UN FUTURO CUANDO ELLOS TERMINEN EL COLEGIO.

EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS, INGREDIENTES, UTENSILIOS Y DESCARTABLES PARA IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ANTOCUCHOS.
texts.en:
Sara, 34, is married and has three minor children. She has been a member of the "UNIDAS POR UN FUTURO" (United for a Future) group for the past 4 months. The group has 11 members most of whom live in the Comas district north of Lima. Her fellow group members elected her president of the group’s governing board. Sara sells anticuchos (skewered, grilled beef heart) nightly. She sets up her grill and tables in her front yard. She started out selling tamales, rice pudding and bread pudding. With profits from this she bought a small grill with which she started her anticucho sales. Her work has maD. it possible for her to pay for her children’s school expenses like tuition and school supplies. She works with the goal in mind to save up for her children’s future university costs once they finish high school. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients, supplies and disposable utensils to set up her anticucho sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inredients and supplies for her Anticucho sales business.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is 25 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. She owns a retail store where she sells household items. She prides herself on having an accurate scale for weighing products. With her business profits, Marceline has been able to afford healthcare for herself. She is taking out a loan to buy more household items for her store. Eventually, she hopes to be able to buy larger quantities of goods and become a wholesale store, selling to local retail shops.

loans.use: To buy household items for her store

loans.name: Dianne

texts.en:
Dianne is 28 years old, married, and has two children, aged 4 and 6, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a businessman and they are able to afford health insurance for the entire family.
Dianne sells used clothing in the local market and has been in this business for the past ten years. Her business has become well known for selling high quality clothing for children and women. Dianne sells at lower prices than the other clothing sellers in the market. With her loan she hopes to increase her inventory of children's and women’s clothing. Eventually, she hopes to attract customers from Kigali, the capital city, to her store.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothes

loans.name: Anique Claudine

texts.fr: SALAKO Anique Claudine est née le 19 Novembre 1958 à Parakou dans le Nord du Bénin. Claudine vit au quartier K. à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trente ans. Claudine est mariée à HOUNGUE Dominique et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, et dont un est à sa charge. Claudine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales. Claudine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Claudine vend  du charbon de bois et des bois de chauffage à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Claudine vend également des sous-vêtements et de la glace. Claudine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Claudine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Claudine désire développer davantage son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour ce faire que Claudine sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Anique Claudine Salako was born 19 November 1958 in Parakou in the North of Benin. She has been living in the K. borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past 30 years. Claudine is married to Dominique Houngue, and is the mother of four children, all having attended school, and of whom one is still under her care. She assists her husband in taking care of family expenses. Claudine has attended very little school. To meet her needs, she sells charcoal and firewood from her home. As a side business, she also sells underwear and ice. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and also from Lomé in nearby Togo. Claudine is a regular ALIDé client, having already been granted five loans, all of which were fully reimbursed. She wants to expand her business in response to customer demand, which is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood, charcoal and underwear

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 26 years old and married, but does not yet have children. He has been selling used clothing in a market for the past seven years. He has been successful because he works hard and the clothes he sells are very different from those offered by his competitors. From the success of his business he has been able to buy health insurance for himself and his wife.
With this loan, Aimable hopes to increase his inventory of clothing. Eventually, he hopes to have a wholesale store and sell to local retailers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Pablina cuenta con 39  años está casada con el señor  Maximino Benitez, poseen  tres hijos una nena en edad escolar y dos varones cursando el secundario.
La señora era vendedora de calzados en una tienda durante muchos años, su marido fue chófer de colectivos, la señora tuvo la idea de abrir su propio negocio con la ayuda de pequeños préstamos consiguió dedicarse a la venta de calzados, actualmente alquila tres salones comerciales con 4 empleados, cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes.
Le gustaría más adelante comprar para su propio local ya que  le va muy bien en las ventas y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad ya que ellos no pudieron por tener que trabajar desde jóvenes dedicarse al engorde de ganado.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de zapatos, zapatillas, calzados deportivos, y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Pablina is 39 years old and married to Sr. Maximino Benitez. They have three children, an infant daughter in nursery school and two sons in secondary school. Pablina has sold shoes from her own store for many years. Her husband was a union taxi driver. She came up with the idea of opening her own business and sought the help of small loans in order to continue selling shoes. She currently rents three commercial locations. Pablina has four employees and several good customers. She would like to get ahead by acquiring her own location. Her sales are doing very well. Pablina has also been raising livestock for fattening since her children were little so that they do not have to find work when they attend university. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, slippers, athletic footwear, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, slippers, athletic footwear, and other products

loans.name: Manos Confeccionistas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MANOS CONFECCIONISTAS
EL GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR LA SEÑORA TELMA ILEANA P. B., QUIEN ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO .  SU NEGOCIO ES LA CONFECCON DE BLUSAS DE TELA EN DIFERENTES COLORES .  SU MERCADO ES VARIADO Y CUENTA CON LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSO.  TAMBIEN LA SEÑORA VICENTA GERTRUDIS C. CANEL  ES COMPAÑERA DEL GRUPO VENDIENDO UNICAMENTE BLUSAS DE TELA DE MANERA AMBULANTE.  SARA ELIZABETH C. C.  TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS DE TELA. ELLAS  TIENEN MUCHOS SUEÑOS Y METAS Y DECEAN LOGRARLOS CON LA AYUDA DE DIOS Y  A TRAVEZ DE  PODER INVERTIR BIEN EN SUS NEGOCIOS EL PRESTAMO QUE ESTAN SOLICITANDO YA QUE  ELLAS MENCIONAN QUE AUNQUE TENGAN MUCHOS PLANES SI NO TIENEN EL CAPITAL SUFICIENTE NO PUEDE HACER MAYOR COSA, ELLAS ESTAN MUY CONTENTAS DE TENER LA OPORTUNIDAD DE QUE  KIVA LES APOYE ATRAVEZ DE FAPE.
texts.en:
Sewing Hands Solidarity Group

This group was formed by Sra. Telma Ileana P. B., who is the group representative. Her business involves producing blouses out of fabric in various colors. She has an assortment of inventory and receives help from her husband.

Sra. Vicenta Gertrudis C. Canel is a fellow group member who sells only blouses made of fabric as a street vendor. Sara Elizabeth C. C. also makes blouses out of fabric. They have many dreams and goals that they hope to achieve with the help of God. With the loan they are requesting, they plan to invest well in their businesses. Unless they have sufficient capital, they are not able to do anything. They are glad to have this opportunity to receive Kiva support through FAPE.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for their businesses

location.town: Cantón San Francisco, Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Ped

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal posee 63 años esta casado con la señora Maria del Carmen Gaona que es jubilada, cuentan con tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
El señor fue sastre durante mucho tiempo, con los ahorros de el y el sueldo de su señora decidieron comprar su primer vehículo, actualmente cuenta con 6 transporte escolar con una buena cantidad de clientes, sus hijos también se dedican a lo mismo. 
Le gustaría más adelante dedicarse al engorde de ganado. 
Solicitó el prestamo para el pago por mantenimiento de vehículo.
texts.en:
Sr. Anibal is 63 years old and married to Sra. Maria del Carmen Gaona, who is retired. They have three adult children.

Anibal worked as a tailor of a long time, but he then bought his first vehicle using his savings and his wife’s salary. He currently owns six school buses and has a large number of customers. His children help with running the business.

Anibal would also like to have livestock for fattening in order to get ahead. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Acquire more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing & accessories

loans.name: Ana Dalinda

texts.es:
Ana de 56 años, , vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Comenzó hace 6 años con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa ya que hay un colegio cerca de donde vive. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere triplicar su mercadería y que su hija de 17 años termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Ana is 56 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and hills). She has a stationery shop in her home where she sells beverages, paper, and notebooks. In Ecuador, this type of business would be called a bazaar.

She started her business six years ago in order to support her family. Ana began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she had enough money to set up a small store, she remodeled her house and placed her business in the front part of her home since there is a high school near where she lives. She works from 7:30am to 8pm every day.

With his loan Ana plans to buy notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets for her business. In the future, she hopes to triple her inventory and see her 17 year old daughter successfully finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets

loans.name: Maria  Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa Y. tiene 36 años vive con su cónyuge en el municipio de Malambo en el departamento del Atlántico y con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 16 años de edad. Desde allí se dedica a la venta de pescado y a la comercialización de mercancía variada, que son sus dos actividades y principales generadoras de ingresos. 
María Teresa es una mujer muy organizada, comenzó su actividad  de vender pescado, hace 16 años junto a su cónyuge, ella salía a vender en la calle y a los empleados de un parque industrial llamado PINZA, ubicado en esta población; en ese momento  transportaba el pescado en cajas de icopor, sus principales clientes eran sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, y utilizaba el enfriador de su suegra; pero gradualmente la familia fue creciendo y llenándose de otras necesidades. Así fuè como cuando le hablaron de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, buscó el beneficio del crédito de esta organización el año 2004 por un valor de $900.000 COP, allí logró darle un impulso a su actividad y luego mediante otro crédito recibió $1,300.000 COP y así mismo el tercero por valor de  $1.500.000. COP, y finalmente otro por valor de $1.500.000 COP; todos los invirtió con disciplina en su negocio, logrando ahorrar de sus utilidades y comprar un lote y sobre esta base solicitó un nuevo crédito simultaneo de mejoramiento de vivienda, con lo que construyó su casa y el que ya canceló totalmente.
Este es su sexto crédito y con él comprará un enfriador para guardar sus pescados y no pasar trabajo con su refrigeración y además para conservarlos; con el resto de dinero comprará mercancía que tiene encargada  y una canoa porque María Teresa pertenece a una familia de pescadores, su cónyuge participa en la pre cooperativa  de pescadores Nuevo Amanecer y pesca en la laguna que está ubicada al lado de las empresas de Malambo. Ellos tenían una canoa que se rompió y necesitan otra, porque en la actualidad compran el pescado a otros pescadores y les sale a un mayor precio.
Desde que participa en los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha podido tener un capital para seguir negociando, ha mejorado sus condiciones habitacionales y sueña con terminar de hacer todas las adecuaciones que requiere una saludable convivencia familiar, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es el invierno, que no la deja salir  por efecto de los arroyos y se le disminuyen las ventas, por eso su negocio simultáneo es la venta de mercancía variada porque encontró su nicho de mercado en los mismos clientes que le compran pescado.
texts.en:
María Teresa Y. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the town of Malambo in the Department of Atlántico. They have four children between the ages of 8 and 16. María has two businesses, one selling fish and the other selling general merchandise. Both of these activities are her main sources of income.

María Teresa is a very organized woman. She began selling fish with her husband when she was 16 years old. María worked as a street merchant, selling to employees who worked at an industrial park called PINZA that was located in her town. At the time, she transported the fish in polystyrene coolers. Her main customers were neighbors, relatives, and friends. She even resorted to borrowing her mother-in-law’s refrigerator. As her family slowly grew, so did the number of other needs that she had to fulfill. It was around that time that she talked with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo about applying for a loan. In 2004, she received a loan from the organization in the amount of 900,000 COP which she used to boost her business. Later she received another loan for 1,300,000 COP, and then a third loan for 1,500,000 COP, and finally an additional loan that was also worth 1,500,000 COP. All of the funds were invested into her business with great discipline. Using the earning she had saved, she was able to buy a plot of land and became eligible to apply for a new loan which she used to build her house. Her housing loan has since been repaid completely.

This is her sixth loan. She will buy a refrigerator where she can store her fish when she is not working. With the rest of the money, she will pay for merchandise that she has ordered and purchase a canoe since she belongs to a family of fishermen. Her husband is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer fishing cooperative and fishes in the lagoon in Malambo, which is near where many businesses are located. They have a canoe that is in disrepair, so they need another one. At the moment, María buys her fish from other fishermen and then sells it at a higher price.

Since participating in the programs offered by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, María has been able to build up enough capital to continue her business and make improvements to her living conditions. She dreams of finishing all of the adjustments she has to make for her family to live a healthy life and for her children to have a secure future. Her greatest challenge occurs in winter when her fish sales decline because she does not go out to sell. With her other business, she is able to sell different merchandise to the same customers who buy fish from her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for storing fish, a fishing canoe for her husband, and merchandise for her second business

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio P. R. de 35 años de edad, reside en el Cantón San Diego, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, este cantón esta ubicado en una de las playas más famosas del país, lugar el cual cuenta con muchos turistas tanto nacionales como internacional. En este lugar esta ubicado el negocio de José, el cual es una tienda en la que comercializan diferentes tipos de productos comestibles y agua embotellada, así mismo su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, elaborando pupusas y tortillas, las cuales se venden muy bien. José desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, sobretodo contar con mayor cantidad de productos en su tienda, ya que las vacaciones de agosto están muy cerca y esta es una de las temporadas más importantes del año en las cuales la afluencia de personas crece, el ganar más para estas vacaciones le permitirá surtir su negocio mucho más. A pesar que no poseen hijos, ellos como pareja desean contar con una vida mejor y mucho más estable en la cual puedan vivir con toda tranquilidad confiados que cuentan con un negocio estable, el cual les provee de todo lo necesario, es por esta razón que José solicita un préstamo a Integral y llevar a cabo todo lo mencionado para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
José Antonio P. R. is 35 years old and resides in Cantón San Diego, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. This canton has one of the most famous beaches in the country where many domestic and international tourists visit. José has a store on the beach where he sells different types of food products and bottles of water. His wife helps with running the business by making pupusas and tortillas that sell very well. José wants to improve his business by acquiring more products for his store. The August vacation season is approaching and it is an important time of the year when the number of people visiting the area increases. In order to earn as much as he can during this time, José wants to restock his business.

Despite not having children, José and his wife want to have a better conditions and more stability so that they can live peacefully and have a steady business that provides them everything they need. For this reason, José is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can make the necessary improvements to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

location.town: Cantón San Diego, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage.

Madame Nogaye D. à debout à gauche de la photo, de thioup noir mauve vêtue et emmitouflée d'écharpe est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Elle achète des gousses d'arachide, les décortique avant de procéder à la transformation. Elle vend son produit dans les marchés et à domicile.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide pour poursuivre son activité de transformation d'huile.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Sope Naby solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the « Banc Villageois » loan group was dissolved. It is made up of 11 women from the same village, who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Nogaye D., the group responsible, can be seen on the left of the picture, wearing a black and purple thioup and wrapped in a scarf. She is married and the mother of five children. She processes and sells peanut oil. She buys unshelled peanuts, and has them unshelled before processing. She sells her product in local markets and does home delivery. She will use her loan to buy peanuts and continue her oil-processing business. Her objective is to assist her husband in handling the various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy peanuts

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos Mauricio P. Z. de 52 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, el cual se dedica a la elaboración de desayunos, almuerzos, pupusas, tortillas, así como también a la venta de jugos, batidos de frutas y sodas. Carlos reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 13 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El negocio esta ubicado en Antiguo Cuscatlán, cerca de La Universidad José Simeón Cañas, lo cual es un enorme beneficio para él ya que la mayoría de estudiantes, prefieren este tipo de negocios, ya que brindan los alimentos a menor precio, así mismo Carlos cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales son empleados de diferentes oficinas las cuales se encuentran alrededor de su negocio,  a pesar que él cuenta con una gran competencia, el trata de elaborar lo mejor posible su trabajo para poder contar siempre con sus clientes frecuentes y así mismo que estos lo recomienden con otras personas, Carlos es un hombre muy responsable, amable y dedicado a su trabajo. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda cotar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de más comida y de esta forma ampliar su menú, y así mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y con un gran deseo de seguir consumiendo los productos de Carlos, lo cual es de mucha importancia para él y su familia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen.
texts.en:
Carlos Mauricio P. Z., 52, is a hardworking man whose business is making breakfasts, lunches, pupusas (typical Central American food-cornmeal filled with cheese, or pork or beans) tortillas, and he also sells juices, fruit shakes and sodas. Carlos lives in Antiguo Cuscatlán with his wife, their three children: 12, 13 and 7 - all students. The business is located in Antiguo Cuscatlán near the José Simeón Cañas University. The location is a great benefit because the majority of students like this type of business since food is offered at a lower price. Also Carlos has many customers who are workers in different offices that are found nearby. Despite the fact that there is a lot of competition, he tries to make the best possible food so that he can always count on regular customers and that they will recommend him to others. Carlos is a very responsible and friendly man who is dedicated to his work. He is asking for the loan to have money to be able to buy a greater quantity of the necessary ingredients so that he can make more food, broaden his menu, and thus keep his customers satisfied and continue eating what he sells. This is very important to him and to his family since the business is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients to prepare food

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Khassama Aïdara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KHASSAMA AÏDARA est créé en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois de TOUB. SERAS. Il est composé de 12 femmes du même village qui se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage.

Madame NDEYE F., la femme dont le visage est mis en médaillon en haut à gauche de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants et a la charge de ses deux petits enfants. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle a acquière une bonne expérience de cette activité.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 05 moutons. Elle les embouchera pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Elle compte également renforcer son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
The Khamassa Aïdara solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the TouB. Seras « Banc Villageois » loan group was dissolved. It consists of 12 women from the same village who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Ndeye F. is responsible for the group: her face is shown in a medallion in the upper left of the picture. She is 54 years old, married, the mother of eight children, and has her two grand-children under her care. She has been fattening sheep for the past five years, and has acquired a solid experience in this activity. Her new loan will enable her to buy five sheep. She will fatten them for at least five months before reselling them at local markets in her area. She assists her husband in taking care of family expenses. She also intends to strengthen her level of savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Beatriz Yolanda

texts.es: Beatriz Yolanda L. C. de 41 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Aguilares, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde se dedica a la venta de jeans para hombres y mujeres, ropa para niños, sandalias, y así mismo cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos perecederos. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y así mismo junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar día con día. Beatriz es una persona muy trabajadora, quien desea poder contar con todo lo necesario para ver feliz a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias de Aguilares, así mismo atiende su pequeña tienda, al mismo tiempo que se dedica a sus hijos. Beatriz solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más en la tienda, comprando todo lo necesario para convertirla en un negocio bastante fuerte en el cual pueda realizar una mayor cantidad de ventas y así mismo competir con los otros negocios que están a su alrededor, de esta mismo forma ella desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que este es uno de los negocio de los cuales obtiene mayores ganancias, las cuales son muy necesarias en su hogar.
texts.en:
Beatriz Yolanda L. C., age 41, lives in the Aguilares municipality, located in the department of San Salvador, where she sells jeans for women and men, children's clothing, and sandals. She also has a small perishables store. She lives with her husband who works as a merchant, and their two young children, who go to school every day. Beatriz is a very hard-working person, who wants to be able to have everything necessary to see her family happy. She sells clothing traveling to different districts in Aguilares, and also tends to her own store. At the same time, she takes care of her children. Beatriz is requesting a loan with which to invest more in her store, buying all the necessary items to make it a very strong business where she can make more sales and also compete with the other businesses around. She also wants to buy a greater quantity of clothing, since this is the business which makes her the most money, which is very needed at home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clothing to sell.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Madelin is the coordinator of her group, El Sol sale para Todos 1, 2 & 3. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge right now is improving her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to sew.

Madelin is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 6 years, starting with some savings and Esperanza's loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling goods in her cafeteria: a place where people can have snacks like juices, cookies, sandwiches and groceries. She is also a tailor and makes household items like curtains and blankets. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She wants to have a successful business. 

This Esperanza associate began working with this group because they were looking for a loan and a friend talked about Esperanza. So, the group from this community joined. Madelin's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy blankets, bedding, cookies and food for resale

loans.name: José David

texts.es: José David C. de 47 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a sus padres y una pequeña sobrina. José posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad y productos comestibles como: granos básicos, productos lácteos, pan, aceite y otros más los cuales vende por mayor, el negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales compran sus productos para surtir negocios más pequeños. José es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo quien se esfuerza mucho por sostener a sus padres y a su sobrina, así como también todos los gastos del hogar, sus padres son de edad bastante avanzado pero a pesar de esto le ayudan a atender el negocio, sobre todo en horas pico que hay bastantes clientes. José solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar productos nuevos, los cuales aún no posee, como también comprar productos como harina, aceite, granos básicos, productos lácteos y otros más los cuales poseen mayor demanda, esto le permitirá percibir mayores ganancias y así mismo mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
José David C., who is 47, lives in the Usulután district with his parents and a small niece. José has a small store in which he sells basic necessities and food products such as basic grains, dairy products, bread, oil, and other items that he sells wholesale. The business is located in his home, where he has many customers who buy his products to stock smaller businesses. José is a person who is very dedicated to his work and who makes a great effort to support his parents and his niece, as well as covering all the household expenses. His parents are of a rather advanced age, but in spite of this they help him tend his business, especially at peak hours when there are a lot of customers. José is applying for a loan so that he can buy new products that he still doesn't have and also buy products like flour, oil, basic grains, dairy products, and others items which are in great demand. This will permit him to increase his earnings and at the same time to keep his business steady.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products that are basic necessities

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira H. D. P. D. 64 años D. edad,  una señora muy esforzada y trabajadora, posee un puesto en el mercado Central D. San Salvador, en el cual comercializa diferentes productos como: canastas, bolsones, carteras, alcancías D. plásticos, escobas, lazos y otros productos más. Ella vive en el departamento D. Sonsonate, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante D. productos varios, y así mismo vive junto a su hija la cual se dedica a trabajar para sus gastos personales y aportar un poco a la casa. La señora Edelmira cuenta con 43 años D. poseer este negocio en el mismo lugar, lo cual la ha hecho muy conocida en el mercado por diferentes personas las cuales son clientes D. ella desD. mucho tiempo atrás. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que las personas la conocen muy bien por ser amable y trabajadora. Edelmira solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos y D. esta forma surtir el negocio con más escobas, depósitos plásticos para colocar agua, canastas D. mimbre para colocar ropa y otros más, los cuales en la actualidad son bastante escasos como el ultimo mencionado, el mayor deseo D. Edelmira es el D. continuar adelante con su negocio y D. esta forma contar con las ganancias necesarias.
texts.en:
Edelmira H. D. P. is 64 years old, a vigorous and hard-working woman. She has a stall in the central market of San Salvador, where she sells different products such as baskets, purses, handbags, plastic piggy banks, brooms, ropes, and other products. She lives in the Sonsonate district with her husband, who works as a merchant of various products, and she also lives with her daughter, who works for her personal expenses and also contributes a little to the household. Señora Edelmira has had this business in the same location for 43 years, which has maD. her very well known in the market by various people who have been her customers for a long time. She has very good personal references, since she is well known for being kind and hard-working. Edelmira is applying for a loan to buy more products and in this way to stock her business with more brooms, plastic bottles for collecting water, wicker baskets for storing clothes, and other items that at the present time are rather scarce, like the last-mentioned item. Edelmira's greatest desire is to continue forward with her business and thus count on the earnings that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic products to stock her business

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov is married with one child. For the past nine years, she has owned a small store selling food, cosmetics and related products. Lubov is an open and sincere person, and these character traits have helped her in her business. Her customers like buying from her and come back again. Her business is quite competitive. Lubov would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products she offers. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est créé en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage.

Madame Maty N., accroupie à droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue, et un foulard blanc sur la tête, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle développe un petit commerce. Elle va à TOUBA dans le département de MBACKE région de DIOURBEL pour acheter sa marchandise. Elle revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone et en faisant du porte à porte.

Son nouveau prêt permettra d'acheter en quantité plus importante des parfums et de l'encens.

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, surtout en ce qui concerne la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Fallou solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the « Banc Villageois » loan group was dissolved. It consists of 11 women from the same village who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Maty N. is responsible for the group: she is shown kneeling on the right of the picture, clothed in white with a white scarf on her head. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is developing a small commercial business. She gets her merchandise from Touba in the Mbacke region of the Diourbel department. She resells at weekly area markets and door-to-door. Her new loan will enable her to buy larger quantities of perfume and incense. She assists her husband in taking care of their family, particularly concerning nutrition and health matters.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and incense

loans.name: Hipolito Gabriel

texts.es:
Hipólito de 30 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas),  el vende productos “Herbaline” (productos naturales para el cuerpo hechos con frutas). 

Hace dos años el comenzó como vendedor de la línea Herbaline vendiendo y haciendo promociones, (todos los vendedores son independientes), desde ese tiempo ha implementado vender batidos compuestos de productos herbaline, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 00h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir trabajando y darle una mejor vida a su familia el quiere comprar con el préstamo productos herbaline como adelgazador, frezztoo, noni etc. En el futuro quiere tener locales de batidos naturales herbaline.
texts.en:
Hipólito, 30, lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil ["Orchids of Guayaquil"], an urban area that got its name because, when it was discovered, there were many orchid flowers around. He sells "Herbaline" products (natural products for the body, made from fruits). He became an Herbaline vendor two years ago, selling and running promotions (all of the vendors are independent). Since that time, he has started selling shakes made of Herbaline products. He works from 8:00 in the morning until midnight every day. In order to keep working and to provide a better life for his family, he wants to take out a loan to buy Herbaline products like weight-loss supplements, "frezztoo," noni, etc. In the future, he would like to open shops where he sells natural Herbaline shakes.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Herbaline products like weight-loss supplement, frezztoo, noni, etc.

loans.name: Sara Josefina

texts.es: Sara Josefina C. D. V. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijos D. 12 y 1 año D. edad. Sara posee una venta D. tortillas, las cuales están hechas a base D. maíz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, en donD. las personas llegan a comprarlas. DesD. hace 4 años que ella trabaja elaborando este alimento el cual es muy necesario en la dieta D. las personas salvadoreñas, ya que se comen a diario hasta dos o tres veces al día, por lo que este es un negocio bastante estable. Sara desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que las ganancias generadas D. este negocio, le permiten brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y el D. sus hijo, los cuales son la razón principal para querer mejorar y poder brindarles lo mejor a ellos. Es por esto que Sara solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor y D. esta manera atender a más personas y así  obtener más ganancias las cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara Josefina C. D. V. is 44. She lives in the department of Usulután, a place where she shares her home together with her husband, who works, and with her two children who are 12 and 1. Sara sells tortillas, which are maD. from a base of corn. Her business is located in her home,where people come to buy them. She has worked for 4 years making this food which is very necessary in the diet of Salvadorean people, as they eat it daily up to two or three times per day, therefore it is a very stable business. Sara really wishes to be able to improve her business, owing to the fact that the profits generated from this business, allow her to offer all the help needed to her husband for the household expenses and for her children,who are the main reason for wanting to improve and be able to offer the best for them. This is why Sara is asking for a loan so she has the money necessary to buy corn wholesale and in this way serve more people and so earn more profits which will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn wholesale for selling tortillas.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia G. de 54 años de edad, es una persona soltera, la cual vive junto a cuatro nietos de: 15, 14, 12, 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y quienes se encuentran a cuidado de Dora, ya que la madre de ellos se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos de donde le manda remesas para el sustento de los niños. Dora se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, jóvenes y niñas, así mismo ropa interior y calcetines para hombres y mujeres. La venta esta ubicada frente a su casa de habitación, en Colón, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra sobre la calle principal, en donde es un lugar muy concurrido, ya que hay escuelas y diferentes negocios alrededor, por lo que Dora se encuentra a la vista de todas las personas quienes pueden apreciar los productos de ella. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de tallas, estampados, colores y estilos de ropa, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y así contar con una vida mejor para ella y sus nietas.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia G. is 54 years old and is single. She lives with her four gandchildren, who are 15, 14, 12, and 9 years old. They are in school and are in her care, since their mother is in the United States, and from there she sends remittances to support the children. Dora sells clothing for women, youth, and girls, as well as underwear and socks for men and women. Her stall is in front of her home in Colón; it is in a location that is very good for sales, since it is on the main street, which has a lot of traffic, since there are schools and different businesses around it. Thus Dora is in sight of all the people who appreciate her products. The business is very stable. For this reason she is applying to Integral for a loan so that she can increase her inventory by buying a greater variety of sizes, prints, colors, and styles of clothing. She is doing all this with the desire to improve her sales and thus have a better life for her and her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of clothing

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 46 años, es viuda y vive el lado de sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica al tejido, actividad que lo realiza en su misma casa con ayuda de su hija, las chompas que realiza son de muy buena calidad por lo que tiene clientes fijos y estables y cada cierto tiempo le solicitan este trabajo bien elaborado. Sabina no se queda  solamente con realizar tejidos, pues siempre esta al pendiente de nuevas oportunidades  de negocio como por ejemplo la venta de desayunos frente a una universidad, con ello tiene un aporte adicional a su economía. Esta tan entusiasmada con el trabajo, su mayor anhelo en este negocio es producir mas cantidad de prendas de vestir a base de lana tejida, para ello desea comprarse una maquina de tejer. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de lanas de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Sabina is 46-years-old. She's a widow and she lives with her 3 daughters in her own house. For more than 10 years she's been a weaver, an activity which she does in her home with the help of her daughter. The sweaters that she makes are very high quality, which is why she has loyal and stable customers who solicit her elaborate work on a regular basis. Sabina doesn't stop at weaving. She's always on the lookout for new business opportunities like, for example, selling breakfast foods in front of a university, which supplements her income. She's so enthusiastic about her work that her greatest desire in this business is to produce a greater quantity of woven wool garments. For this purpose she wants to buy a loom. This is her third loan with MFP and she's very happy to know that she has financial support because she's always been responsible with her payments, and, furthermore, it gives her pleasure to be a part of her local communal bank because all of its partners are responsible, supportive people. She's thankful to those who will participate in this loan that she's asking for, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of wool of various qualities and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of wool of various qualities and colors

loans.name: Martha Susana

texts.es:
Martha de 19 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), hace unos meses atrás sus padres le dieron una tienda pequeña para Martha. 

Por la falta de oportunidades y al ver sus padres el empeño que ella tenia por independizarse decidieron comprar algunos víveres y ubicarle una tienda para Martha, poco a poco ella ha administrado la tienda, cuando sale en las noches a la universidad su mama le ayuda atender la tienda, vende arroz, bebidas, lácteos etc. 

Ella quiere continuar con su tienda e invertir en dinero comprando arroz y bebidas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere surtir su tienda y terminar sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Martha is 19 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an area outside the city of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem). A few months ago, her parents gave her a small store. Because of the lack of other opportunities, when her parents saw her determination to work independently, they decided to buy some groceries and create a store for Martha. Little by little, she has improved the store, and when she goes out at night to her university classes, her mother helps her by working in the store, selling rice, beverages, dairy products, etc. Martha would like to continue with her store and invest the funds from the loan to buy rice and beverages. In the future, she would like to expand the range of goods she sells and successfully complete her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice and beverages for her store

loans.name: Yerlin

texts.es:
Yerlin V. A.    es una joven  de 20 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja 
Desde hace pocos años, doña Yerlin fue impulsada por su padre para que desarrollara su propio negocio en el pequeño terreno que él le había dado por herencia.  Hoy ella se dedica a la siembra de Ñame, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países. 
Actualmente Doña Yerlin  está solicitando un préstamo de ¢623,000 (seiscientos veinte tres mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del Ñame 
Doña Yerlin  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con el espera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de producción.
texts.en:
Yerlin V. A. is a youth of 20 years of age who lives with her husband and her 2 children in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region that is located very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. A few years ago Yerlin was motivated by her father to develop her own business on a small plot of land that he had given her for an inheritance. Today she is cultivating yams, root vegetables that taste good, are rich in nutrients and are processed in large volume by the local agro-industry. There is great demand for this product in Costa Rica as well as in other countries. Yerlin is now requesting a loan of 623,000 Costa Rican colones to help with the preparation of the soil by purchasing of seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that are needed to guarantee the optimal cultivation of yams. Yerlin is a member of the communal bank "Manatial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to improve her income and the quality of her production.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare the soil, and to cultivate yams

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma O. R.    es una señora de 37 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.
Con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia ella buscó alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco más de un año inició un negocio,  una panadería , en la cual  ofrece diferentes tipos de pan y sobre todo repostería casera.  Dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su comunidad ha tenido mucha aceptación puesto que antes no había un lugar que brindara ese servicio.
En estos momentos lo que desea doña Norma   es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢623 000 (Seiscientos veinte tres mil colones) para mejorar las condiciones del local donde se elabora el pan. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más  ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 
Doña Norma  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y mantener  su negocio
texts.en:
Norma O. R. is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in a community named Santa Fe, in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community lies in a mountainous zone very close to our country's northern border. The area's leading economic activities are ranching and farming, especially staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. With the desire to improve her quality of life and that of her family, Norma was looking at various alternatives, and a little more than a year ago, she started a business: a bakery in which she offers different types of bread and especially homemade pastries. She says that the business has gone very well for her; she has enjoyed great acceptance in her community, since there had previously been no business providing this service. At this time, Norma would like to request a loan of 623,000 colones in order to improve the infrastructure of the place where she bakes her bread. With this, she hopes that her microenterprise will grow and generate more income to raise her standard of living. Norma is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe (Santa Fe Springs Communal Credit Company), one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes that it will help her to grow on a personal level and allow her to maintain her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to improve her bakery

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor P. L.   es una joven  de 18 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y su  hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.
Flor  tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual   ha sembrado diferentes cultivos tales como papaya y plátano, pero desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la siembra de ñame  un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países. Asegura que desde que se dedica solo a este producto sus ingresos han aumentado.
Actualmente Flor está solicitando un préstamo de ¢623,000 (seiscientos veinte y  tres  mil colones) para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame.
Doña Flor  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y espera aprovecharlo al máximo y seguir teniendo acceso a este de tipo de Créditos.
texts.en:
Flor P. L. is an 18 year-old youth who lives with her husband and their son in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region that is located very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. Flor has a small piece of land where she has cultivated different crops such as papaya and bananas, but three years ago she started to grow yams. Yams are root vegetables that taste good, are rich in nutrients and are processed in large volume by the local agro-industry. There is great demand for this product in Costa Rica as well as in other countries. She tells us that since she dedicated her production entirely to this product her income has increased. Now Flor is requesting a loan of 623,000 Costa Rican colones to help with the preparation of the soil by purchasing of seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that are needed to guarantee the optimal cultivation of yams. Flor is a member of the communal bank "Manatial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes to take maximum advantage of it and to continue to have access to this type of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to improve her land

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro P. D.    es un señor de 57 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Durante toda su vida  Don Leandro  se  ha dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito. Una de sus especialidades es la producción  de queso. De la cual asegura que la calidad que el produce es la mejor alrededor de la zona. 

En estos momentos el desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢623.000 (seiscientos veintitrés mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto  y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus  vacas. El dice que la calidad de la leche que producen sus  vaquitas depende de la calidad del pasto.

Don Leandro  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y mantener  su negocio.
texts.en:
Leandro P. D. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and their three sons in a community called Santa Fe. Santa Fe is located in the Los Chiles area, in the province of Alajuela; this community is in a mountainous area and is very close to the country’s northern border. His main economic activities are ranching and farming, specifically, growing staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges. For all of his life Leandro has made a living raising cattle for milk and for meat. One of his specialties is producing cheese, and Leandro guarantees that his cheese is the best produced in the area. At this time Leandro wants to obtain a micro-loan for ¢623,000 (six hundred and twenty three thousand colones) so that he can purchase grass seed and improve the conditions of the corral where he keeps his cattle. He says that the quality of the milk his cows produce depends on the quality of the grass they eat. Leandro is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Leandro’s first loan, and he hopes it will help him to grow more on a personal level and maintain his business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining his business and purchasing grass seed.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 64 años, es casada y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 21 años D. experiencia en la actividad agrícola y lo que principalmente cultiva es papa y  maíz sobre extensiones D. terreno que posee en su tierra natal ubicado en la zona rural D. su localidad. Casi siempre acuD. a ver sus terrenos y  más en época D. siembra y cosecha, este ultimo es ella misma la encargada D. vender su cosecha al por mayor en el mercado local donD. tiene regulares rentas que le permiten incrementar un poco mas su inversión para la siguiente siembra, puesto que no tiene edad suficiente para continuar con esta actividad. Ahora sus hijos  trabajan mas seguido y se dedican a ver sus  terrenos D. cultivo, sin embargo Teofila no descansa en buscar buenos compradores para su cosecha, es por eso que continuara esforzándose en la agricultura. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. semillas y abono para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Teófila, 64, is married and lives in her own home with her three children. She has been a farmer for 21 years. Her main crops are potatoes and corn. Her fields are located in the area where she was born in her locality’s rural zone. Customarily she visits her fields mostly during planting and harvesting times. She herself sells her crops at wholesale in the local market where her profits are satisfactory and which permit her to gradually increase her investment in the next planting. Because she is now of an age that does not permit her to continue with this kind of work, her children now work more often and see to the fields. However, Teófila works tirelessly to find good buyers for her crops and this is why she will continue to work in farming. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal group because all its members are responsible, very united people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy seed and manure for the next planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure for the next planting cycle.

loans.name: Bella Angelica

texts.es:
Bella de 56 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres. 

Ella tiene la tienda para ayudar con los gastos familiares y a su esposo , comenzó comprando arroz, verduras y lácteos. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para asegurar su vejez porque ya sus hijos son mayores de edad. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Con el presta quiere comprar arroz, y bebidas para surtir mas su tienda, en el futuro quiere comprar una casa con su esposo.
texts.en:
Bella is 56 years old and lives in the Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area in which the majority of its residents are informal vendors). She owns a general store.

She runs the store in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She started out by purchasing rice, vegetables and dairy products. Since then, she has continued to work in order to be able to support herself during old age, since her children are now over age. She works from 8:00am until 9:00pm every day.

With this loan, she would like to purchase rice and beverages in order to better stock her shop. In the future, she would like to buy a house with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and beverages

loans.name: Kuñakuera Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Mirna quien ya conocia el programa D. Comite D. Mujeres Emprendedoras e invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte D. comite y hasta la actualidad siguen trabajando, y se encuentran contentas con sus trabajos. 
La sra. Mirna C. obtiene buenos ingresos mediante la venta D. ropas, tiene su clientela ya formada y debido a la temporada D. invierno aumentó su demanda por el frío.
Deseando incrementar sus ingresos quiere invertir en más compra al por mayor D. prendas D. vestir como pantalones, tricotas, camperas, remeras, medias, bufandas, gorros, etc. al por mayor para venta al detalle.
texts.en:
The contact person for the establishment of the current committee was Ms. Mirna, who was already familiar with the Comite D. Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) Program. She invited and organized her friends to form the group, which has been functioning since then. The group members are satisfied with their jobs.

Ms. Mirna C. earns a living via her apparel business. She has established her client base, and due to the winter season, demand has increased because of the cold weather.

Hoping to increase her income, she would like to invest in purchasing apparel such as pants, sweaters, jackets, T-shirts, socks, scarves, caps, etc. both wholesale and retail.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale and retail apparel

loans.name: Shalom 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Harthanesse is the coordinator of her group Shalom 6 & 7 (Shalom). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a stable business.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home.

Harthanesse is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for four years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different shoes, including sports, kid and women's shoes. She will use the profits to improve her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to make her business better, with more products. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Maravillas, una zona agrícola del distrito de Mochumí, zona perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina utilizada en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). El lleva nueve años trabajando en esta actividad, usualmente brinda su servicio uniendo la ruta de Mochumí con su caserío y otros caseríos aledaños. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos vendiendo algunos animales que el mismo cría. Con estas actividades el sostiene la economía de su familia.

William desea realizar algunas labores de reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil ya que, debido al continuo uso y al estado accidentado de los caminos del lugar, ha sufrido algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

William es un joven tranquilo y bastante entregado a su familia, en la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como transportista y llegar a tener una mototaxi mas.
texts.en:
William is a 35-year old father who has one dependent child. He lives with his family in the town of Maravillas, an agricultural area in the district of Mochumí, Lambayeque, about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He dedicates himself to providing transportation services with his mototaxi (a motorcycle outfitted with passenger seating and storage areas). He has been carrying out this activity for nine years, usually providing service along routes in Mochumí and other neighboring areas. He also generates income by selling livestock that he raises himself. He provides for his family financially through these activities. William would like to do some repairs to his vehicle. Because of continuous use and the bad state of the local roads, he has experienced some breakdowns and is in urgent need of some mechanical work so that his mototaxi will continue to run properly. In order to meet his goal, he has found himself having to turn to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles. William is a calm young man, and very dedicated to his family. He is well-known and liked by his neighbors, and his greatest wish is to continue growing his business and buying another mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Danny Felipe

texts.es:
Danny de 31 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una lavandería para poder solventar los gastos familiares. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en lavadoras para poder tener dinero y mantener a sus dos hijos que ahora tienen 7 y 8 años. Hace 5 años atrás comenzó con una lavadora ahora tiene tres y trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar dos lavadoras con el préstamo y en el futuro quiere tener sucursales de lavado y secado de ropa.
texts.en:
Danny, 31 years of age, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area where a majority of residents are merchants). He runs a laundromat to support his household’s expenses. Due to lack of opportunities, he had to invest his savings into washing machines so he could support his two children, now 7 and 8 years old. Five years ago, he started with one washing machine and now he has three. He works from 7 am until 10 pm every day. He would like to use the loan to buy two washing machines, in order to grow his business. In the future, he would like to open more branches of his laundromat.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase washing machines.

loans.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Naciones Unidas” está conformada por diez personas, nueve mujeres y un varón. Este es su segundo ciclo, la señora Cristina P. V. es la presidenta para este ciclo.

“Naciones Unidas” es una asociación comunal que pertenece al Centro Focal de Alto Lima.  La señora Cristina  tiene como negocio la producción y venta de zapatos, desde hace varios años;  el taller está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.  Ella indica que trabaja en forma conjunta con su esposo y su cuñado.  

Para el primer crédito la asociación le aprobó de Bs. 2000.  Ahora el préstamo solicitado es por Bs.2000.- y será destinado a la compra de material para la elaboración de zapatos. 

Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de pescado frito, venta de aceite, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de verdura, venta de cerveza, producción de calzados, producción de mantas y venta de fruta.
texts.en:
The “Naciones Unidas” (Nations United) Communal Bank is comprised of ten people, nine women and one man. This is their second cycle. Cristina P. V. is the president for this cycle. Naciones Unidas is a communal bank, which belongs to the community center in Alto Lima. Cristina has had a business producing and selling shoes for several years. Her workshop is located in her house. She says that she works together with her husband and her brother-in-law. Her first loan with the association was for 2,000 BOB. Now she is requesting a loan for 2,000 BOB. She will use the loan to buy material to make shoes. The members of the communal bank have different types of businesses like selling fried food, selling oil, selling groceries, selling food, selling vegetables, and selling beer. Some members make shoes, make blankets, or sell fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood to use as a fuel for making hot water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of products to increase her stock

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año ofrece el servicio de llamadas, por lo que cuenta con un locutorio instalado en su misma casa, aprovechando además que tiene una tienda.  Es así que de manera diaria atiende su establecimiento con la ayuda de sus 2 hijas la apoyan en esta tarea. Por otro lado se dedican también bordar bellas prendas típicas. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le gusta ser independiente y también porque le permite  tener una vida tranquila ya que le permite tener las rentas necesarias para su familia, afirma además que  aunque su trabajo suele ser tranquilo  requiere de muy buena administración y control de las ventas diarias, es por eso que Jesusa esta planificando crecer más en su negocio. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de línea  telefónica para llamadas en su locutorio y materiales para realizar bordados así como la compra de un saco de arroz para su tienda.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 40 years old and lives with her two children in their own home. For a year she has been offering phone service from her house, where she also runs a small store. Every day she runs the business with help from her two daughters. Jesusa also has another line of work, embroidering beautiful traditional clothing. She enjoys this second job because she can work independently and it allows her to have a less stressful life because it helps to cover the household expenses. Jesusa says that while her work is not stressful, it does require careful planning and sales management. For this reason, she is planning to expand her business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner]. She is very happy to have this financial support and has always repaid her loans on time. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because her fellow bank members are responsible and supportive. She thanks the people who will fund her loan. It will be very useful for her to move her business forward. She will use the loan money to buy another telephone line for her business, to buy materials for embroidery work, and also to buy a sack of rice for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a telephone line and embroidery materials

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
