Cesar es un padre de familia de 50 años que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector San Miguel del caserío Lagartera, una de las tantas zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir en un pequeño taller que está instalado en su vivienda, el cuenta con una máquina de coser pequeña con la que confecciona pantalones, los cuales ofrece en venta a un acopiador de la zona que los distribuye en ciudades de la sierra norte del país, este negocio es la principal fuente de sustento para la economía de su familia, adicionalmente tiene ganado de engorde, el cual vende eventualmente con lo que se genera ingresos adicionales.

Cesar desea implementar su taller adquiriendo una remalladora que le permita realizar sus labores con mayor comodidad y eficiencia, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su meta.

Cesar es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la zona donde vive es considerado una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 50 year old husband and father who lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel sector of the village of Lagartera. This is one of the many rural areas that make up the district of Mórrope, an agricultural district that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is found forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He makes clothing in a small workshop set up in his home. He has a small sewing machine with which he makes pants that he sells to an area warehouse that distributes them in cities in the northern sierra of the country. This business is the main source of support for his family. He also has beef cattle which he sells eventually and with which he generates additional income. Cesar wants to outfit his workshop adquiring an overlocker which will allow him to do his work with more convenience and efficiency. That is why he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles which will allow him to attain his goal. Cesar is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his family. He has worked with our institution previously and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes to making payments. In the area where he lives he is considered a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an overlocker to improve his clothing making business.

loans.name: Ilusiones De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “ILUSIONES DE ALTO LIMA” está conformada por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varón. Este es su segundo ciclo, la señora  Jesusa A. C. es la presidenta.  Como su nombre lo indica, la asociación es parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima.

La señora Jesusa  tiene como negocio la venta de comida, desde hace diez años, por ahora no tiene un lugar específico de venta, es vendedora ambulante.  

Si bien este es el segundo ciclo para la asociación, es el primer ciclo para la presidenta, la asociación le aprobó de Bs. 1500.-, monto de dinero que le servirá para la compra de insumos para la venta de comida.
En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de tostado, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de verdura, venta de repuestos, tapicería.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones de Alto Lima Communal Association is comprised of 8 members: seven women and one man. This is the group's second loan cycle. Ms. Jesusa A. C. is the group president. As its name indicates, the association is part of the Alto Lima headquarters.

Ms. Jesusa has been selling food for a living for ten years. As of right now, she does not have a fixed business space; she is a street vendor.

This is the association's second loan cycle, but it is the first cycle for the president. The association approved a loan of 1,500.00 BOB, which will be used to purchase supplies for selling food.

Regarding the group, the members own different types of businesses: roasted nuts and legumes, provisions, food, produce, spare parts, and upholstery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale provisions

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LIZABETH MARIELA, TIENE 49 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE UN HIJO D. 24 AÑOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES EN ACCIÓN", INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE 6 AÑOS INICIÓ EL NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA D. GOLOSINAS, UNA AMIGA LE DEJÓ EL LUGAR DOND. AHORA ELLA SE UBICA CON SU CARRETA, QUE LO COMPRÓ JUNTANDO SUS GANANCIAS ASI COMO TAMBIÉN ADQUIRIÓ UNA PEQUEÑA VITRINA PARA EXHIBIR LOS PRODUCTOS D. VENTA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO ARREGLAR SU CASA Y SOBRETODO AUMENTAR SU STOCK D. GOLOSINAS LO QUE LE PERMITE TENER MAYOR INGRESOS Y MAS CLIENTES.
SU META MAS CERCANA ES AMBIENTAR UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA PARA IMPLEMENTAR UNA BODEGA, ASÍ YA NO TENDRÍA QUE SALIR A VENDER A LAS CALLES Y EVITARÍA PASAR FRÍO EN ÉPOCAS D. INVIERNO E INSOLACIÓN EN ÉPOCA D. VERANO.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. GOLOSINAS Y GASEOSAS PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Lizabeth Mariela is 49 years old, married, and has a 24-year-old son. She is part of the "Mujeres en Acción" [Women in Action] group, which has 8 members. Her fellow group members elected her as the head of the group. For 6 years, Lizabeth has worked selling candy. A friend found her a place to park her mobile sales stand, which she purchased with her earnings. She also bought a small glass display case in order to show off her products. With her earnings, Lizabeth has been able to make improvements to her home, but principally she has been able to increase her stock of candies, which in turn has allowed her to gain more customers and make better profits. Lizabeth's current goal is to remodel part of her house to start a small grocery store. This will mean she does not have to sell in the street and will avoid being cold in the winter and getting too much sun in the summer. She will use this loan to buy candy and soft drinks for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy for her store

loans.name: Libia

texts.es: Libia tiene 23 años, vive en casa de su hermana en compañía de su madre y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, ofreciendo a personas que en su mayoría son conocidas o familiares, eso le garantiza el pago de la mercadería que vende. Afirma que este negocio es muy rentable porque compra a un precio módico las prendas y puede ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, es así que se abastece de mercadería cada 2 meses donde viaja a la ciudad de Lima y compra al por mayor. Una de sus metas es tener más capital y tener un puesto de ventas. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en casacas y prendas gruesas ya que son los que más demanda tiene en esta época de frío.
texts.en:
Libia is 23 years old and lives in her sister's house along with her mother and her two children. For the past two years she has worked selling clothing, mostly to family members and acquaintances. This helps her to be sure that she will be paid for her merchandise. Libia says that her business is very profitable because she can buy clothing for a low price and offer her customers a good price when she sells it. She stocks up on clothing every 2 months when she travels to the city of Lima, where she can purchase the clothing wholesale. One of her goals is to obtain more working capital and set up a sales stand. This is her fourth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner]. She is very happy to have this financial support and has always repaid her loans on time. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because her fellow bank members are responsible and supportive. She thanks the people who will fund her loan. It will be very useful for her to move her business forward. She will use the loan money to buy more jackets and other heavy clothing that is in demand during the cold winter season in Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets and other cold-weather clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home enlargement.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto Benavidez tiene 26 años y vive en el barrio la Luz, su negocio se llama “Venta de víveres donde Carlos” este es su tercer crédito y lo invertirá en la compra de surtido para la tienda, entre víveres ranchos, licores y abarrotes. 
Su negocio lo inició en el año 2005 con una venta de jugos naturales y otros refrescos, como gaseosas y bebidas frías, gradualmente fue agregándole otras mercancías, porque sintió la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos y además porque el lugar resultó propicio para esta actividad; en la actualidad en su tienda  vende adicionalmente bebidas frías al por mayor y al detal y también productos de papelería que  adicionó últimamente.
Carlos Alberto ha recibido 3 créditos que le han ayudado a producir ciertos cambios como el su economía que se ha mejorado y también han ocurrido en los aspectos organizacionales de su tienda, que cada día reviste un mayor orden.
Su meta es continuar adicionando otros productos como los de miscelánea e independizar su negocio de su espacio familiar. Su mayor desafío es la competencia que existe en ese sector, por eso su meta es tener gran variedad de mercancía e ir diversificando la oferta de productos y servicios.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Benavidez is 26 years old and lives in the La Luz neighborhood. His business is a general store called “Venta de víveres donde Carlos.” This is his third loan, and it will be invested in purchasing products for the store, like general provisions, food and liquor.

He started his business in 2005, initially selling fruit juices and other beverages, such as soda pop and cold drinks. He gradually added other merchandise because he felt the need to increase his income. Furthermore, the business turned out to be favorable. He currently also sells cold drinks wholesale and retail, as well as stationery, which he recently added.

Carlos Alberto has received 3 loans, which have helped him achieve several changes; his financial situation has improved, and his store organization is improving day by day. His goal is to continue adding other products and to separate his business from his residence. His biggest challenge is the competition that exists in the area, which is why his goal is to offer a greater variety of merchandise and to diversify his goods and services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions, food and liquor for general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras del barrio Loma Merlo de la ciudad de Luque, se formó  gracias a que una de las integrantes del comité llegó a la oficina de la Fundación para informarse sobre los créditos, y formó con un grupo de amigas un comite y solicitaron  para formar parte del programa de Comité de Mujeres.
De esta forma se inicia el comité Mujeres Luchadoras, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 16 integrantes que invierten en distintas actividades.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María M. quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles y bebidas, así como helados y golosinas.
 La misma está bien situada por lo que posee una buena clientela y con buena demanda, por lo que desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando su negocio con más variedad de comestibles, mas variedad de bebidas, así como diversidad de golosinas y helados para la compra de estos productos ella solicita el prestamo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras Group of the Loma Merlo neighborhood in the city of Luque was formed thanks to one of its members who came to the Fundación office to get informed about microloans. She formed a committee with a group of friends, and they applied to be a part of the Comité de Mujeres program.

This is how the Mujeres Luchadoras Group was formed, which is currently in its fourth loan cycle in the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) Program of the Fundación Paraguaya. The group is comprised of 16 members who invest in different businesses. One of the members is Ms. Maria M., who sells food, beverages, ice cream and candy for a living.

She is prosperous because of her solid client base and high demand, which is why she wishes to increase her income by expanding her business with a variety of foodstuffs and beverages, as well as a large assortment of ice cream. She is requesting this loan in order t o purchase these products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale charcoal, soft drinks, beer, vegetables, cooking oil, flour, breads, meats, and ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction tools like: polisher, saw, hammer, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JINA, ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "NUEVO AMANECER", FORMADO POR 8 INTEGRANTES. ELLA TIENE 53 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE 7 HIJOS, DE CUALES DOS AÚN SON MENORES.
HACE SIETE AÑPOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CONDIMENTOS, ELLA LOS PREPARA Y REPARTE EN LOS DIFERENTES MERCADOS; FUERON SUS HIJOS QUIENES EMPEZARON ÉSTE NEGOCIO Y ELLA SOLO LOS APOYABA, AL VER LA ACOGIDA DECIDIÓ FORMAR SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y ASÍ APOYAR A SUS HIJOS MENORES EN LOS GASTOS ESCOLARES.
CON SUS INGRESOS HA LOGRADO ARREGLAR SU CASITA, COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS Y SOBRETODO LO MAS IMPORTANTE PARA ELLA HA PODIDO CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE ESTUDIOS DE SUS HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES INCURSIONAR EN LA VENTA DE ABARROTES, ALQUILANDO UN LOCAL EN UNA ZONA COMERCIAL PRIMERO PARA LUEGO ADQUIRIR SU PROPIO LOCAL.

EL PRÉSTRAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INGREDIENTES PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE SUS CONDIMENTOS, APROVECHARÁ QUE RFECIBE UHNA CANTIDAD CONSIDERABLE PARA COMPRAR LOS PRODUCTOS A PRECIO POR MAYOR Y OBTENER ASÍ UN POCO MAS DE GANANCIA.
texts.en:
Jina, 53, is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER" (New Dawn) group which has 8 members. She has 7 children two of whom are still minors. For the last 7 years she has sold condiments that she prepares herself and sells in the various markets. Her children were the ones who started the business and she just helped out. In view of the good reception she got, she decided to set up her own business to help her youngest children with their school costs. Her income has made it possible for her to fix up her little house, to buy her appliances and, above all, to cover her children’s educational expenses. Her next goal is to go into grocery sales by first renting a locale in a commercial area and subsequently acquiring he own locale. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients to prepare the condiments. She will take advantage of the fact that she will receive a considerable sum to buy supplies at better wholesale prices thereby earning somewhat higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for condiments preparation.

loans.name: Cruz Esperanza

texts.es:
Cruz Esperanza tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo, vive en el caserío El Huantaco, un centro poblado del área rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona dedicada principalmente  al cultivo de árboles frutales, se encuentra en la provincia de Piura y pertenece a la región del mismo nombre, se  localiza a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en el domicilio donde reside, este negocio le permite a sus clientes y vecinos contar con productos de uso diario al alcance de la mano, por lo que su negocio cuenta con bastante clientela, las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y cuidar se su pequeño niño.	

Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas artículos para aumentar su stock y también aumentar su nivel de ventas. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que  le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Cruz es una mujer honrada y bastante trabajadora. En la zona donde reside sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz Esperanza is a 33-year-old single mother with a small child. She lives in the El Huantaco hamlet, a rural community in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a region where there is mainly fruit tree cultivation. This place is located in the Piura province, and is a part of the region that goes by the same name. It is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic need items and provisions from home. This business allows her customers and neighbors to have easy access to daily use products, which is why she has a solid client base. She uses the profits earned from this business to cover her personal expenses and to support her young child.

She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more goods and increasing her stock, thus boosting sales. For this reason, she feels the need to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time so that she can reach her goal.

Cruz is an honest and hard-working woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area consider her to be a calm and trustworthy person. Her greatest wish is to be able to grant her child the opportunity to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need items and other provisions to expand her in-home general store

loans.name: Julio Omario

texts.es:
Julio Omario A. C. tiene 25 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 niña de 4 años.

Julio es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Julio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao cada fin del mes. 

Solicita el préstamo para cultivar sembríos de cacao para cambiar su economía personal y familiar. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su trabajo y de esta manera dar una buena educación a su hija. 

Le gusta practicar el juego de billar.
texts.en:
Julio Omario A. C. is 25 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. He has one daughter who is 4 years old. Julio is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, located three hours from Chillanes. It has a total of 19 members, most of whom are involved in growing corn and cacao [cocoa]. This is their first loan through the San José Cooperative. Julio works in agriculture, growing corn and cacao. He makes his purchases and his sales in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month. He is requesting the loan so he can cultivate more cacao crops, in order to improve his personal economic situation and that of his family. His dream is to continue with his work so that he can give a good education to his daughter. He enjoys playing billiards.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing cacao

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 años brinda el servicio de transporte y su herramienta principal es el propio carro que han adquirido y ahora  el servicio que  brinda va por diferentes puntos de la ciudad. Es por esta razón que han contratado a un chofer, para que pueda trabajar todo el día, mientras que  Martha y su esposo trabajan como docentes en un centro educativo. Cada día el trabajo les genera la renta que necesita para la economía de su hogar, además eso le ayuda a pagar las letras de crédito que aún faltan para cancelar el carro que posee. Manifiesta que se siente muy satisfecha de tener los ingresos porque  le permite disponer para muchos gastos  que se requiere en su hogar. En adelante desea adquirir un carro más para que siga trabajando de esta modalidad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico y en la compra de repuestos de su carro.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a rented house. For the last 2 years she has been in transport services and her principal tool is a car which she has acquired. She offers service to different points in the city. Recently Martha has hired a driver to work all day, so that she and her husband can serve as teachers in an educational center. Each day the work earns them the money they need for their household economy. It also heps them to pay off what they still owe on the car. Martha feels very satisfied to have her taxi income because it permits her to cover many household expenses. In the future, she would like to acquire another car and to continue to work in the same manner. This is Martha's 1st loan with MFP. She is very content to know that she has financial help and appreciates being part of her communal group, because all the members are responsible people who offer solidarity. Martha is grateful to those who supported her loan, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will invest her loan in maintenance and replacement parts for her car.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO OBTAIN SPARE PARTS AND MECHANICAL MAINTENANCE FOR HER TAXI

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “16 DE JULIO” está conformada por nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varón. Este es su primer ciclo, la presidenta es la señora Eustaquia Santusa Q..  La asociación es parte del centro focal de Santiago II.

La señora Eustaquia, socia de 51 años de edad, casada, madre de 5 hijos,  tiene como negocio la venta de flores, ella comenta que aprendió este negocio de su madre desde los quince años.  

Ingresó a Pro Mujer por invitación de sus amigas.   El crédito le servirá para aumentar el capital de trabajo. Compra la mercadería en el mercado Rodríguez que se encuentra en la ciudad de La Paz, para venderlas en la feria, los días: viernes, sábado y domingo por las mañanas.

Conversando con la presidenta comenta que lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la capacitación y el ahorro.
En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
The 16th of July Communal Bank is made up of nine people: eight women and one man. This is their first loan cycle. Ms. Eustaquia is the group's president. This communal bank is part of the Santiago II branch. Ms. Eustaquia is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her business is selling flowers. She notes that she learned this business from her mother, starting when she was 15 years old. Her friends invited her to join Pro Mujer. She will use this loan to increase her working capital. She buys merchandise in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz, then sells the flowers at the fair on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday mornings. When Pro Mujer was speaking with Ms. Eustaquia, she told them that her favorite things about Pro Mujer are the training and savings. The other members of the communal bank have various types of service and commercial businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Roberto Hugo

texts.es: Roberto es un joven muy trabajador, el vive solo, y hace poco tiempo adquirió una vivienda de interés social, poco a poco ah estado acondicionándola para cuando tenga una familia.  Roberto trabaja en una constructora y tiene muchas ganas  de ver terminada su casa, el requiere este crédito para colocar el Vitro piso de su casa y así tener el y su futura familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is a very hard-working young man. He is single, and through social services he has recently obtained a house that he is arranging little by little in view of having a family one day. Roberto works for a construction company, and is really eager to finish his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to put tiled floors in his house, in order to grant to himself and his future family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put tiled floors in his house.

loans.name: Yonny Capri

texts.es:
Yonny Capri P. R. tiene 44 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 niños de 20, 19, y 17 anos.

Yonny  es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Yonny se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao y en Babahoya, 2 veces al año para maíz y cada 2 semanas para el cacao. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para maíz, para ingresar pollos y chanchos. No se podía hacer sin el crédito. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su trabajo y terminar de dar estudios a los hijos.  

Le gusta jugar indoor futbol y salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Yonny Capri P. R. is 44. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 3 children ages 20, 19 and 17. Yonny is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San Jose. Yonny is a farmer who grows corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao and in Babahoya, twice per year for corn and every two weeks for cocoa. He is requesting this loan to purchase inputs for corn, and to introduce chickens and pigs. He would not be able to do this without the loan. His dream is to succeed with his work and to finish his children's education. He likes to play indoor soccer and go for walks with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inputs for corn, and to raise chickens and pigs

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: La Señora Edelmira F. tiene una familia muy unida, cuanta con dos hijas ya grandes y su esposo el Señor Facundo. Todos en la familia trabajan para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Quieren mejorar la casa y agrandarla, requieren de este préstamo para construir un cuatro en la parte trasera de la vivienda y así vivir con mas comodidad.  Poco a poco le han hecho mejoras a su vivienda, ellos agradecen su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ms. Edelmira F. has a very close-knit family, composed of two adult daughters and her husband, Facundo. The whole family works to contribute getting a better quality of life. As they would like to improve and enlarge their house, the requested loan will be used to build a room in the back of the house that will grant them better living conditions. They have improved their house, little by little, and they are thankful to the lenders for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Antonio Francisco

texts.es:
Antonio Francisco G. Z. tiene 45 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 niños de 14, 13, 12, 8, 5, y 3 anos. 

Antonio es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Antonio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, yuca, y maracuyá. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para sus cultivos para cambiar su economía. Su sueño es poder dar una buena educación a todos sus hijos. 

Le gusta practicar el deporte de indoor futbol.
texts.en:
Antonio Francisco G. Z. is 45. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 6 children ages 14, 13, 12, 8, 5 and 3. Antonio is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San Jose. Antonio is a farmer who cultivates corn, cocoa, plantains, yucca and passion fruit. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao every weekend. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of inputs for his crops and to change his economic situation. His dream is to be able to give a good education to all of his children. He enjoys playing the sport of indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of inputs for his crops

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el caserío San Eloy, una zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia D. Piura, se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas, las cuales son vendidas en algunas procesadoras del lugar que manufacturan este producto para exportarlo a diversos países del exterior. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. chicha D. jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara en base a un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz), Esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes D. iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Jacinta ofrece esta bebida acompañada D. diversos platos denominados 'piqueos' los dias sabado, domingo y lunes. El negocio goza D. buena acogida gracias al buen trato que ella brinda a sus clientes. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza en ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos económicos D. su familia.

Jacinta desea adquirir mas insumos para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y respetuosa, su mas granD. anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer honesta y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 51 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in San Eloy, a rural community located in the agricultural district of TambogranD., in the Piura province, which is three hours away from the town of Chiclayo. The main activity of this area is the production of fruit that is then sold to some local food processors manufacturing this product to export it abroad. Jacinta engages in producing and selling chica D. jora (a typical drink of the area prepared with a special kind of maize flour). This is a fairly consumed drink in the area, especially during the various holidays and celebrations. On top of this, local workers drink it before starting to work, because they believe this drink gives energy and strength. Jacinta offer this drink together with different appetizers called “piqueos” on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. Her activity enjoys a good reputation thanks to the good way she treats her customers. She uses the money she earns from this activity to help her husband, a farmer, cope with the economic expenses of their family. Jacinta wishes to buy more ingredients to keep on preparing this drink and increase her sales. For this reason, and for the first time, she has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to Edpyme Altenativa in order to reach her goals. She is a calm and respectful woman, whose biggest desire is to keep on working to improve her family’s quality of life. In the area where she lives she is known by neighbors and acquaintances for being a honest and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare chicha and to enlarge her stall.

loans.name: Jesus Hector

texts.es: El señor Jesús Héctor cuenta con dos trabajos, uno es en una empresa donde trabaja todos los días y el otro trabajo es de fin de semana, el Señor Jesús Héctor lucha por darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.   El requiere de la impermeabilización de el techo de su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias intensas que han Caído en la cuidad se ah dañado considerablemente. El señor Jesús solo quiere lo mejor para su familia. Y agradece sinceramente el apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Héctor has two jobs: he works in a company during the week, and has another job for the weekend. Jesús Héctor struggles for his family to offer them better life conditions. The loan he is requesting will be used to waterproof the roof of his house, as the heavy rains that fell on the city have severely damaged it. Jesús only wants what is best for his family, and he is sincerely thankful for the offered support.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof the roof of his house.

loans.name: Luis Estalin

texts.es:
Luis Estalin S. R. tiene 27 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 ninos de 7 meses hasta 8 anos.
  
Luis es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura y al cultivo de cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao 2 veces por mes. 

Solicita el préstamo para criar los pollos y chancos. Su sueño es sacar adelante una casa y los estudios de los niños.  

Le gusta jugar el deporte del indor futbol.
texts.en:
Luis Estalin S. R. is 27. He is in a common law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 4 children from 7 months to 8 years. He is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San Jose. Luis is a farmer who cultivates cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao twice a month. He is requesting this loan for raising chickens and pigs. His dream is to get ahead with a home and his children's studies. He enjoys playing the sport of indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chickens and pigs

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: La Señora Soledad es una persona trabajadora y con muchos ánimos de hacer crecer su negocio, ella y su esposo tienen un local en donde venden ropa usada y aparatos electrónicos, viven solos en su vivienda y son una pareja muy unidos, ellos requieren de este crédito para invertir en su negocio, La señora Soledad quiere comprar mas mercancía para la venta y así incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Soledad is a hard-working woman with a great desire to make her activity grow. She and her husband own a stall where they sell used clothes and electrical appliances. They live alone in their house and they are very close as a couple. They will use the requested loan to invest in their activity. Soledad wants to buy more products to sell in order to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Alfredo N. Solís, es un hombre muy trabajador, el vive con uno de sus hijos y se ayudan en los gastos de la casa, ellos quieren una mejor calidad de vida y  requiere de este crédito para reparar un techo de madera de su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias tan intensas que han caído, el techo esta muy dañado y temen que con la humedad que guarda la madera ocurra un accidente y se pueda caer. El Señor Alfredo les agradece la ayuda que le brindan por que de verdad que si necesita la reparacion de este techo.
texts.en:
Alfredo N. Solís is a very hard-working man. He lives with one of his children, and they both help with household expenses. They want a better quality of life, and he needs the loan to repair the wooden roof of their home, since with the recent intense rainfalls the roof is quite damaged and they fear that with the humidity in the roof, there will be an accident and the roof could fall.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of a wooden roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for improved animal production

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo R. es un hombre muy emprendedor, que quiere el bienestar de su familia, el señor Arturo es albañil y el mismo con ahorros le ah hecho muchas mejoras a su vivienda. Tiene una familia muy unida. El requiere de este credito para la instalacion de el drenaje en su localidad, ya que no cuentan con este servicio tan necesario para su familia, El señor Arturo siempre esta al pendiente del bienestar de su familia. y el les agradece su apoyo.
texts.en:
Arturo is a very entrepreneurial man who wishes for his family’s well-being. Arturo is a mason. He himself has made many improvements to his home with savings. He has a very close family. He needs this loan to install drainage in his area since his family does not have this much needed service. Arturo is always on the lookout for his family’s well-being and he thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drainage Installation

loans.name: Ma De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Ma de los Ángeles cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, desde hace 16 años, este negocio ah permanecido gracias al empeño que ella ah puesto. En esta ocasión la señora Ma de los Ángeles requiere de este crédito para la compra de juguetes para la venta que ella tiene.  La señora quiere hacer crecer el negocio, incrementar las ventas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles has a business selling used clothing. The business has stayed open for the past 16 years thanks to her efforts. Maria de los Angeles is requesting a loan to buy toys to sell in her store. She wants to grow her business, increase sales and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda E. is from the village of Balugo, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Luzviminda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Luzviminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the second loan taken out by Luzviminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel B. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Richel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice like "masipag" for sale. (Masipag rice is grown using green methods.) Richel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Richel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

To make a living, Alice E raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice like "bordagol" and "mimis" for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Nilda Rosa

texts.es:
En Jacinto la tierra de las artesanias y hamacas en el departamento de Bolívar, vive Nilda L. O.,con su conyuge y sus tres hijos de 17 a 26 años de edad.Su negocio es elaborar artesanias como hamacas, sandalias mochilas y todo lo que desarrolle su creatividad natural.  Aprendió esta actividad por tradición familiar, se dedica a ella desde hace 35 años  y es justamente lo que la ha ayudado a sostener su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde que empezó a acceder a créditos con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, su negocio logrò cambios  favorables, porque le ha permitido adicionar un nuevo capital de trabajo, generándole mayores oportunidades de bienestar familiar por ejemplo la educación de sus hijos, que están en la universidad estudiando derecho y licenciatura en ciencias sociales; también le ha permitido en el arreglo de su vivienda,que aunque es propia la ha levantado poco a poco al lado  de su cónyuge. Este es su cuarto crédito con esta organizaciòn y lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de artesanías y algunas sandalias que tiene encargadas.

Sus mayor desafío lo vivió hace 10 años cuando su esposo no tenía trabajo estable y se mantenían subsistiendo con pocos ingresos y mucho trabajo por parte de ella, pero todo les ha cambiado, porque con su negocio les va bien, viven en un barrio rodeado de comerciantes de artesanías, competencia que los impulsa día a día y sus vecinos son trabajadores del campo y personas conocidas y muy familiares, lo que genera gran tranquilidad y una dinámica social saludable.
texts.en:
Nilda L. O. lives with her husband and three children between the ages of 17 and 26. They in in Jacinto, land of crafts and hammocks in the department of Bolivar. Her business is making crafts such as hammocks, sandals, bags and anything that her natural creativity inspires. These skills were passed down by her family and for 35 years have helped maintain her home and help her children succeed. Since she started receiving loans from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo her business has changed for the better, since they allowed her access to working capital. This generated better conditions for the family such as education for her children, who are in college studying law and social sciences. It has also allowed her to improve her home that she built little by little with her husband. This is her fourth loan with this organization and she will invest in in the purchase of materials to make crafts and sandals for which she has orders. She faced her greatest challenge 10 years ago when her husband didn't have a stable job and the family lived on her modest income and hard work. Today all that has changed, the business is thriving and they live in a neighborhood surrounded by craft businesses. This competition motivates them daily. Many neighbors are agricultural workers, well known and friendly, which creates and secure atmosphere and a healthy social interaction.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as thread and other materials needed for crafts and to fill orders for sandals

loans.name: Sari Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh K. is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Luh is the group leader of a 17-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Pertiwi (PK-10235).


Ni Luh is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Luh owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Luh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Luh joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Luh is requesting a loan from MUK for the first time. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Luh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Luh K. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Luh adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 17 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Pertiwi (PK-10235).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Luh sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Luh bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Luh meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry P. is from the village of Nipaan. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry operates a family member's business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Cherry has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Cherry joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cherry from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Ni Kadek C. D. is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ni Kadek plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Kadek C. D. (0) merupakan 25 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Flamboyan (PK-10220).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Kadek sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Kadek bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg O. is 24 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and parents-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger – a traditional housing tent.
Three months ago, Gantsetseg began her construction materials business, specializing in selling lights for household use, at Jobi – one of the biggest construction markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Now her daily sales range between 125,000 and 150,000 MNT. Gantsetseg is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to increase her business working capital.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

texts.en: Guillerma C. is from the village of Manukan. She is 62 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Guillerma owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Guillerma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Guillerma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Guillerma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Batsuh T. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own ger – a traditional housing tent – in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His wife works as a tailor while he operates a carpentry business in their town. Batsuh has been working as a carpenter since 2005 and over this period, he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. His business is more profitable in the summertime than in the cold season. In the future, Batsuh would like to own his own carpentry shop and expand his product line in order to grow his customer base. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more timber for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
From the town of Cetro Napu, Tudela Mis. Occ., Jovita M. is a 68-year-old married mother of seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 50000 PHP for the same purpose. Jovita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa D. is from the village of Gusa Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. This 39-year-old married mother of two school-aged children owns and operates a general store selling daily food in the local community. Engaged in her business for eight years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jesusa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital and for the tuition of her two children. This loan will be Jesusa's seventh from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Erdene-Oyun

texts.en: Erdene-Oyun T. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger – a traditional housing tent. Her husband works for a local brick-manufacturing company. Erdene-Oyun manages a food trading business in her town. She started her business in 2008 and has used her earnings to purchase a fridge. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more food products to sell at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for resale

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantrea V. is 25 years old and her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Pov, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have two children – one son and one daughter – both of whom are still young. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Chantrea runs a grocery store at her home. She has just delivered a baby. Her husband has been a blacksmith for ten years. She is applying for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorcycle for her brother to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her brother

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma B. is from the village of Bandera. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S. and her husband, Mr. Som-oun Nhem, have been married since 1962 and have seven children – two sons and five daughters. All of their children are now married, and one still lives with the family. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Kheng buys silk products from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in other provinces far away from her home. Her husband is a primary school teacher. She has received a Kiva loan several times already. She is now requesting another loan, for $1,000, in order to continue expanding her business by purchasing silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk products for resale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Khiev, married in 1978 and have four children – one son and three daughters. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Heng and her husband are farmers. They grow jasmine flowers on their farmland near their house and sell the flowers in Phnom Penh market. Besides farming, Mr. Khoeun Khiev is also a fisherman. One of their daughters is married and wants to live outside the family home. Therefore, Heng is asking for a loan of $600 to help finance her daughter to build a house in which to live.

loans.use: To help finance her daughter to build a house

loans.name: Noeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeu T., aged 55, is a widow with five children – three sons and two daughters. Her eldest daughter assists Noeu in her business, her next son is a chef, and the other three children attend school. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Noeu is a farmer. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village. In addition, she wants to run a coffee shop as she will be able to earn extra income from this business. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $500 to build a shelter and buy materials to operate the business.

loans.use: To build a shelter and buy materials to run a coffee shop

loans.name: Ma. Luzviminda

texts.en:
Ma. Luzviminda D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be a successful entrepreneur someday.
Ma. Luzviminda joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy T. is 27 years old and her husband Mr. Bin Khloeng, is 37 years old. They have been married since 2005 and have two young daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Channy has been selling grocery items at her home for a year. She buys them from Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi for six years. Channy is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Karya Murni Abadi Group

texts.en:
Putu D. (0) is a 38-year-old male living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Putu is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Karya Murni Abadi (PK-00108).


Putu is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Putu owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale.  Putu has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Putu is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  He is requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Putu D. (0) merupakan 38 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Karya Murni Abadi (PK-00108).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Putu menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Putu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura K. is the leader of this group. She is 51 and married. She has raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, the second is a student and the son works as a teacher. Ainura also works as a teacher at the same school. Her husband has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1995, after the collective farms broke up. Ainura applied for this loan because she needs money to pay for her second daughter’s education at university.

Nuruiza M., 51, is married. She has two daughters and a son. The first daughter studies at university, the second is at school and the son is preschool age – under 7. Nuruiza and her husband have been engaged in cattle breeding since 1995. By selling some cattle, they were able to repair their house and purchase a tractor. Now Nuruiza hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to pay for her daughter’s medical treatment. In the future, Nuruiza wants to see her daughters get married.

Aigul T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 49 and married. She has raised five sons: the three older ones are working, the fourth son is in the army and the youngest one studies at school. With money received from this loan, Aigul wants to pay for her son’s education at university. In the future, she wants to purchase a house in Bishkek.

Sveta B., 43, is a widow. She has two daughters and a son. The older daughter and the son are at school and the younger daughter is not yet school age. Sveta hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to cover the family's expenses. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education at university

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 28 years old and single. She has two children who are 5 and 9 years old. She has one dependant and she has a family of four people with whom she lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children. She has a beauty salon business. She has been in the business for four years. She started by plaiting hair. Eventually she opened her own salon for plaiting hair and now has started stocking cosmetics. Her business is seasonal and in the future, she expects to specialize in selling cosmetics and treating hair. The purpose of the loan is to purchase cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester O. is 35 years old, single and does not have any children yet. His business is located in Mshomoroni, a residential area in Mombasa. He does carpentry and sells beds and sideboards. He has been in this business for the last two years and has two employees. He sells to local wholesalers and retailers. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is customers not paying their debts on time as per their agreement. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy timber, backboard and nails to meet his customers' needs. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He is very hardworking, honest, determined and self-motivated.

texts.en: B. Godfrey is the leader of this lending group in Rukungiri. He is 37 years old and married with 3 children, all in primary school and he also takes care of other dependents. Godfrey is a boda boda (bicycle taxi) cyclist in Rukungiri, operating from the Bus Park stage for over 5 years. Most of his customers include district officials, local residents and school children. With this clientele, he is able to earn approximately 250,000 UGX as monthly profits, which help with his children’s school fees and general upkeep. Godfrey also has a banana plantation and he is able to sell his produce to merchants. He also has a retail shop that is mostly managed by his wife. He says that it has not been an easy road as he was a security guard before venturing into business. He is such a hardworking and dedicated man and he now owns three motorcycles with the help of loans. He needs a loan to help with upgrading his banana plantation and restocking his retail shop.
