About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase more car electrical equipment

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 54 ans,veuve avec 3 enfants dont l'age varient entre 18 et 24 ans. En 1994  elle perd son mari et pour faire face aux difficultes de sa nouvelle vie de veuve, elle  se lance dans la vente des produits divers avec la somme de 50.000frs qu'on lui avait donnee pour les condeleances lors du deces de son mari
Elle a des revenus de 30000 a 50000 frs par jour, puisque la majorite de ses clients sont ceux les femmes Ouest Africaines tel que les Beninoises,les Maliennes... qui fabriquent du jus de gingembre et le jus de Bissap  et elle s'approvisionne aux grossistes  de la place . Ses fournisseurs de bissap  sont les grossistes aui 
 Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir , elle va acheter des sacs de Bissaps, gingembre, sucre, des aromes , de la vanille et des sacs de farine.
Elle pense agrandir son etalage et faire beaucoup d'epargne pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, prendre en charge les etudes de ses enfants et a la longue acheter un terrain pour ses enfants .
Dans le quartier tout le monde l'apprecie , et est tres celebre dans le grand marche ou elle passe tout son temps.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 54-year old widow, with three children between 18 and 24 years of age. She had lost her husband in 1994 and, in order to adjust to the challenges of her new life as a widow, she launched a business retailing miscellaneous items, using as a starting capital the 50,000 West African francs she had received as condolence gift. Her revenue ranges from 30,000 to 50,000 per day; most of her clients are West African women (coming, for example, from Benin or Mali) who produce ginger juice and bissap [hibiscus] juice. She purchases from local wholesalers. Her bissap suppliers are also wholesalers. With this expected loan, she plans to purchase bags of bissap, ginger, sugar, flavorings, vanilla and bags of flour. She intends to expand her business and put a big part of money away as savings in order to meet her family needs, pay for her children’s education, and, in the long term, purchase a land plot for her children. She is well liked in her neighborhood, and very well known at the big market where she spends all of her time.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of ginger, sugar,bissap,flavorings,vanilla and flour

loans.name: Ines Sylvie

texts.fr:
Femme de 38ans celibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 5ans à 3 mois, 1 enfant est scolarisé. après son bac, n'ayant pas de soutien financier pour poursuivre ses études, elle s'est lancé dans le commerce de petite patisserie depuis 2003.
avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant deux sacs de farine, un sac du sucre,de la levure chimique, dela vanille, des boites de margarine, un sac de 25 kg de sucre, plus un bidon d'huile.

Elle a plusieurs strategies pour faire ecouler sa marchandise; elle fait des livraisons des ses cakes,madeleines, gauffres et brioches dans les boutiques environnants, au marche et elle vend aussi a domicile.
A l'avenir elle pense a ouvrir une patisserie ou elle pourrait employer 2 ou 3 personnes, et vac ses epargnes elle veut soutenir sa famille et les etudes de ses enfants. Femme tres calme, elle a bon temoignage dans son quartier et a l'eglise ou elle communie.
texts.en:
This 38-year-old woman is a single mother of two children, a 3-month-old and a 5-year-old who attends school. After obtaining her bachelor’s degree, she had no financial support to continue with her studies. She started selling small pastries in 2003. She wants to use this loan to strengthen her activities by buying two bags of flour, baking powder, vanilla, containers of margarine, a 25kg bag of sugar, and a can of oil. She uses different strategies for a quick turnover: she delivers her cakes, madeleines, waffles and sweet rolls in the neighboring shops, at the market, and she also sells baked goods from her home. In the future, she plans to open a pastry shop and hire two or three employees. She wants to use her savings to support her family and pay for her children’s tuition. She is a quiet woman with a good reputation around her neighborhood and at the church where she receives communion.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, milk, butter, vanilla, and vanilla sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his shop inventory

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 47 ans, mariee et mere de 4 enfants est en activite depuis son jeune age, quand elle assistait sa mere a vendre , elle prit gout au commerce de la friperie et a l'arret de ses etudes  en classe de troisieme , elle commenca elle meme aussi  a vendre  de la friperie
Elle a une vente journaliere de 25.000 a 30.000frs par jour,et s'approvisionne dans les grands depots et magasins de la place ou chez les grossistes qui vont acheter a Matadi en RDC.
Des que le pret  lui ai octroye, elle compte renforcer son commerce  en achetant des ballots de serviettes, draps, couvre lits et rideaux et peignoirs non utilises
Ses strategies de vente sont tres remarquables, elle fait laver les draps et serviettes non utilises et fait des livraisons  dans les administrations et domiciles  de series de serviettes, et lots de draps classes par rapport a la taille et  aux couleurs
A l'avenir elle pense ouvrir une ou plusieurs boutiques dans les differents quartiers de Brazzaville et cela va l'aider a epargner plus et prendre en charge la scolarite de ses enfants pour qu'ils puissent faire des etudes universitaires
Tres connue dans le quartier, elle fait la fierte de son mari
texts.en:
Adrienne K. is a 47 year-old retailer. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been in business from a young age, when she helped her mother with her sales. She developed a liking for second-hand clothing and at the end of her junior high school studies, she also began to sell secondhand clothing. Her daily sales are from 25,000 to 30,000 francs and she gets her supplies in the storehouses and department stores in the area or from the wholesalers who go to buy in Matadi in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Once the loan is granted, she plans to expand her business by purchasing bundles of unused towels, sheets, bedspreads, curtains and robes. Her sales strategy is very remarkable. She has the unused sheets and towels washed and delivers sets of towels and bundles of sheets sorted by size and color to offices and homes. She is thinking of opening one or more shops in various districts of Brazzaville. That will help her to save more and to provide for the education of her children so that they will be able to get a university education. Very well known in the neighborhood, her husband is proud of her.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of unused towels, sheets, bedspreads, curtains and robes

loans.name: Maranatta Sisters For Development Group

texts.en:
Mercy G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Maranatta Sisters For Development”. She is 35 years old, is single, and has three children who range from 9 to 18 years old. Mercy was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support.

For twenty years, Mercy has been selling cosmetics in Chicken Soup Factory Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,500 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.

Mercy describes herself as a serviceable woman. Her dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Amelia is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia G. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, onions and tomatoes to sell.  Nadia is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil, onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local brew out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Margret is 50 years old and is widowed.   She has 5 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real charcoal store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize, beans, rice and pulses in a little store  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and maize to sell.  Susan is 49 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her little store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and maize to sell

loans.name: Cotton's Business Group

texts.en:
Tenneh J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Cotton's Business”. Tenneh lives in Montserrado County and is served by the Monrovia North branch of this MFI. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two children who range from 18 to 24 years old. Tenneh was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For twenty years, Tenneh has been selling lappas (traditional dress for women), gents’ and ladies’ trousers, blouses, underwear, etc. in Harbel Cotton Tree community, Margibi County, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lappas, gents’ and ladies’ trousers, blouses, underwear, etc.

Tenneh describes herself as easy-going. Her dream is to expand her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, J. T. is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more lappas, gents' and ladies' trousers, blouses, underwear, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia A.  is currently in the business of selling various perfumes, gels and body lotions in the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more perfumes to sell.  Sadia is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

loans.use: Stock more perfumes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more timber to fix beds, chairs and other funiture

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes Group

texts.es:
Este comité sigue desarrollandose dentro del sexto ciclo del programa de comite de mujeres emprendedoras y todas se encuentran muy contentas de estar trabajando muy unidas realizando cada una sus actividades que les ayuda con los gasto especialmente para la alimentación de su familia además de mejorar los ingresos. 
La señora María Dominguez es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de comestibles, tiene su negocio con buena ubicación y bastante demanda, debido a la calidad de sus preparados, su forma de trabajo es la de levantarse muy temprano diariamente para trabajar por sus comestibles con la ayuda de su marido.
Y al amanecer ella se traslada hasta los lugares donde vende sus productos como en las paradas de buses, mercado y otros.
Ella desea incrementar sus ingresos para tener su local propio con más variedad de comidas, así como postres y bebidas.
Invirtirá el dinero en la compra de insumos como carnes, verduras, aceites, arina, arróz, condimentos, etc..
texts.en:
This group continues to demonstrate itself through the sixth cycle of the committee for entrepreneurial women, and all of the members are very happy to be working together to do the things they do to be able to feed their families and increase their incomes. Ms. María Dominguez is one of the members. She sells food and has a business in a good location and there is plenty of demand because of the quality of her items. Each day she arises early every morning to work on her food, with her husband’s help. At dawn she travels to the places where she sells her products; places such as bus stops, markets, and others. She would like to increase her earnings so that she can have her own location with a greater variety of food, such as drinks and desserts. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies, such as meats, vegetables, cooking oils, flour, rice, condiments, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Maxime

texts.fr:
jeune femme de 41 ans; mariee et mere de 3 enfants, dont l'age varie entre 7 et 25 ans.A la fin de ses Etudes universitaires, ne trouvant pas de debouche sur le marche du travail , elle ouvre une boutique pour vendre des habits pour nouveaux nes et autres articles pour bebes.
Elle vend en moyenne 50.000 frs par jour; et s'approvisionne das les grands magasins de la place,a Kinshasha et les grossistes qui vont acheter en Chine et Dubai.
Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir elle va approvisionner son stock en ajoutant des lots de couches, brassieres grenouilleres, draps, biberons, tetines, goupillons...
A l'avenir elle pense etre grossiste en allant meme acheter a l'etranger et fournir chez les vendeurs du marche et les dames qui ont des boutiques.
Tres entreprenante, elle fait de son mieux pour satisfaire sa clientele.
texts.en:
This is a young woman, 41 years old, who is married and a mother of three children, who range from 7 to 25 years of age. With a university-level education, she did not have job opportunities in her field. So she opened a store selling clothing for newborns and other baby items. Her sales average 50,000 francs a day. She gets her supplies locally from major stores, in Kinshasa, and from wholesalers who are going to go to China and Dubai. With this loan that she plans on receiving, she is going to stock up by including batches of diapers, night shirts, bed sheets, baby bottles, pacifiers, bottle brushes…. In the future, she is thinking of being a wholesale merchant by going abroad herself to buy goods for supplying market vendors and ladies who have shops. A very enterprising woman, she does her best to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying baby clothing, bed sheets, shirts, diapers, knit clothing

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Matina de 50 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas  caballeros y niños su puesto de ventas se encuentra en la Terminal de ómnibus  de la ciudad hace mas de 15 años, en el trabajo le ayuda su cónyuge el señor  Carlos de 56 años de edad, a cargo de la pareja  solo se encuentra una hija de 21 años estudiante.
 Comenta que empezó con poca mercadería y se hicieron de capital gracias a un préstamo que se le otorgo actualmente cubre todo los gastos familiares gracias al ingreso diario de las ventas de ropas.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más mercaderías como camperas, medias, bufandas, pantalones y otros, para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene estos prendas de vestir por la temporada fria.
texts.en:
Martina, age 50, is a businesswoman. She sells clothes for women, men, and children. She has been selling at the city’s bus terminal for over 15 years. Her life partner, 56 year old Carlos, helps her with the work. The couple only has one daughter under their care. She is 21 years old and goes to school. Matina comments that she started with little merchandise. Her capital grew thanks to a loan she received. She now covers all of the family expenses thanks to the daily income from the clothing sales. She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise like jackets, hosiery, scarves, pants, and others. She wants to do this in order to satisfy the great demand there is for these articles of clothing for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get seasonal cothes wholesale to sell retail:  jackets, hosiery, scarves, pants, t-shirts, and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Hawa S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Unity. She is 33 years old, widowed and has two children who range from 10 to 12 years old. She was only able to attend school through seventh grade due to lack of financial support.

For five years, she has been selling plantains and bananas in New Georgia Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more plantains and bananas. She describes herself as a caring mother.

Her dream is to improve her business, make a profit, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and bananas

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has nine children. They live in Twalatwal, a neighborhood in Belo Sub-Division, Boyo Division, Cameroon. The fact that Margaret never went to school has made life very difficult for her. She is unable to assist her husband in paying tuition fees for her children and also she is unable to raise money that can be used as take-off capital in her farm. With all these difficulties she decided to look for a way to find this capital. She decided to join GHAPE. This is Margaret's first loan, and this loan will help provide capital, thus increase her income and the well-being of her family. 

With the loan, Margaret plans to rent farmland for 25,000 FCFA, buy three tins of beans seedlings for 21,000 FCFA and 4,000 FCFA will be used to pay for labour that will assist her in the farm. She knows this business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time.

With the profits from this loan, Margaret will assist her husband to construct a house for the family. She will also pay tuition fees for her children and ensure that they are well prepared for school. She will also provide good food for her family.  Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner. 
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: seedlings, rent farm land, and pay for labor

loans.name: Eduardo José

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo  de 22 años de edad es comerciante, cuenta con una pequeña micro industria familiar en su casa, prepara productos de limpieza como detergentes, lavandinas, suavizantes, desodorante de ambiente y otros. 
Empezó gracias a la ayuda  económica de sus padres, actualmente trabaja por su cuenta.
 
El mismo se encarga de la comercialización de sus productos por la zona, para lo cual necesita de mas capital para trabajar mejor, ha aumento notablemente su clientela, confía en Fundación Paraguaya, y se siente seguro para lograr todos sus desafíos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 22 years old. He is a merchant who runs a small business out of his home, where he prepares cleaning products, such as laundry detergents, bleach, fabric softeners, household deodorants, and others. He started this business with his parents’ financial help and now he works on his own. He takes care of making sales within his zone and needs to increase his working capital in order to be able to work better, since he has noticeably increased his number of customers. He trusts Fundación Paraguaya and feels confident that he will be able to meet all of his challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with nine children and they live in Twalatwal, a neighborhood in Belo Sub-Division, Cameroon. Poverty has been the main cause of problems in her family. In order to solve some of these problems, she decided to became a GHAPE member. This is Regina's first loan. She is very interested in the activities of GHAPE.   

This loan will help her rent  farmland for 10,000 FCFA, buy Irish potato seedlings for 20,000 FCFA, and also buy bean seedlings for 20,000 FCFA. She knows this business will succeed because the land where she will carry out her farming is still very fertile and her community will provide a ready market for her farm produce when it is ready.  
 
With the profits from this loan, Josephine F. will open a workshop for her daughter. She will also pay her children’s and the children of her late sister's tuition fees and ensure that they are well prepared for school. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner. 
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: seedlings, rent farmland and to pay for labour

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité KHADIM RASSOUL est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI. Il est composé de 30 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Et se sont organisées par affinité. 

Le groupe a comme responsable Madame NDOUMBE S. W.. Elle se trouve debout à l'extrême droite de la photo. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. 

Elle fabrique et vend des jus de fruits naturels. Par ailleurs, elle fait de l'embouche ovine.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des condiments pour la fabrique de ses jus de fruits naturels et d'acheter également 02  moutons.

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de la famille, par la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Solidarity group KHADIM RASSOUL was created on December 30, 2009. It's part of the "Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI". It is composed of 30 women, all from the same village. They are grouped by affinity. Mrs. NDOUMBE S. W. is the head of the group. She's standing on the far right in the picture. She's 56 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She prepares and sells natural fruit juice. She also raises sheep. Her new loan will enable her to buy ingredients to prepare her natural fruit juices, and to buy two sheep. Her goal is to bolster her savings and to help paying her family's food and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare natural fruit juices, and to buy two sheep

loans.name: Wilfrid

texts.fr:
jeune homme de 31 ans, celibataire et père d'1 enfant de 5 ans.Apres sa licence n'ayant pas des moyens pour prolonger ses etudes et n'ayant pu postuler dans une entreprise de la place, il ouvre une boutique d'alimentation en 2008.

Son revenu moyen est de 100000f par jour. Avec ce prêt il compte renforcer ses produits de premiere necessite de son alimentation comme un sac de sucre roux,un sac de sucre blanc, des cartons de lait, des boîtes de conserves,carton de beurre,et tous produits que l'on consomme regulierement dans son alimentation.

Pour faire avancer son activité il épargne souvent, s'efforce à avoir les produits, faire  un bon accueil  a ses clients parce qu'il a pour vision d'être grossiste dans les jours avenirs.

IL veut à la longue construire une maison  pour sa famille et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et mettre ses enfants dans mes meilleures écoles.
texts.en:
This is a young man, aged 31, who is unmarried and the father of a 5-year-old child. After receiving his degree, he could not afford continuing his education. And unable to apply for a position in a local company, he opened a grocery store two years ago. His average revenues amount to 100,000 francs per day. With this loan, he intends to bolster his supply of basic necessities, such as brown sugar, white sugar, canned foods, butter, and any typical consumer product in his store. To advance his business, he often saves and strives to offer these goods in order to accommodate his customers well, since his vision is to be a wholesale merchant in the days to come. Over time, he wants to build a house to improve his family's living conditions and to put his children into the best schools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying milk, butter, sugar, canned foods, margarine

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señora Calixta Zoraida  quien invito a  sus vecinas para formar parte del comite D. mujeres emprendedoras y todas encantadas aceptaron conformar el comite Nombrandolo Comité Santa Librada.

El comité cuenta con veinte miembros en donD. la mayoria se dedica a realizar bordados en Ao-po´i, confeccionando ya sea camisas, manteles y muchas otras creaciones que son heredadas D. sus madres, abuelas, pasando estos conocimientos D. generación en generación. 

Calixta Zoraida  G. que vive en Mbocayaty se dedican a la artesania o pequeños comercios D. ropas y productos artesanales en Ao Po-í; vestimentas, manteles, mantas, adornos, etc.

Por la calidad D. sus productos, le resulta bastante productiva la venta D. los mismos y desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando el negocio mediante la adquisición D. más materiales para su elaboración así como muebles utilizados para la exposición.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Calixto Zoraida. She invited her neighbors to become part of a group of enterprising women. All of them were delighted to accept, and they formed the communal bank. They named it the Santa Librada Communal Bank. The group has twenty members. Most of them make “Ao-po´i” (traditional Paraguayan needlework). They make shirts, blankets, and other creations that they inherited from their mothers and grandmothers. This knowledge was passed on from generation to generation. Calixta Zoraida G. lives in Mbocayaty. She devotes herself to handicrafts and small businesses, which deal with clothing and products that are crafted in Ao Po-í. Some of those items are garments, table cloths, blankets, and decorations, etc. Her sales are good because of the quality of her products. She wishes to increase her income by expanding the business. She will do this by getting more materials to work on like furniture, which will be used for display.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Ao Po-í fabric to make their embroidersed tableclothes and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man and has 2 young children; he is from Lebanon. For the past 22 years, he has been working in a car repair shop. He is the main provider for his wife and kids. He works hard to earn the profit needed to pay for his children's schooling. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. It will be his second loan and is intended to buy additional spare parts and motor oils required by his clients. In the future, he is looking to continue the expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: buy additional spare parts and motor oils

loans.name: Laure Rachel Estelle

texts.fr:
Femme couturière de 38 ans célibataire avec 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 7 et 21 ans.
Quand elle finit sa formation en Coupe et Couture, sa mère lui fait  cadeau d’une machine à coudre   et elle ouvre un atelier de couture en 1996. Elle a une forte clientèle et elle a en moyenne 45000 a 50000 Frs par jour des recettes.
 Avec le prêt qu’elle compte recevoir elle  va acheter des tissus et pagnes  et faire des camisoles, des chemises, des ensembles dames qu’elle va  vendre à ses clients et en dehors de cela il y a aussi les commandes de clientes qu’elle reçoit chaque jour.
Les difficultés qu’elle rencontre se situent  dans l’accumulation des commandes et les clients qui ne respectent pas leur rendez vous.
A l’avenir elle pense ouvrir une école de couture pour la réinsertion des jeunes filles mères et les aider a la longue à se prendre en charge
Elle pense aussi continuer ses cours de designer pour être modéliste et faire des défiles de mode dans le futur.
texts.en:
This is a seamstress, aged 38, who is unmarried. She has three children, who range from 7 to 21 years of age. When she finished her training in the tailoring trade, her mother gave her a sewing machine as a gift. She opened a workshop in 1996. She has a strong customer base and has an average income of 45,000 to 50,000 francs CFA per day. With this loan that she plans on receiving, she is going to purchase some fabrics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to make camisoles, shirts, and women's outfits that she will sell to her customers. Beyond this, there are special orders from customers she receives each day. The difficulties she encounters involve the accumulation of orders, and the customers do not keep their appointments. In the future, she is thinking of opening a sewing school for re-integrating young mothers into the working world and for helping them to support themselves eventually. She is also thinking of continuing with her design courses in order to be a designer and to put on fashion shows in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics, yardage, traditional cloths, thread, lace, linings

loans.name: Marina Landrine

texts.fr:
femme de 30ans, celibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age vari de 7ans à 5ans tous scolarisé, ayant 2 personnes à charges.ayant un niveau scolaire secondaire, elle debute son commerce comme gerante dans une boutique en 2000 et se lança dans la vente de friperie en 2005. sa recette journalière varie de 7000frs)à 20000frs .

elle veut renforcer son activité avec ce prêt en achetant des balons de t-chirt,de serviette,de gean's .
sa strategie est de mieux sa marchandise afin de satisfaire ses clients, avoir un bon étallage.

elle veut être grossiste dans les jours futur afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, aider ses enfants à prosperer dans les études.dans son quartier elle est l'exemple des femmes ambitieuses à encourager.
texts.en:
Marina Landrine N. N. is 30 years old, unmarried and the mother of two children whose ages range from 5 to 7 years. Both of the children are in school and in her care. With a middle school education, she started in business in 2000 as a manager in a shop and went into secondhand clothing sales in 2005. Her daily revenue ranges from 7,000 to 20,000 francs. She wants to expand her business with this loan by purchasing bundles of t-shirts, towels and jeans. Her strategy is to have better merchandise in order to satisfy her customers and to have a good display. She wants to be a wholesaler in the future so as to better improve the living conditions of her family and to help her children prosper in their studies. In her neighborhood she is a model of an ambitious woman to encourage.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of shirts, towels and t-shirts

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es: Sergio Alberto de 64 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Sergio se dedica a la venta de madera, la venta está ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido, ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre apreciar los productos de él. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que Sergio solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de maderas para la elaboración de sus productos, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y así contar con una vida mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Alberto is 64 years old. He has five children, and they all work independently. Sergio sells wood, and this business is located at his house. The location is very good for sales because it is in a very busy place. He has many customers who always value his products. The business is very stable. Serio is requesting a loan because he wants to be able to increase his inventory. He will buy a greater variety of wood in order to make his products. All of this is because he wants to improve his sales. That way he and his family will have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mwinda Plus Group

texts.en:
Erick B., aged 27, is the president of the Community Bank “Mwinda Plus,” which is composed of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Erick is single. He sells second-hand clothing. He has been in business since 2001. He manages his business in his area located the center-east of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received one loan and has repaid it properly. He intends to use the next loan to expand the inventory of his business by buying a bundle of used clothing to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of US$ 30. His ambition is to open a general store.

loans.use: increasing his inventory by buying a bundle of used clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Clémentine  Flavie

texts.fr:
femme de 38 ans, marié et mère d'un enfant agée de 18 ans scolariser et ayant 5 personnes en charge.ayant quitter ses études en terminale elle se lance dans la restauration en 2000, sa recette est de 10000frs minimun par jour.
avec se prêt elle aimerai renforcer son activité en achetant de la boissons gaseuze et des vivres frais et du de restauration comme des assietes, poisson salé, poisson fumé,légume, feuille de manioc, manioc,haricot,riz,huile et bien d'autres condiments.
comme strategie elle s'efforce à améliorer la qualité de sa cuisine pour mieux attirer les clients et aussi épargner chaque jour apres la vente.
elle veut ouvrir  dans  futur en ayant un grand restaurant  plus moderne, avoir une maison et surtout soutenir sa fille à faire ses études de médecine, son restaurant  est tres populaire ,   car elle reçoit beaucoup des gens chez elle et est très acceuillante.
texts.en:
This is a 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of an 18-year-old child in school. She has five people to support. Having dropped out of school in her last year of high school, she got started in the restaurant business in 2000. Her income amounts to 10,000 francs minimum per day. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business by buying carbonated soft drinks, fresh provisions, and restaurant goods, such as plates, salted fish, smoked fish, vegetables, cassava leaves, cassava, beans, rice, oil, and many other condiments. As a strategy, she strives to improve the quality of her cooking in order to attract more customers and also to save money each day after the sales are made. In the future, she wants to open a big restaurant that is more modern, to have a house, and especially to support her daughter in studying medicine. Her restaurant is very popular, since many people go there, and she is very welcoming.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Amabengeza Group

texts.fr:
Josiane D.  est une femme de 30 ans, née à Nyamata, province de l’Est du Rwanda. Elle est mariée et à trois enfants, le moins âgée a  7 mois et le plus âgée à 4 ans, 2 parmi ses enfants sont allé à l’école. Josiane avec sa famille habite Gisenyi.

Concernant son activité, elle est commerçante des produits alimentaires  comme riz, haricot, huile, sorgho,…. elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce domaine.
Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le deuxième, le précédent lui a aide d’ameliorer son business de commerce ambulant et payer le loyer pour sa famille qui habite a Nyamata
Dans l’avenir, elle pourra avoir un nouveau prêt bien d’un gros montant pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires ainsi elle pourra acheter ou bâtit sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Josiane D. is a 30-year-old woman who was born in Nyamata, in East Province, Rwanda. She is married and has three children, of whom the youngest is 7 months old, and the oldest is 4 yours old. Two of her children are attending school. Josiane lives with her family in Gisenyi. Regarding her business, Josiane is a merchant selling foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, oil, sorghum… She has two years of experience in this domain. The loan signed with the micro-finance institution ACB is the second one. The previous one helped her to improve her itinerant business and to pay the rent for her family living in Nyamata. In the future, she will be able to obtain a much larger loan to increase her sales. Thus, she will be able to buy or to build her own house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beans, rice, sorghum for retail sale in her store

loans.name: Thès  Jarrel

texts.fr:
jeune commerçant de 24ans, celibataire et père d'un enfant agé de 4ans.Ayant fini ses étude  secondaire et n'ayant plus de soutien il débute son commerce avec la vente de boissons en 2007 avec un capital de 150.000  et se lance dans l'alimentation en 2008. sa revenu journalier est de 35000frs à 40000frs.

Avec ce prêt il aimerait agrandir son ativité en achétant des cartons de lait,de bôite de conserve.
Malgré les difficultés d'ouvrir tôt et de refermer tard son alimentation,il à pour strategie, d'ouvrir tôt afin d'être fidele à l'acceuil de ses clients, ouvrir un bon service, bien évaluer ses marchandises. 
 il veut epargner de jour en jour pour atteindre son but.

il se bat pour l'epanouissement de sa famille et que ses enfants vivent dans des meilleures conditions. c'est un jeune qui est connu dans son quartier du petit au pus grand grâce à ses exploits.
texts.en:
This is a young merchant, 24 years old, unmarried, and the father of a 4-year-old child. Having finished middle school but having no more support, he started his business selling beverages in 2007 with 150,000 francs in capital. He launched his grocery store in 2008. His daily revenues amount to 35,000 to 40,000 francs. With this loan, he would like to expand his business by buying boxes of milk and canned foods. Despite the difficulties of opening his store early and closing late, his strategy is to open early in order to accommodate his customers faithfully, to provide good service, and to price his merchandise well. He wants to save money each and every day to achieve his goal. He struggles, so that his family may come into its own and so that his children may live under the best conditions. He is a young person who is known in his district by everyone from kids to older people, thanks to his accomplishments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying milk, canned foods, sacks of sugar, butter, margarine

loans.name: Marie Irène Ida

texts.fr:
femme de 48 ans, celibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varient entre 22 à 10 ans.Ayant quitter sa scolarite tôt par manque de soutien financier elle s'est lancé dans le commerce de vente des ustentils de plastiques,des sous vêtements,des bombons, biscuits en 1990 afin de palier à la crise financière et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.son revenu journalier vari de 15000frs à 20000frs.

avec ce prêt elle compte renforce son activiter en achetant des plastiques tel que des paniers, des cuvettes, des bassines, des bols,sceaux, des cucreries(bombons,biscuits kwik, biscuit telephonne, biscuit chocolat),des mèches(pony,afro,darling,x-pression, olive et des mèches angaise),des sous vêtements( slip,soutien) et bien d'autres choses.

sa strategie est de bien ranger son étalage afin de mieux attirer ses clients, le bon acceuil,et épargner du jour au jour.

 elle a pour vision d'avoir une grande boutique dans le  futur, s'acqueruir un terrain et mettre ses enfants dans des bonnes conditions.Elle est un bon exemple des femmes de son quartier.
texts.en:
This 48-year-old woman is a single mother of five children whose ages range from 10 to 22 years old. She had to quit school early on for lack of financial support. She started selling plastic cutlery, underwear, candy and cookies in 1990 in order to deal with the financial crisis and provide for the needs of her family. Her daily income varies from 15,000 to 20,000 francs. With this loan, she plans to boost her business by purchasing plastic items such as baskets, bowls, basins, bowls, buckets, as well as sweets (candy, cookies), hair extensions (pony, Afro, darling, x-pression, olive, English), underwear (slips, bras) and many other things.Her strategy is to set up an appealing display of her merchandise to attract customers, to give them a proper greeting, and to accumulate daily savings. For the future, she plans to open a big shop, get a piece of land, and provide good living conditions for her children. She is a good representation of the women in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cutlery, plastic chairs and tables, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to a taxi driver; they have three children and all their children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a stall in Nakulabye selling second-hand clothes.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and uses public transport to and from shopping. 

Margaret has been in this clothing business for years.  She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Margaret goes for shopping once a week. She works six days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation  of bales of clothes from Owino to her stall in Nakulabye.  She is aspiring of improving her standard of living and even starting importing clothes from Dubai.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital.   She resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr:
Femme couturière de 43 ans, mariée  et mère des 4 enfants dont l’age varient entre 4 et 18 ans, elle s’est  lancé dans la couture  il y a  bientôt 20ans, après sa formation elle  se spécialise dans la couture et broderie des draps des nouveaux nés.         
Elle achète des rouleaux des tissus  popelines de différents couleurs comme le rose, le bleu, le blanc et les tissus fleuris, avec sa machine elle couds 10 a 15 draps par jour et les emballe dans des sachets en plastique et va déposer les exposer dans une boutique pour les vendre.
Elle vend en moyenne 25000 Frs par jour et par moment elle livre ses draps dans les martenites de la place.
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter des rouleaux de popelines de différentes couleurs pour commencer les draps non seulement pour les nouveaux nés mais aussi des séries des lits de différente taille (single bed, King bed) pour les adultes.
Très entreprenante, elle fait la fierté de son mari et ses enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is a seamstress, 43 years old and married, the mother of four children whose ages vary between four and 18 years. She began working as a seamstress almost 20 years ago, after she finished her training. She is specialized in sewing and embroidering sheets for newborns. She buys bolts of poplins in various colors such as pink, blue, white and flowered fabric and with her sewing machine, she sews 10 to 15 sheets per day and wraps them in plastic before displaying them for sale in a shop. She makes sales of an average of 25,000 francs per day and sometimes she makes sheets for local birthing centers. With the loan she intends to buy bolts of different colored poplins in order to begin making sheets, not only for newborns but also sets of sheets in various sizes (single bed, King size) for adults. A very enterprising person, she is the pride and joy of her husband and children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of poplin to make sheets for newborns and adults

loans.name: Marble

texts.en:
Marble is married with five children and all her children have attended school.  None of her children currently goes to school, they all finished their education. She also takes care of additional family members.  

Marble changed her business enterprise from selling cold drinks to a shoe business. She has been in this business for a few months and she is now proud of this business. She buys bales of second-hand shoes from shops in Nabugabo and Owino market and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale.  Besides this shoe business she also sells piped water and hires out her sewing machine at   2000 per day. 

Marble owns a stall   in Kawempe where she sells her shoes.  Her business challenges include defaulters, ever increasing prices of second-hand shoes, and transportation of bales of shoes from Nabugabo to her stall in Kawempe. She works seven days a week.  

Marble is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she can get enough profit to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT because she could get loans without any collateral and the loans are timely. She resides in and   owns a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Patricia de 31 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella tiene un restaurante de comida típica. 

La mama de Patricia era empleada de un restaurante y como no tenia donde dejar a sus hijos los llevaba con ella al trabajo, cuando Patricia creció decidió tener su propio puesto de comidas, poco a poco lo convirtió en un restaurante, ahora ella trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 14h00pm todos los días, sus hermanas le ayudan a cocina mientras que otras reparten la comida.      

Para poder continuar con el negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un congelador y así mantener las carnes y vegetales fríos. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta.
texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). She has a restaurant where she serves traditional food.

Patricia’s mother was employed at a restaurant, so she brought her children with her to work since she did not anywhere to leave them. When Patricia became old enough, she started her own food stand. Over time she converted her business into a restaurant. Now she works every day from 5am to 2pm. Her sisters help in the kitchen while she has other employees who serve the food.

To continue her business, Patricia will use her loan to buy a freezer for keeping meats and frozen vegetables. In the future, she wants to buy a truck.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
femme de 33ans,mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie de15ans à 16 mois et a 3 personnes à sa charge, ayant quittee sa scolarité tôt après le deces de son père,étant ainé elle se lanca dans la coiffure en 1995. son revenu journaliere  est de 10000frs par jour.
Avec ce prêt elle aimerai agrandir son activité en achetant des produits cosmétiques tel que des defrisants, des demelants, des bigoudis, des mèches(pony,anglaise,olive), des filets et pinces à cheveux et d'autre produits de première necessité.
sa strategie est de faire  des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans son salon de coiffure.
Son  ambition est  d'aller acheter les produits de cheveux à l'étranger et être grossiste car elle pense beaucoup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa mère et de ses frères. son entourage est content d'elle car elle se debrouille bien.
texts.en:
Blandine is a 33 year old mother of two children aged 15 years and 16 months, who also cares for 3 other people. She had to quit school soon after her father died, since she was the eldest in her family. In 1995, she started hairdressing, and her daily income is 10,000 francs. With this loan, she would like to grow her business by buying cosmetics such as hair straighteners, detangler, curlers and extensions (ponytails, ringlets, Olive brand), hair nets and clips, and other essential items. Her strategy is to promote her products, have reasonable prices and keep the best products in her salon. Her ambition is to someday go overseas to buy hair products and become a bulk seller since she believes this would very much improve living conditions for her mother and brothers. Her friends and family are proud of her because she is very resourceful.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products (hair extensions, straighteners, detangler)

loans.name: Jenny Yadira

texts.es:
Jenny de 35 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia y tener una mejor estabilidad económica, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería.. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h30pm todos los días.  

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, libros y papelería, en el futuro quiere que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Jenny is 35 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). She has a stationery shop in her home where she sells beverages, paper, and notebooks. In Ecuador, this type of store is called a bazaar. To restock her business, she plans to use her loan to buy notebooks, books, and paper. In the future, she hopes to see her two children successfully finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, books, and paper

loans.name: Las Alfareras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Alfareras. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 1er. Préstamo con Fundación Realidad.
El representante del grupo es la señorita Pompilia T. A. tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria obteniendo su certificado de primaria, Ella es soltera no tiene hijos y se dedica a la Alfarería y necesita el préstamo para comprar barro, leña, greta, celite, pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros en varios tamaños y modelos. Ella desde muy pequeña le gusto ayudarle a su papa con el trabajo y le fue enseñando como se trabaja el barro, tiene en el negocio 15 años y  participan en el la elaboración de sus productos, su papá, su mamá y su hermano unos cortan el barro, otros lo machucan y otro va poniendo las cintas, las asas y las orillas a las cazuelas, ollas y jarros. Ella considera importante su negocio porque de ahí tienen ingresos para los gastos de su casa, la alimentación  y para ir ahorrando para seguir comprando la  materia prima este negocio ya viene de familia, pues se a trabajado por generaciones en la alfarería, le proporciona gran satisfacción ver sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros ya terminados por que se ven muy bonitos, o cuando los clientes les dicen que están muy bonito. Ellos llevan sus productos a vender a la plaza de  Ozumba los martes. Y también a Tonatico, estado de México, se enfrenta mucha competencia pues éstos son lugares donde especialmente se vende alfarería, lo bueno es que la señorita Pompilia ya tiene clientes que solo le compran a ella por su calidad, buen precio y buen servicio, las ganancias que obtienen son para comprar mas barro, leña y va guardando para pagar los gastos de la casa. Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla es un pueblo bonito hay árboles, campo, siembran sorgo, milpa, cacahuate y utilizan para trabajar en el campo los burros, caballos, mulas utilizan las yuntas de bueyes para arar sus tierras, sus calles pavimentadas, algunas con adoquín o cemento, también hay una fiesta del barrio Santiago el 25 de Julio celebran misa, procesión, queman castillo, hay baile, chinelos y comida para todos los que van a la fiesta del barrio Santiago. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar una camioneta para transportar el barro, la leña y también su mercancía que van a vender a Tonatico Estado de México.
Las integrantes del grupo son Fidelia M. P. y va a comprar con su préstamo barro, greta, celite y pintura para elaborar sus ollas y cazuelas, la Señora Jaime T. Martínez va a comprar barro, Tierra blanca para elaborar sus macetas rusticas, La señora Gregoria M. H. va a comprar greta, leña, barro, etc. para elaborar sus cazuelas, la señorita Pompilia T. A. va a comprar barro, greta, leña, celite, pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros, la señora Virginia B. B. va a compra barro para elaborar sus cazuelas.
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “agradecerles que confían en nosotros y si vamos a cumplir con el pago, para que nos vuelvan a prestar.”
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Alfareras ["The Potters"]. It is located in the community of Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The group is made up of 5 members who know each other because they are neighbours. This is their first loan with Fundacion Realidad. The representative of the group is Miss Pompilia T. A., age 37, who studied until the 6th grade and obtained her primary certificate. She is single and has no children. She is a potter and needs a loan to purchase clay, firewood, lead, celite, and paint for decorating her pans, pots and jars of various sizes and models. From a very young age she has enjoyed helping her father with this work, and he taught her how to work with clay. She has been in this business for 15 years and her father, mother and brother are involved in the making of the products. Some will cut the clay, others will crush it and others put on the plaster, handles and edges of the pans, pots and jars. She considers her business to be important because it generates the income for her household costs, food and savings to continue purchasing materials. This is a family business; generations of her family have worked in pottery. She takes great satisfaction in seeing her completed pans, pots and jars because they are very beautiful; and she gets great satisfaction when her customers say that they are beautiful. They bring their products to sell in the Ozumba plaza on Tuesdays, and also in Tonatico, in the state of Mexico. They have much competition since these are locations where much pottery is offered for sale. The good thing is that Pompilia already has customers who only buy from her because of her quality, good price and good service. Her earnings are used to purchase more clay and firewood, and she saves to cover her household costs. Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla is a very beautiful village. There are trees and fields, and they sow sorghum, corn, and peanuts and use donkeys, horses and mules to work in the fields. They use yoked oxen to plough the land. There are paved roads, some with cobblestone and some cement. They have a festival in the neighbourhood of Santiago on July 25th where they celebrate mass, have a procession, and set off fireworks. There is dancing, the Chinelos [a traditional Mexican dance] and food for all who go to the Santiago neighbourhood party. Pompilia and her family dream and hope to purchase a truck to transport the clay, firewood and their merchandise for sale to Tonatico in the state of Mexico. The group members are: Fidelia M. P., who will use her loan to purchase clay, lead, celite and paint to make her pots and pans; Mrs Jaime T. M., who will purchase clay and ceramic to make her rustic flowerpots; Mrs Gregoria Montano H., who will purchase lead, firewood, clay etc for the making of her pans; Pompilia T. A., who will purchase clay, lead, firewood, celite and paint to make her pans, pots and jars; and Mrs Virginia B., who will purchase clay to make her pans. The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundacion Realidad "thank you for your confidence in us, and we will repay the loan so that you will lend to us again".

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clay, firewood, lead, celite and paint for making pots, pans and jars

location.town: Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, estado de Puebla

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fátima del Rosario M. N., tiene la edad de 47 años vive en el Barrio Nindiri, es casado y su esposo labora como chofer apoyándole en los gastos que se incurren mensualmente tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que estudian y apoyan a sus padres en las actividades del hogar y la finca.

Ellos se dedican a la Agricultura, desde hace 15 años, fue gracias  al apoyo de sus suegros que lograron incursionar en esta actividad que ha sido la fuente de ingresos de la familia durante todos estos años, es ahora que ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que le permitan brindarle un mantenimiento a sus terrenos para que se produzca a futuro una mejor cosecha, esta inversión les permitirá mejores condiciones económicas, que favorecerán el desarrollo económico a la familia y sobre todo a sus hijos que están iniciándose en el mundo universitario, así mismo como proyectos familiares para el bienestar de todos.
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario M. N. is 47 and lives in the Nindiri neighbourhood. She is married, and her husband works as a driver, helping her with their monthly costs. They have 3 grown children who study and support their parents in the household and farm activities. They have been farmers for 15 years. It was thanks to the support of their parents that they were able to enter into this activity which has been the source of their family's income for all these years. They are now requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural materials which will permit them to maintain their lands so that they produce a better harvest in the future. This investment will allow them better economic conditions, which will help the economic development of the family and above all of their children who are joining the world of university. It will also help with family projects for the well-being of all.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purcahse of agricultural materials that will allow them to maintain their lands so that they produce a better harvest in the future

loans.name: Idania Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Idania del Socorro R. A., tiene la edad de 33 años vive en el Barrio Buenos Aires es casada y su esposo labora como cobrador, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos uno menor de edad y el otro adolecente, los cuales se dedican a los estudios de primaria y secundaria respectivamente.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace 6 años, esta actividad se ha incrementado debido a la buena acogida de parte de la población por la crisis que afecta el bolsillo domestico y se recurre a la compra de ropa de segundo uso, fue gracias a al apoyo de su esposo que comenzó en este negocio y a futuro espera la apertura de una tienda en el centro comercial de Ticuantepe municipio de la capital, el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería e incrementar de esta forma los volúmenes de venta para llevar a cabo sus planes evolutivos para su empresa, que conllevara a futura a una mejor estabilidad económico-social de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Idania del Socorro R. A., age 33, is married and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. Her husband works as a fare collector, and his income helps with the household finances. They have two children. One is a minor and in elementary school. The other child is an adolescent, and he is in high school. She has been selling second hand clothes for six years. This activity has increased because of how well it is received by the population. This is due to the domestic economic crisis; people are buying second hand clothes. She started this business thanks to her husband’s support. In the future she plans on opening a store in the commercial center of the Ticuantepe municipality in the capital. She will use the loan to buy a greater inventory of merchandise. That way she will increase her sales volume in order to complete her progressive plans for her business. In the future this will bring better socioeconomic stability for all of the members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Gilberto Crispín

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto es soltero de 33 años y tiene una hija de 1 año, tiene un estudio de serigrafía hace 5 años, el cual cuenta con una ubicación muy estratégica, pues, esta ubicado frente a un comercial muy concurrida, el cual facilita que se conozca  su negocio. Cuenta con una vasta clientela quines gustan mucho de sus trabajos por la calidad de las mismas.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar pinturas, plásticos y resma de papel ya que, además, de su servició de serigrafía también realiza fotocopias para tener un ingreso agregado.

Su máximo sueño es tener su propio local, para lo cual necesita incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Gilberto is 33 years old, single, and has a one year old daughter. Five years ago, he opened a silk screening business in a very strategic location on the opposite side of a busy shopping center. This enables his business to be easily recognized. He has a list of clients who are fans of the quality of his work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paints, plastic, and reams of paper. In addition to silk screening, he also provides photocopying services to generate extra revenue.

His greatest dream is to have his own location where he can increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase screen printing & photocopying supplies

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
Femme de 32ans, celibataire et mère d'un enfant agée d'une annee,  ayant arrete  ses études en terminale et n'ayant plus de soutien financier elle se lance dans le commerce en 2009. son revenu varie de 8000frs à 10000frs par jour.
A l'octroi de son pret , elle compte approvisionner son stock en ajoutant des cartons de viande, poissons frais,volailles, condiments, cartons de tomate ,bidon d'huile...
Elle s'approvisionne dans les chambres froides et marches de la place, toujours pret a reserver un bon accueil a ses clients, offrrir ses meilleurs services, faire des prix abordables, et respecter les heures d'ouverture de son resto.
Elle l'avenir elle pense ouvrir un grand restaurant et epargner plus, pour  soutenir son enfant et acheter un terrain .
texts.en:
Estelle Rajy B. is 32 years old, single, and mother of a one-year old child. Having stopped her studies in final year of secondary school and being without financial support she threw herself into commerce in 2009. Her income varies from 8000 frs to 10000frs a day. When granted a loan, she intends to increase her supplies and buy meat, fresh fish, poulty, condiments, boxes of tomatoes, cans of oil etc. She gets her supplies from the local coldrooms and markets, and always offers a warm welcome to her clients, providing the best service at affordable prices, and respecting the opening hours of her small restaurant. In the future she would like to open a big restaurant and save more, to support her child and buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat des cartons de poissons, viande, volailles,

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria Haidee tiene 1hijo que se encuentra de 9 meses pues está bajo su cuidado. Desde hace 4 años cuando empezó la venta de cosméticos, con iniciativa propia pues en la comarca donde vive no existen muchas personas que se dedica a este tipo de actividad. El avance de su negocio ha sido su desafío constante, pues vive sola y sostiene su hogar con este negocio y dinero. En la actualidad solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de lápiz, labial, perfumes, cremas tratamientos y ropa interior, que es lo que más compra su clientela. Su deseo es que  su negocio pueda crecer cada día más tener si propio local.
texts.en:
Maria Haidee has a 9 month old son in her care. Four years ago, she took the initiative to start her own business selling cosmetics since there were no other people in the area engaged in this same activity. Making progress in her business is a constant challenge since she lives alone and relies on her income to maintain her household.

At the moment, Maria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of eye pencils, lipsticks, perfumes, crèmes, treatments, and undergarments since these items are the most requested by her customers. Her wish is to grow her business each day until she is able to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eye pencils, lipsticks, perfumes, crèmes, treatments, and undergarments

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 54 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants, dont l’age varient entre 22 ans et 19 ans.En classe de première ,quand elle perd ses parents par manque de soutien , elle se lance dans le commerce des poissons fumes.
Elle a une recette journalière de 30000  a 50000frs par jour, elle s’approvisionne 
Dans les marches intérieures du pays  ou les villages riverains ou l’activité principale est la pêche des poissons du fleuve
Avec le prêt qu’elle compte recevoir elle va acheter  5 paniers de Mboto (gros carpes) ,10 paniers de silures (Ngolo) et 8 paniers de lamproie ou anguilles (Nzombo), poissons très consommes dans les familles congolaises.

Avec le temps, elle a des projets d’élargir en  ouvrant un  grand dépôt de poissons, avoir des fournisseurs riverains qui viendront livrer des paniers de poissons sur place au lieu d’effectuer des voyages par pirogues chaque semaine.
Plus elle va accroître son stock, plus les bénéfices seront énormes pour accroître  son épargne et cela va la permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille  et les pousser a faire des grandes études.
texts.en:
Rosalie M. is 54 years old, single and mother of 2 children aged between 19 and 22. In her second last year of high school she lost parents and due to lack of support started a business selling smoked fish. She has a daily revenue of 30000 to 50000 and gets her supplies from the inland markets or from the riverside villages where fishing is the principal activity. With the loan she hopes to receive, she will buy 5 baskets of Mboto (large carp). 10 baskets of brown bullheads (Ngolo) and 8 baskets of sea lamprey or eel (Nzombo), all heavily consumed fish in Congolese familiies. In time, she has plans to expand and to open a large fish outlet, and have the riverside suppliers deliver their baskets of fish rather than her having to make the trip by canoe each week. The more she increases her stock, the greater her profits will be, enabling her to increase her savings and in turn provide for her family and put her children through tertiary level education.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de paniers de poissons fumes de carpes, anguilles,silures

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat des t shirts; pantalon; curottes;...en vu de les detailler

loans.name: Fanny Vladys

texts.es:
Fanny de 45 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella vende productos químicos, como shampoo, desinfectante, etc. 

Cuando se separo de su esposo ella decidió continuar con el negocio de químicos que los dos habían empezado, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Ella hace shampoo, desinfectante, aromatizante, y los llena en envases plásticos. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mas químicos para hacer sus productos, en el futuro quiere tener su propia distribuidora de químicos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Fanny is 45 years old and lives along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a periurban area that is surrounded by a salt marsh). She sells chemical household products such as shampoos, disinfectants, etc.

When she separated from her husband, she decided to continue the household chemical business that the two of them started. She now works every day from 8am to 9pm. Fanny makes shampoos, disinfectants, and air fresheners and sells them in plastic containers.

With this loan, she wants to buy more chemicals for making her products. In the future, she wants to open her own distribution center and finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household chemicals

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maxima is the coordinator of her group Unidos para Progresar 1 & 2 (Progressing Together). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being with her family.

Maxima is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 7 years, starting when she learned how to sew. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she makes and sells curtains, sheets, quilts, tablecloths, and she will buy fabric, needles, thread and others. She will use the profits to improve her home, by changing some wood and having a floor. She wants to be successful in her business and with God's will and her Esperanza Loan, she will do it.
 
This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffer from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread

loans.name: Carine

texts.fr:
Femme agée de 30ans,celibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie de 15ans à 7ans et ayant 3 personnes en charge,par manque des moyens financiers elle arrête ses études au lycée en classe de terminale et commence à vendre comme agent de l'aréoport des plats pour des vols de 2004 à 2009 et se lance dans la coiffure en fin 2009. son revenu journalier est de 30000frs.

avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activite en achetant des produits cosmetiques de coiffure dames comme des demelants,defrisants,pinces et filets à chignon, mèches(pony,anglaise...) et autres produits de première necessité.

Elle à pour strategie de mieux faire son travail avec beaucoup de professionalisme faire preuve d'un bon accueil et avoir du respect pour ses clients.

Avec les bénéfices que son activité vont générées, elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en soutenant ses enfants dans les études. Continuer dans cette activité est son soucis majeur, elle veut à la longue ouvrir un salon plus moderne avec une salle de soins esthétique,dans son milieu  social elle est connue  parmi les femmes qui se débrouillent.
texts.en:
Carine K. I. is 30 years old, single,and mother of 2 children aged between 7 and 15 years. Due to lack of financial support, she left her studies in final year of high school and began to sell inflight meals as an employee at the airport between 2004 and 2009. She became a hairdresser at the end of 2009, and her daily income is 30000frs. With this loan she wants to strengthen her business by buying hairdressing products for women such as detangler, defrizz, clips, hairnets, streaking kits and other necessary products. Her strategy is to do her work well with a high level of professionalism, to provide a warm welcome, and to show respect to her clients. WIth the profits her busines will generate, she would like to improve the quality of life of her family and support her children through their studies. To continue in this business is her greatest worry, she eventually wants to open a more modern salon with a beauty salon incorporated. In her social circle she is well known, and gets along well with the women.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat  et materiel de coiffure defrisant; mèches,démelant, fillets; pinces

loans.name: Las Josefas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Josefas está conformado por Rosa Yolanda y Barbará Josefa. Rosa tiene 33 años y se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano para buscar los productos en el mercado y también realizar los diferentes productos que ofrecer como gallo pinto, tortas de carne, maduros, tajadas, enchiladas y refrescos. Por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida y por las noches es muy visitada por sus diferentes clientes. En el caso de Barbara se dedica a la venta de ropa, pues con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado obtener este medio de ingreso. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para sus diferentes productos que necesitan para su negocio. Juntas tienen los sueños de establecer un restaurante en donde las dos sean las dueñas.
texts.en:
The Josefas Solidarity Group consists of Rosa Yolanda and Barbará Josefa. Rosa is 33 years old and earns her living by preparing and selling food. Every day she wakes up early so that she can find the products she needs at the market. She offers different items such as beans and rice, meat pies, fried plantains, plantain chips, enchiladas, and soft drinks. Rosa feels very happy with this way of life and at night she is frequently visited by her different customers.

In Barbara’s case, she sells clothing with great effort as her means of income. The loan they are requesting will be used to buy different materials they need for their businesses. They dream of establishing a restaurant where they both are owners.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
El Señor Bacilio nacido el 28 de Febrero de 1966 en Cochabamba casado con la Sra. Filiberta con 7 hijos. Hace 6 años que el compro una parcela en 2 hectareas en la localidad de San Carlos a 25 Km de Limoncito. En la cual el vive y trabaja desde entonces con su esposa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la siembra, cosecha y la comercializacion en el mercado de el Torno.                                             
Es primera ves que Esta sacando Credito de Emprender, el dinero lo utilizara  para la siembra de Yuca. También él pertenece o es socio de un centro de acopio de Maiz.
texts.en:
Sr. Bacilio was born on February 28, 1966, in Cochabamba. He is married to Sra. Filiberta and they have seven children. Six years ago he bought a parcel of land that measures two hectares in the town of San Carlos, which is 25km away from Limoncito. There he lives and works with his wife and children. The crops that they plant and harvest are sold at the market in El Torno.
