This is the first loan he is requesting from Emprender. The money will be used for planting cassava. Bacilio is also a member of the local corn collection center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inputs for growing cassava

loans.name: Angelica Victoria

texts.es: Doña Angelica C., es originaria de Sumpango, Sac. municipio que queda a una hora de distancía de la ciudad Capital, tiene 4 hijos. Doña Anelica se dedica a vender perfumes, un negocio que a sido rentable en su vida, ya que ha tenido varios negocios, y no le han funcionado, pero en este si, ya que tiene a personas que le ayudan a vender, por lo tanto ella necesita solicitar un crédito, para poder aumentar la compra de su producto, ella ha trabvjado durante varios años con FAPE, y durante este tiempo ella ha demostrado su responsabilidad, ella sueña con tener un buen suertido de su producto, y asi poder tener mejores ingresos,  ya que gracias a este negocio ella ha podido contribuir a que su familia este mejor y salga adelante.
texts.en:
Doña Angelica C. is originally from the town of Sumpango, Sacatepequez, which is located an hour away from the capital of Guatemala. She has four children. Doña Angelica has been selling perfumes, a business that she has found to be quite profitable. She has had several other businesses before, but none of them have ever worked out like this one has.

Angelica has people who help her sell, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products. She has worked with FAPE for several years. During this time, she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person. Her dream is to be well-stocked with her product so that she can earn more income. Through this business, she has been able to provide her family with the best and everything they need to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Union y Desarrollo 1 & 2 (Union and Development). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to live comfortably in a safe house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking.

Maria is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 5 years, starting with her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying silver jewelry and shoes. She will use the profits to invest in her business, to buy what her children need for school and, in the long term, to build a better house. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to started a business. She talked with some of her friends and maD. up a group to receive a loan from Esperanza. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffer from unreliable and electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loans.use: To buy shoes and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es: Aura Luz tiene 50 años. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y elaboración de nacatamales.  Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido generar más ingresos para su hogar con la ayuda de este negocio. Trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días de semana que son los más solicitados por sus clientes, ya que también conocen la ubicación de su negocio que es su humilde vivienda. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, ingredientes para la elaboración de sus nacatamales, hojas, masa y bolsas plásticas.
texts.en:
Aura Luz is 50 years old. She butchers pigs and prepares Nicaraguan tamales to earn a living. With some effort, she was gradually able to generate more income through her business to maintain her household. Aura Luz works from 5am to 8pm every day of the week since her customers are placing more orders. She operates her business from her modest home.

At the moment, Aura Luz is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy pigs. She will also purchase ingredients and supplies for making Nicaraguan tamales such as banana leaves, cornmeal, and plastic bags.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and supplies for making Nicaraguan tamales

loans.name: Kublay Alain

texts.es: El Señor  Kublay  y su esposa se dedican desde hace tres años a la elaboración y venta de sándwich, tienen dos niños la mayor de diez años y el niño de cinco años, por las circunstancias de la vida Kublay tuvo que dedicarse a esta actividad pese a que el es ingeniero agrónomo,  en épocas de siembra y cosecha de arroz el viaja a la localidad de chapare para realizar estas actividades agrícolas y en esta oportunidad les falto capital razón por la que solicitaron crédito en la institución, kublay es optimista ya que el dice que  pese a haber trabajado en instituciones grandes y ahora vendiendo sándwiches, sabe que las circunstancias cambian y que las cosas van a mejorar.
texts.en:
Sr. Kublay and his wife have been preparing and selling sandwiches for three years. They have two children, ages 10 and 5. Due to the circumstances of life, Kublay had to resort to this business even though he is an agricultural engineer. During the rice planting and harvesting seasons, he travels to the town of Chapare to engage in these farming activities.

At the moment he lacks the capital to continue, so he is requesting a loan from Emprender. Kublay is optimistic and says that despite having worked for larger institutions, he continues to sell sandwiches. He knows that circumstances change and things will get better.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice seedlings, provisions, and equipment; pay for labor

loans.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
El señor William Enrique C., tiene la edad de 39 años vive en Lomas de Guadalupe su esposa es ama de casa y tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que estudian la secundaria, ellos tienen un molino en el cual se dedican a la venta de granos, desde hace mas de 5 años.

Este es el sustento económico de la familia, el año próximo su hijo mayor ir a  la universidad y temen no tener los recursos económicos para poder sobrellevar el gasto en el que se pudiese incurrir, es por esta razón que ellos planean reforzar su negocio y hacer crecer los volúmenes de venta para una mejor estabilidad económica, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos que posteriormente estaría ofertando en los mercados capitalinos, ellos son una familia muy unida,  y trabajadora que los embates de la economía que afecta a las familias nicaragüenses, no es razón suficiente para dejar de ambicionar por un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
William Enrique C. is 39 years old and lives in Lomas de Guadalupe. His wife is a housewife, and they have 3 teenage children who attend secondary school. They have a mill where William has sold grains for more than 5 years. He is the financial provider for the family. Next year, his eldest son will go to college, and they are afraid they will not have the economic resources to bear the expense this could incur. That is why they plan to strengthen their business and make their sales volume increase so they will have greater economic stability. William is requesting the loan to purchase basic grains which he would be offering for sale later in the markets at the capital. They are a very united and hard-working family. They believe the economic blows that are affecting Nicaraguan families are not sufficient reason to stop seeking a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains to be sold in the capital

loans.name: Try God Group

texts.en:
Tede W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Try God'. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has four children who range from 20 to 27 years old. Tede was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for two siblings.

For 6 years, she has been selling dried fish in Banjor Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more dried fish. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

Her dream is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Agnes is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish

loans.name: Eva Virginia

texts.es: La señora Eva Virginia Sánchez  tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos lácteos y cosméticos en el mercado de San Raymundo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita este crédito porque quiere agrandar su negocio, ya que casi no tiene competencia y  ya la gente del pueblo la conoce, por lo que le piden sus productos.  Por lo que ella cuenta que necesita el capital para poder tener mejor surtido y poder cumplir con lo que sus clientes le piden.  Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable en FAPE  y agradece el apoyo que  le brinda La señora Eva Virginia Sánchez  tiene 53 años de edad y es viuda, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos lácteos y cosméticos en el mercado de San Raymundo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita este crédito porque quiere agrandar su negocio, ya que casi no tiene competencia y  ya la gente del pueblo la conoce, por lo que le piden sus productos.  Por lo que ella cuenta que necesita el capital para poder tener mejor surtido y poder cumplir con lo que sus clientes le piden.  Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable en FAPE  y agradece el apoyo que se le brinda KIVA.
texts.en:
Eva Virginia Sánchez is a 53 year old widow. She has a business selling dairy products and cosmetics in the San Raymundo market. She is a very hard-working woman. She is requesting this loan because she wants to expand her business. She has almost no competition. The people in the town know her, and they ask for her products. She says that she needs capital to be able to better stock her business and to fill her customers’ orders. She has shown herself to be a responsible woman in FAPE, and she is grateful for Kiva’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business with more products

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: El Sr. Franz Radica en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales tres están con el y los demás ya se casaron y se independizaron, vive en el barrio Miraflores de dicha localidad en casa en alquiler, su ocupación es herrero, es decir construcción de canaletas para casa, verjas, ventanas, esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso, el destino del crédito es para compra materiales como Hierro, clavos, soldador y así poder cubrir sus pedidos, su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar; es cliente nuevo en la institución y en el sistema financiero y esta muy contento por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mr. Franz Radica, in El Torno, 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, has seven childred, three of whom still live with him. The other four are married and on their own. He lives in a rented house in the Miraflores neighborhood. [Franz] is a blacksmith; specifically he makes gutters for homes, railings, and windows. This is his only source of income. He will use the money from this loan to buy materials, such as iron, nails, and welding supplies, in order to be able to fulfill his orders. His wife is a homemaker. He is new to our institution and to this system of finance, and he is very grateful for the opportunity given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of four and all her children go to school. She owns a stall in Kawempe market selling vegetables. She buys these vegetables from the same market where she works and so doesn’t incur any transport costs. Besides this vegetable business she also sells Irish potatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, and yams concurrently.  She has done this business for years and works seven days a week. She sells vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions, cucumber, etc.   

Mary wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cabbages, onions, tomatoes, and a bag of Irish potatoes. Her main challenge is that selling vegetables is seasonal and she is aspiring of going directly to farmers.  Mary decided to join MCDT because of timely loans. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricitybut no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cabbges, tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gioconda del Socorro S. L., tiene la edad de 38 años, habitante del barrio Israel Galeano, con su pareja de vida tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad independientes que subsisten bajo sus propios recursos, su pareja labora como albañil apoyándole en los gastos del hogar, habitan en una humilde casa que a futuro esperan poseer el dinero necesario para la remodelación de la misma, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace ya más de 5 años.

Antes laboraba en una zona franca, pero fue gracias a su ahorro y el apoyo de su familia que ella labora para sí misma y crea su propia fuente de ingreso, desea invertir un capital más fuerte para el aumento en las   ventas y el beneficio económico de toda su familia, esta es la razón por la  cual solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería  cosmetica, que le permita mejores utilidades y la posibilidad a futuro de realizar las remodelaciones a su hogar que tanto añora.
texts.en:
Mrs Giconda del Socorro Sanchez L., age 38, lives in the Israel Galeano neighbourhood with her life partner; they have 4 grown and independent children who live on their own resources. Her partner works as a bricklayer, helping her with household costs. They live in a modest house which they hope to have money to remodel in the future. Giconda has sold cosmetics for more than 5 years already. Before, she worked in a tax-free area, but thanks to her savings and the support of her family she works for herself and has created her own source of income. She wants to invest a greater amount of capital in increasing her sales for the economic benefit of all of her family. This is the reason that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a larger inventory of cosmetic merchandise, which will be more useful and allow her the possibility of remodeling her home in the future, which she longs to do.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a bigger inventory of cosmetic merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José de 36 años, vive en el reparto Carlos Nuñez el se dedica a la venta de leña, de la manera más humilde se gana el pan de cada día para mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Por la falta de oportunidades profesionales él comenzó a vender en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, por lo que es su primer crédito y está muy entusiasmado para empezar este negocio. Por lo que trabaja todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, es necesario ya que tiene mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y aumentar su inventario. Sueña con seguir adelante con su actividad y proporcionar a sus hijos los recursos más necesarios.
texts.en:
Carlos José is 36 years old. He lives in the Carlos Nuñez neighborhood and sells firewood. He earns his daily bread in a most humbly way, so that he can improve his family’s income. With his wife’s help, he began selling out of his home due to a lack of other opportunities. This will be his first loan and he is very excited about starting this business. He works every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. This is necessary because he has to support his family. He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and to increase his inventory. He dreams of moving ahead with his business and of being able to give his children their most needed resources.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married to a taxi driver; they have four children and all their children are in school.  She owns a stall in Mulago market selling second-hand clothes   and she has been in this business for seven years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market and goes for shopping once a week.  Gladys uses public transport to and from shopping. 

Besides clothing sales, she also owns a restaurant at her home and has three girls who work in it. She works six days a week. Her business challenge are the rainy season which hinders her customers from getting to her.   She is aspiring of building her own house and decided to work with  MCDT  because she wanted capital. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: María Biviana

texts.es: Doña Biviana tiene 43 años de edad esta casada con Don José y tienen 6 hijos. Doña Biviana desde hace tiempo tiene una tortilleria, al principio tuvo la tortilleria en su casa y ahora alquila un local y esto lo pudo lograr con la ayuda de KIVA, ahora doña Biviana solicita nuevamente la ayuda de KIVA ya que necesita ampliar su negocio, ella necesita comprar gas, maíz para poder seguir adelante con su negocio. Uno de sus sueños es abrir un local más y asi poder expandir su negocio de tortillas.
texts.en:
Biviana is 43 years old, is married to José, and has six children. She has had a tortilla factory for some time. When she started, she ran it out of her home, but now she rents a specific location, which she was able to do with Kiva’s help. Biviana is once again asking for help from Kiva. She needs to buy gas, and dried corn in order to expand her business and be able to continue moving ahead. Someday she would like to open another location and in this way expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Estelvina M. Rojas: es presidenta del comité de Mujeres kuña Guapa de la  zona rural  de la compañía  Caaguy Cupé, distrito de Ybycuí, departamento de Paraguarí.

Este comité se encuentran trabajando desde el año pasado con un un credito inicial de 300.000mil, actualmente estan en el segundo ciclo del prestamo, inicialmente, empezaron con un grupo de 16 personas de las cuales desertaron 3 y ahora se quedaron con 15 integrantes.

Los miembros del comité trabajan en conjunto haciendo actividades de venta de comida, torneo de futbol, boley  para solventar los gastos de pago de cuota, aparte de que los miembros el dinero prestado de la Fundacion Paraguaya utilizan para compra de pollitos, cria de cerdos, ampliacion de almacén  y para utilizar en laa actividades agropecuarias para la siembra de los cultivos para el sustento de la familia durante el año.

Asi la señora Estelvina se dedica a varias actividades en su casa ya que tiene cria de aves y cerdos, y debe trabajar mucho para criarlos para obtener buena ganancia con la venta de los animales.
Ella ademas de la cria de animales tambien tiene su huerta con plantaciones de horalizas para el consumo de la familia y vender los excedentes.
Solicita el préstamo para  invertir en sus actividades como en la compra de pollos, balancelados para cerdos, y otros.
texts.en:
Estelvina M. Rojas is the president of the “comité de Mujeres kuña Guapa” of the “Caaguy Cupé” rural zone, located in the “Ybycuí” district, of the “Paraguarí” department. This group has been active since last year and began with an initial loan of 300,000,000 PYG. They are now in the second cycle of the loan. The group began with 16 people, 3 of whom left, and they currently have 15 members. The committee members work together to organize activities, such as food sales and soccer and volleyball tournaments, to cover the expenses of making their payments. The members also use the money that they borrowed from “Fundacion Paraguaya” to buy chicks, raise hogs, run a store, and to raise crops to feed their families throughout the year. Estelvina does various things out of her home, since she raises poultry and hogs and she must work hard to raise them in order to produce good earnings from the sale of the animals. She also has an orchard where she raises vegetables for sale and for feeding her family. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her businesses, such as buying chickens, hog feed, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry, feed, and supplies

loans.name: Norma  Judith

texts.es: Doña Norma hace 13 años, trabajaba con su tía vendiendo ropa típica, trabajo con ella durante 7 años, pero Norma comenzo a pensar en su futuro  y penso en tener su propio negocio, ya sabía como hacerlo, donde comprar los materiales y la ropa, con sus ahorros ella inicio vendiendo suéteres y los ofreci a conocidas y amigas y asi estuvo durante un año. al pasar el tiempo le hablarón de FAPE y ella comenazó a trabajar solicitando crédito para invertir en mas mercadería y asi hacer su negocio mas grande, al pasar del tiempo ella busco un local para poner su venta, ahora tiene un local propio en su casa, y ella sigue trabajando con FAPE y ahora con KIVA y solicito su crédito para surtir aún mas su tienda y asi llegar a ser cada vez mas y mas grande, ya que gracias a su negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Norma worked with her aunt, selling typical clothing, 13 years ago. She worked with her for seven years, but Norma then began thinking about her future and thought about having her own business. Since she already knew this business and knew where to buy materials and clothing, she used her savings and began selling sweaters to her friends and acquaintances. She did this for one year. After some time, someone told her about FAPE and she requested a loan in order to invest in more merchandise and expand her business. After a while she looked for a location where she could sell and now she runs her own store out of her home. She continues to work with FAPE and now with Kiva and requested this loan in order to better stock her store and grow it more and more. Thanks to her business, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Nicasio Antonio tiene 66 años, el se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos por haber comprado los productos. El ofrece la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, golosinas y pan, ya que su pulpería está ubicada en su vivienda y así ofrecer gran variedad de productos para sus clientes. Solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para comprar los productos necesarios y ofrecer una gran variedad. Siempre sueña con mejorar cada día más su actividad.
texts.en:
Nicasio Antonio is 66 years old, and he owns a small grocery store. This is not the first time he has sought financing to purchase products. He offers for sale basic products like rice, sugar, oil, beans, sweets, and bread. Since his store is located in his home, he can offer a good variety of products to his clients. He seeks this loan to invest in the purchase of the products necessary to offer a good variety. He dreams of improving his business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Paula Francis

texts.es:
La señora Paula Francis, tiene 33 años de edad vive con su pareja de vida y sus dos hijos adolecentes. Actualmente estudian la estudian la escuela primaria, ella labora como empleada domestica desde hace 3 años en una casa privada, son una familia muy humilde que habitan en un populoso barrio de la capital conocido por la inseguridad ciudadana que amenaza a las familias que ahí residen.

Es por esta razón que ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan asegurar su hogar en la compra de un puerta de madera e instalación de una verja de hierro, así mismo la mejora de la infraestructura  de los cuartos de la casa, trayéndole la satisfacción personal de ofrecerles a sus hijos un hogar más digno, seguro y comodo donde desarrollar su vida sobre todo que se encuentran en una etapa de sus  vidas en donde demandan más espacio e independencia.
texts.en:
Mrs Paula Francis, age 33, lives with her life partner and their two adolescent children. They currently study in elementary school. She has worked as a domestic employee in a private home for three years. They are a very humble family who live in a crowded neighbourhood of the capital known for the insecurity that threatens the families that live there. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials which will allow her to secure her home through the purchase of a wooden door and the installation of a wrought-iron gate, as well as the improvement of the infrastructure of the rooms of the home. This will bring her the personal satisfaction of offering her children a more dignified home, secure and comfortable, where they can develop their lives. Above all, they are now at a stage of their lives where they need more space and independence.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of construction materials to secure her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of men's, women's, and children's clothes (e.g., jeans, blouses, sheets, and hair products)

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri is married with four children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a store selling charcoal and bananas in Nabulagala in Lubaga Division. She has been in this business for four years.    She plans to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal. She sells to all categories of people in the area, both retail and wholesale. 

Eseri works seven days a week.  She depends on this job for a living. She buys bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal from Kiboga, one of the districts in the central region. Eseri uses public transport to and from Kiboga and goes shopping once a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season because when it rains the roads become impassable.  She is aspiring of educating her children up to university. 

Eseri joined MCDT to acquire additional capital.   She  resides in and owns a house which has no electricity or piped water. Among her  monthly expenses  are school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of banana and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Milagros is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres SolidA. 2 & 4 (Solidarity Women). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and one child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to add some services to her house, like running water. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy sharing with more people like her neighbors and family.

Milagros is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over three years, starting with her first loan.

Milagros plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cosmetics and personal and household products from catalog sales. She will use the profits to buy a refrigerator and a motorcycle to move faster and carry her products easily. She want to have a successful business and be a professional.
 
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to have a better life with more opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and personal and household products to sell

loans.name: Glenda Maritza

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad, trabaja todos los días atendiendo su negocio de comida en el mercado municipal, junto a su mamá trabajan y asi poder sacarle el mayor provecho al negocio. Glenda también trabaja dando clases de computación en un colegio. Necesita el crédito para comprar una estufa industrial y una churrasquera ya que la que tenian se daño. El sueño de Glenda es expandir el negocio y abrir otro local de venta de comida
texts.en:
Glenda is a hard-working woman. She is 21 years old and works every day tending to her food stand in the municipal market. She works alongside her mother in order to make the most out of the business. Glenda also works giving computation classes at a school. She needs the loan to purchase a an industrial stove and a barbecue grill since the ones she had were damaged. Glenda's dream is to expand her business and open another food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove and a barbecue grill

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Julia Z. F., tiene la edad de 51 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur es casada y su esposo es fiscal de proyectos de una casa en construcción, siendo sus ingresos parte esencial de la economía del hogar, tienen 2 hijos adolecentes, el cual uno de ellos trabaja y apoya a sus padres y el otro estudia su carrera universitaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace mas  de 20 años y refiere que le va muy bien y que su mercadería tiene buena aceptación entre sus clientas, desde muy joven la señora se dedico al comercio, siendo sus padres quienes la ayudaron en sus inicios en el negocio.

Ellos habitan en una casa humilde que por ahora no posee el dinero para realizar una remodelación al porche de su hogar, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cerámica, cemento, caliche, que le permitan llevar a  cabo este proyecto que les traerá mejores comodidades, seguridad y un buen desarrollo socio económico para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Julia Z. F. is 51 years old. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a project manager at a construction company and his income is an essential part of the family finances. They have 2 teenage children. One of them works and supports his parents and the other one is studying at the university. She has sold shoes for more than 20 years and she remarks that it has gone very well for her. Her merchandise is well accepted by her customers. She has been a saleswoman since she was very young and her parents helped her get started in the business. They live in a humble home. At this time, they don't have the money to remodel the porch on the house and that is why she is asking for this loan to purchase contruction materials such as ceramic tile, cement, and caliche, which will allow them to finish this project and bring more comfort, safety and good social economic development for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the porch on their home

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: D. Emilienne est née le 19 Mars 1972 et est mariée à GBETINDE Sébastien, un matelassier. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a quatre ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du  Bénin. Emilienne et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Emilienne  prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs) à Cotonou. Emilienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu six prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de jour en jour nombreuse de sa clientèle, Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Emilienne D. was born on the 19th March 1972 and is married to Sebastien Gbetinde, a quilter. The couple have four children in their care, of which 3 are their own children. It's been four years since the family settled in the Yabe district of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Emilienne and her husband together cover all the household expenses. To achieve this, Emilienne prepares and sells food (corn paste) in Cotonou. Emilienne buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is a longterm client of ALIDe, having taken out 6 loans, all of which have been diligently repaid. In order to strengthen her business, and to better face the growing demands of her clientele, Emilienne is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et des condiments de sauce.

loans.use: Purchase of hosiery, hats, sweatsuits, windbreakers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all of them are at school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Kasubi market selling second-hand clothes.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda and uses public transport to and from shopping.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She has no additional income. 

Sarah sells to all  categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living.  Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring of building her own house.  Sarah Joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. She  resides in  and rents a two-roomed  house and the family has  electricity  but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses  are  school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jeaneth Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Jeaneth Concepción D. R., tiene la edad de 45 años habita en el barrio de Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y habitan de manera independiente, ella tiene un cafetín en un colegio de la capital, desde hace mas de 7 años, el cual es considerado económicamente estable.

Ellos habitan en una morada humilde que por los embates de las tormentas, se les han deteriorado los cuartos es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que les favorezcan a mejores condiciones salubres por el moho que se estaba desarrollando,  así mismo comodidades para morar en un ambiente digno, y merecido por ser una familia, trabajadora que no permite que la crisis por la que atraviesa el país, robe sus añoranzas hacia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs Jeaneth Concepción D. R., age 45, lives in the Laureles Sur neighbourhood. She is married and her husband works as a security guard. They have 2 grown children who work and live independently. She has had a snack stand in a school in the capital for over 7 years, and it is considered to be economically stable. They live in a humble dwelling whose rooms have deteriorated from winds and storms. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials which will be conducive to better living conditions, safe from the mold that was developing, and for amenities to live in the dignified environment her family deserves. She is a hard-worker who has not allowed the crisis that has crossed the country to steal her dreams of a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: remodeling of rooms of her home

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr: Née en 1960, A. Awaou est mariée à AMOUSSOU Damas, un transitaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Awaou s'est installée depuis dix huit ans environs au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Awaou apporte une aide financière à son mari dans les différentes charges de la famille. Awaou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses charges, Awaou  vend du charbon de bois et des fagots de bois à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Awaou vend du maïs. Awaou s'approvisionne à Ikpinlè, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin. Awaou exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Awaou désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et élever davantage le niveau de son activité. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Awaou A. is married to Damas Amoussou, a forwarding agent. The couple has four children, all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom three are under their care. Awaou settled some 18 years ago in the Sènadé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her husband and children. She gives her husband financial assistance regarding the various family expenses. Awaou has not attended school. To meet her needs, she sells charcoal and bundles of firewood from her home. As a side business, she also sells corn. She gets her supplies from Ikpinlè, a farmer’s market in Benin. Awaou has been running this business for the past ten years and has already been granted four loans from ALIDé, all repaid in full. She wishes to increase her working capital and her level of activity, which is why she is now requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Lydie Olouwafèmi

texts.fr: Z. Lydie Olouwafèmi est née le 13 Juillet 1977 et est mariée à OGAH Adrien, un mécanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Lydie habite le quartier Midombo à Cotonou, avec ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Lydie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis une douzaine d'année, Lydie vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, sucre, lait, savons, allumettes, etc.) et aussi des produits de merceries au marché de Midombo. Lydie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Lydie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle. Lydie a bien remboursé le premier crédit.
texts.en:
Lydie Olouwafèmi Z. was born 13 July 1977 and is married to Adrien Ogah, a mechanic. The couple has two children, both attending (or having attended) school. Lydie lives with her children in the Midombo borough of Cotonou. The couple shares the handling of family expenses. Lydie interrupted her schooling at secondary level. For the past 12 years, she has been selling various items (pasta, canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, matches, etc.) and also haberdashery products at the Midombo market. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. This is Lydie’s second loan request with ALIDé, the purpose of which is to increase her level of activity and also her customer base. She fully reimbursed the first loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy haberdashery products and various items (pasta, sugar, canned goods, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is married to a builder;  they  have  five children and all of them are at school.  Currently she doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Rose Mary changed her business enterprise from a food business to a retail shop. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping  She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She has a retail shop as an additional income. 

Rose Mary sells to all categories of people around the area. She works seven days a week and her business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and thieves.  She depends on this job for a living. She resides in and owns a house which has electricity but no piped water. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university and joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital.    Her greatest monthly  expenses are for food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa A. O.  es una señora de 54  años que vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en una pequeña comunidad en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades  tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el turismo, entre otros.

Con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia Doña Rosa  buscó alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco más de un año inició un negocio,  exactamente un bazar-librería en su casa, en el cual ofrece: diferentes tipos de papel, artículos para oficina como lapiceros, lápices, cuadernos, goma, además de servicio de fotocopiado entre otras muchas más cosas. Dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su comunidad ha tenido mucha aceptación puesto que antes no había un lugar que brindara ese servicio. 

En estos momentos lo que desea doña Rosa  es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar mercadería para mejorar su inventario. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más  ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Doña Rosa   es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera más activa con este  tipo de organizaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 and lives with her husband and 3 children in a small community in Guanacaste called La Garita. It is located on a plain with a very warm climate where activities such as cattle-raising, agriculture, and tourism, among others, occur. With the desire of improving her condition of life and that of her family, Rosa sought different alternatives and just a little over 1 year ago, she launched a business. Precisely, a book store and shop in her house, offering different types of paper and office supplies such as pencils and pencil cases, notebooks, glue, plus photocopying services, among many other things. The business has been well received in her community, since previously no local store offered these things. At present, what Rosa wants is to solicit a loan for 500,000 colons to buy merchandise and improve her inventory. With this she hopes that her micro-enterprise will grow and begin to generate more income and improve her condition of life. Rosa is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita, one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Rosa's 2nd loan and she hopes to participate even more actively in these types of organizations in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HER BOOK AND OFFICE SUPPLY STORE

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: D. D. Marie est née en 1960 et vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont deux sont à sa charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Marie vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses différents besoins. Marie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà obtenu cinq crédits et qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Marie souhaite augmenter le volume de son activité et se faire encore plus de revenu pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants ; raison pour laquelle Marie sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Marie D. D. was born in 1960 and has been living for the past 20 years in the Sènadé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Marie is a widow and the mother of four children, of whom two are under her care. Only some of the children attend school. Marie lives with her children and is their sole provider. For 15 years Marie has sold “akassa” (a local foodstuff based on cornstarch) from her home, which enables her to meet her different needs. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Marie is a regular ALIDé client, and has already been granted five loans, all of which were reimbursed in full. She wants to increase her turnover and generate more revenue to satisfy her children’s needs, which is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and bundles of firewood

loans.name: Mujeres Inversionistas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES INVERSIONISTAS

El grupo está integrado por 3 personas las represéntate del grupo es Doña Teresa P. ella tiene 10 en su negocio se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y ropa típica  tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad  y 1 menor  su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su casa  y también sale a ofrecer sus productos de en otros pueblos,  su esposo falleció hace 1 ½   ella a salido a delante con la ayuda de sus hijos  y su negocio su mayor deseo para su hijo pequeño es que estudie y salga adelante y también desea tener mas mercadería variadas para sus clientes. Doña Candelaria P. tiene  una tortillería,   tiene 3 hijos  uno de ellos es mayor de edad su deseo para su hija  es que estudie y tenga una carrera, y prosperar más en su negocio, Doña Lucia P.  su  negocio es venta de productos por catálogo y por las mañanas vende jugos en su casa, su mayor  deseo es tener un pequeño local en su casa para que sus clientes lleguen y puedan ver  sus productos
texts.en:
Mutual Group of Investing Women. The group is made up of three persons. The group representative is Doña Teresa P.. She has been in business for 10 years and sells products through catalogs and typical clothing. She has 7 grown children and one that is still young. Her business is located in her home and she also goes to other towns to sell her products. Her husband passed away 1 1/2 years ago. She has gotten ahead with the help of her children and her business. Her wish for her young son is that he studies and gets ahead. She wants to have a variety of merchandise for her customers. Doña Candelaria P. makes tortillas. She has three children, one of them grown. She wishes that her daughter will finish her studies and have a career and that she will prosper in her business. Doña Lucia P. sell products through a catalog and sell juices in the mornings from her house. Her main wish is to have a small shop in her house so that her customers could come and see her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor J. A. Guzman Canda, tiene 44 años de edad vive en el Municipio de Monimbo, es casado y su esposa con sus ingresos le apoya en los gastos del hogar, tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, independientes y que le ayudan así mismo al gasto en el que se incurre mensualmente, ellos tienen su propio negocio desde hace 21 años el cual es una discomóvil. 

El solicita un préstamo para la compra de un nuevo parlante que le permitirá una oferta mejor a su clientes debido a que ahora las fiestas se realizan en lugares de mayor amplitud situación que dificultaba sus ordenes de trabajo, por ahora asegura que le irá mejor por a demanda alta que se viene de fiestas para estos meses, esto le favorecerá a mejorar sus condiciones económicas y la posibilidad de incursionar en nuevas fuentes  de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr J. A. Guzman Canda, age 44, lives in the municipality of Monimbo. He is married and his wife helps with the household costs with her income. They have 4 grown children who are independent and cover their own monthly expenses. J. and his wife have had their own business for 21 years, which is a mobile disco. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new loudspeaker which will allow him to provide a better offering to his customers since currently their parties are conducted in areas with good amplitude; this situation makes it difficult to work. He is sure that it will go well because of the high demand for parties in these months. This will help him to improve his economic conditions and provide the possibility of exploring new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a loudspeaker for his business

loans.name: Rosa Maria's Group

texts.es: Las señoras que participan en este grupo soy mujeres emprendedoras ya que cada uno tuvo la creatividad de iniciar su propio negocio; se dedican a la venta de medicina lo cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a la familia, una de ellas tiene una venta de juguetes y venta de ropa usada, en lo cual le va muy bien y también una de ellas se dedica a la pintura, pinta paisajes y esto le ha ayudado a salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. el deseo de las tres es sobre salir y ser mujeres de exito
texts.en:
The women in this group are very enterprising women since each one has the creativity needed to start her own business. One of them make a living selling medicines, which has helped her make headway for her families. One of the women sells toys and used clothing, which has gone very well. Another makes a living in art, painting landscapes, and this has helped her and her husband cover household expenses. All three wish to keep making headway and become successful women.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, Fuerza Divina 1 & 7 (Divine Force). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and a son. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a better life. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being with her little son.

Maribel is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two-and-a-half years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying household products. She will use the profits to buy school supplies and she is dreaming of building her house.
 
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to have a better life with more opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy household products to sell

loans.name: El Eden 5 Group

texts.en:
Elvira is the coordinator of her group, El Eden 5 (The Eden). She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children by herself. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being at home with her children.

Elvira’s business is a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily meal. Normally these colmados are in the same neighborhood, to be a short walking distance from any home. 

Elvira is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for four years, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more rice, flour, and other foods.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to invest in her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres, para poder solventar sus gastos.

 Ella tiene la tienda de viveres para ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenzó comprando arroz, verduras y lácteos. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para asegurar su vejez porque ya sus hijos son mayores de edad. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y carnes para su tienda, en el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and lives in Perimetral de Guayaquil, a suburban area bordered by a salt-water stream. She has a grocery store in order to cover family expenses. She started out purchasing rice, vegetables and dairy products, and since that time she has continued working to ease her into old age because her children are now adults. She works from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. With the loan she plans to purchase rice, oil and meats for her store. In the future she wants to better stock her store and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oils and meats

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina “Medalla Milagrosa”  están  en el Segundo Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes donde cada una trabaja para ayudar a sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Barcilisa quien es ama de casa y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde casa.
En la atención del negocio le ayudan sus hijos y de esa forma ella obtiene ingresos que ayudan con  los gastos diarios de la familia.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora con una familia muy humilde pero con muchos deseos de superarse  y sacar adelante a su familia de la mejor manera posible.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group called “Medalla Milagrosa” ("Miraculous Medal") is in its second loan cycle with 17 members. This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for its solidarity and being very united and responsible. The women make a living in different activities in which each one works to help out her family. One of the members is Barcilisa, who is a housewife and makes a living selling fruits and vegetables from her home. Her children help her tend to the business and in this way she earns an income to help with daily family expenses. She is a very hard-working woman with a very humble family and has a strong desire to move up in life and make headway for her family in the best way possible. She is requesting the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables, and other items for the member's respective businesses

loans.name: Amparo Colombia

texts.es:
Amparo de 38 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, sus caminos y calles son de tierra y hay que subir lomas para ir a las casas), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres hace 8 años atrás. 

Desde hace años ella comenzó a trabajar en su propia tienda no solo para ser independiente sino para solventar los gastos de sus dos hijos ya que su esposo se separo de ella, con esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha surtido su tienda, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una vitrina, arroz y lácteos para su tienda, en el futuro quiere tener un negocio adicional como un restaurante.
texts.en:
Amparo, 38, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (on the outskirts of the city where the avenues and streets are unpaved and it’s necessary to climb hills to get to the houses). She has had a general store for the past 8 years. From some time ago she started to work in her own store not only to be independent, but also to cover the expenses of her two children since her husband separated from her. With efforts and dedication she has supplied her store and she works from 6 am until sunset. With the loan she will buy a display case, rice and dairy products for her store. In the future she would like to have another business like a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A display case, rice, and dairy products

loans.name: Mireya Gioconda

texts.es:
Mireya Gioconda P. P. tiene 20 años.  Vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 niños de 2 y 4 años.

Mireya es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Mireya se dedica a la agricultura y tiene cultivos de maracuyá. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Matilde todos los fines de semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertir para dar compra de semilla de cacao y poder sembrar. El crédito le ayudara para poder tener sus cultivos de cacao propios. Su sueño es poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.
  
Le gusta practicar la lectura y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Mireya Gioconda P. P. is 20. She lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has 2 children ages 2 and 4. Mireya is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San Jose. Mireya is a farmer and grows passion fruit. She makes her purchases and sales in Matilde every weekend. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cocoa seeds to be able to sow them. The loan will help her to have her own cocoa crops. Her dream is to be able to give her child a good education. She likes reading and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to have more cocoa crops

loans.name: Elman Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Elman Santiago R. L., tiene 31 años de edad vive en Lomas de Gavilan es casado y su esposa es ama de  casa, pero le apoya en las tareas de la finca, ellos tienen 4 hijos, ellos son agricultores desde hace 5 años y fue con el apoyo de su papa que comenzaron a trabajar en esta actividad.

La afectación de plagas le ha dificultado la buena producción de las cosechas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fungicidas, fertilizantes, e insumos vegetativos, esta inversión le garantizara una mejor cosecha y la posibilidad de una ganancia mayor que les permitirá mejores condiciones económicas para todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr Elman Santiago R. L., age 31, lives in Lomas de Gavilan. He is married and his wife is a housewife, but she helps him with the farm chores. They have 4 children. They have been farmers for 5 years; it was with the help of his father that they were able to start this activity. Plagues have made good production difficult. For this reason he is requesting a loan for the purchase of fungicides, fertilizers and vegetable inputs. This investment will guarantee a better harvest and the possibility of better income which will permit them to improve the economic condition of all of the family members.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fungicides, fertilizers and vegetable inputs, which will guarantee a better harvest

loans.name: Olivia Margot

texts.es:
Olivia Margot C. R. tiene 33 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 niños de 12, 9, 7, y 6 años.

Olivia es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Olivia se dedica a la agricultura y a la sembra de maíz, arroz, y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao y en San Jose de Tambo para cacao cada 15 dias y 2 cosechas para maíz.  

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz y tener el agua, semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes. El crédito le permitirá comprar todo al mismo tiempo para sembrar el maíz. Su sueño es poder estudiar y tener buena profesión. Ha tenido problemas con los animales en el maíz, eso presenta un desafío a su negocio. 

Le gusta jugar pelota y aprender.
texts.en:
Olivia Margot C. R. is 33. She is in a common law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has 4 children ages 12, 9, 7 and 6. Olivia is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San Jose. Olivia is a farmer who grows corn, rice and cocoa. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao and in San Jose de Tambo, every 15 days for cocoa and every 2 harvests for corn. She is requesting this loan to sow corn and have the water, seeds, manure and fertilizer. The loan will allow her to buy all of this at the same time to sow the corn. Her dream is to be able to study and have a good profession. She has had problems with the animals and the corn which have presented challenges to her business. She enjoys playing ball and learning.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of manure to sow corn

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas junto a su esposa tienen 4 niños menores de edad de los cuales cuidan a diario. Sus inicios se dan por que ninguno de los dos tenía experiencia profesional y juntos deciden iniciar este medio de vida para generar ingresos para su hogar, pues siempre están pensando en sus hijos que necesitan  estudios y otras cosas que son muy importantes. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de maíz, comal, bolsas, cal entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus tortillas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y poder obtener una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is 37 years old. She has a business selling tortillas. She and her husband have 4 dependent children, who they care for daily. Their business came about because neither of them had professional experience. Together they decided to start this way of making a living to generate income for their home, since they are always thinking about their children and their need for schooling and other very important things. The loan they are requesting is for the purchase of corn, a comal (a ceramic dish or metal hotplate used for cooking tortillas), bags, lime and other items they need to make their tortillas. She hopes to expand her business and to be able to open a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Tembiaporä Group

texts.es:
Este comite surgue por iniciativas de algunas señoras quienes deseaban aumentar su capital de trabajo y otras emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinaron  la reunión  para confromar el comité y actualmente el comité se encuentra en pleno desarrollo y todas se encuentran satisfechas con sus trabajos.
El comité se encuentra en una zona donde la mayoria de la personas se dedica a la agricultura y crias de animales para generar ingresos, ademas es un zana con poco movimieto comercial, por lo que las personas muchas veces viajan hasta otras ciudades para comercializar sus productos.
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Braudelina quien tiene un negocio para generar sus ingresos.
Ella ofrece productos para usos del hogar a precios accesibles y muchas veces le provee de mercaderias a sus socias del comité a cambio de otros productos como quesos o leches.
Es una señora muy activa y generosa ayuda a todas sus socias de alguna manera para que salgan adelante.
Solicita el prestamo para cargar mercaderias en su negocio como productos enlatados, arroz, verduras, fideos, aceite, azucar y otros.
texts.en:
This group started thanks to the initiatives of a few of the women who wanted to increase their capital for work and other activities. From there, they coordinated a meeting to form the group. Now the group is in full swing and all of the members are satisfied with their work. The group is located in an area where the majority of the people make a living in agriculture and livestock, and there is little commercial movement, which is why the people many times travel to other cities to sell their goods. One of the members is Braudelina, who has a business offering household products at fair prices, and many times she provides supplies to her fellow members in exchange for other products such as cheese or milk. Braudelina is a very active and generous woman who in some way helps all of her fellow members to make headway. She is requesting the loan to bring in merchandise for her business, products like canned goods, rice, vegetables, noodles, oils, sugar and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire canned goods, rice, vegetables, noodles, oils, sugar and other items

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre C.M.R de SAN ROQUE pues se encuentran en un barrio del mismo nombre , sus objetivos es trabajar en grupo, ir aumentando los monto de los préstamos y por ende la calidad de vida de ellas mismas y de sus familiares.
Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo integrada por 11  sacrificadas mujeres, quienes trabajan a diario para brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
Todas las integrantes son personas muy activas, y sacan los créditos para invertir en sus respectivas actividades y hasta la actulalidad han cumplido con todos los pagos sin mora.
Petrona A. es una de las integrante y se dedica  a la confeccion de trajes de noches para damas, sus trabajos son muy delicados y admirados por sus clientes, por los que constantemente tiene trabajo.
Ella desde muy joven estudio esta profesion con la ayuda de sus padre, y actualmente el ingreso que obtiene de este trabajo ayuda muchisimo a su familia.
Ella comenta que seguira trabajando mucho y que seguirá trabajando con sus socias del comite, y en esta ocación solicita el prestamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, y otros accesorios para confección.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is named after the neighborhood where the members live. Their objective is to work as a group, to keep increase the amounts of their loan and thus improve the quality of live for themselves and their families. The group is currently in its sixth loan cycle and consists of 11 hard-working women who work every day to provide the best for their respective families. All of the members are very active women who use the loans to invest in their respective activities, and to date they have fulfilled all of their payments without fail. Petrona A. is one of the members, and she makes a living making nightgowns for women. Her items are very delicate and much admired by her customers, so she constantly has work. She has studied this profession since she was a young girl with the help of her father, and now the money she makes from her work really helps her family. She plans to keep working hard and working together with her fellow members. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing items.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Alberto tiene la actividad de venta de pescado ya que él es pescador. Hace más de 20 años que tiene esta actividad, por lo que desde muy joven ha trabajo debido a la necesidad de su familia, el tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio y también quiere realizarles ciertas reparaciones a su bote. Sueña con mejorar con su vivienda, ya que es un hombre muy responsable con su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Félix Alberto makes a living selling fish since he is a fisherman. He has been doing this activity for more than 20 years and started working at a very young age out of family necessity. He has two young children under his care, so he is always looking for a way to generate income for his family. He is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials necessary for his business, and he also wants to make certain repairs to his boat. He dreams of improving his home since he is very responsible with his family and his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and make certain repairs to his boat

loans.name: Mirella Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirella de 43 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Desde hace años ella comenzó a trabajar en su propia papelería no solo para ser independiente y por la separación de su esposo sino para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, con esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha surtido su papelería, trabaja desde las 08h00am.

Quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, hojas y laminas para surtir mas su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mirella is 43 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban zone whose inhabitants mainly work in sales on the informal economy). She has a store in her home, called a "bazar" in Ecuador, in which she sells items such as school supplies, paper goods, and soft drinks. She started her own school supply store years ago, not only for the sake of independence and because of her separation from her husband, but also to cover her children's expenses. With effort and dedication, she has been able to expand her store's inventory. She works starting at 8:00 in the morning. With the loan, she would like to buy notebooks, paper sheets and laminated educational materials to further expand her store's inventory. In the future, she would like to have a store in downtown Guayaquil. .

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, paper, learning materials

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta Eugenia L. L.  es una señora  de 43  años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus  5 hijos en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semi montañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio. 
Hace varios años Doña Marta decidió tener su propio negocio; Por lo que compro una casita cerca de su casa  para alquilarla a los estudiantes o turistas de la zona. Esto le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, 
Sin embargo por la falta de mantenimiento la casita se encuentra en muy mal estado, y necesita repararlo para seguir rentarlo y seguir obteniendo ganancias, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de ¢617.000 (Seiscientos diecisiete mil colones ) para  comprar vidrios, portones  y madera para arreglar la cocina  y otros detalles que le hacen falta para ser utilizado.
Doña Marta  es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Marta Eugenia L. L. is a 43 year old woman who lives with her husband and five children in the community of Canalete, which is located in Upala, Alajuela Province. This place is located in a semi-mountainous area where the main business activities mostly revolve around livestock breeding and agriculture. In this community there are great opportunities to develop and establish micro-enterprises, particularly in the agriculture and retail sectors.

Several years ago Doña Marta decided to start her own business, so she bought a cottage next to her house and rents it out to students and tourists in the area. This provides her with a source of income that will allow her to move her children forward. However, due to the lack of maintenance, the cottage is in very bad condition. It needs to be repaired so that it can be rented out and continue generating income. For this reason, Marta needs a loan of 617,000 CRC to buy windows, doors, and wood to repair the kitchen and fix other details that are lacking so that the cottage can be used.

Doña Marta is a member of the Canalete Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan and she hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level. She is also an active participant in her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase windows, doors, and wood to repair her rental cottage

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este comite se forma por iniciativa de las integrantes del comite que se enteraron del Programa de Comite de Mujeres y decidieron trabajar para ayudar a sus maridos a sacar adelante a sus familia de la mejor manera.
Todas la señoras de este comité son de familias humildes, muy trabajadoras y tienen el deseo de que sus hijos terminen sus estudios terciario para tener una vida mejor.
Una de las integrantes integrantes es la señora Nelida quien se dedica a la venta de huevos y gallinas, ella nos comenta que esta actividad requiere de mucha atención, por que las aves son muy delicados en cuanto al cuidado.
La ganancia mayor ella obtiene de la venta de huevos, y tambien obtiene ingresos cuando vende las gallinas en descartes.
Ella vende los huevos a varios negocios de la zona, y estos constantemente solicitan  su producto en gran cantidad.
Actualmente necesita alimentos especiales para sus gallinas, y solicita el credito para la compra de balanceados.
texts.en:
This committee was formed as a result of the initiative of its members upon learning about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. They made the decision to work so that they could help their spouses move their families forward in the best way possible. All of the women in this committee come from modest families. They are hard workers who want to see their children complete a higher education so that they can have a better life.

One of the members is Sra. Nelida who sells eggs and chickens. She says this business requires a great amount of attention because the birds are very delicate in terms of their care. Her greatest source of revenue is the sale of eggs, but she also earns income when she sells hens that she no longer needs.

Nelida sells the eggs to different businesses in the area. Her customers constantly request her product in large quantities. She is requesting a loan because she currently needs to buy specialized feed for her hens.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Reyna De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Reyna de los Ángeles R. F., vive en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casada, de 37 años cuyo esposo labora como chofer, siendo la fuente de ingreso de la economía del hogar, son una familia de 5 hijos  los cuales estudian la primaria y a secundaria.

Ellos son una familia muy humilde que dentro de sus planes a futuro están las remodelaciones de su hogar, la señora se dedica a  la venta de frijoles y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos y abarrotería para aumentar el inventario y elevar los volúmenes de ventas, y que a futuro mejoren poco a poco la economía de esta humilde familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Reyna de los Ángeles R. F. lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla division, is married and 37 years old. Her husband works as a driver, which is the source of income for their family. They are a family with 5 children who study in elementary and high school. They are a very humble family. Part of their plans for the future include remodeling their home. Reyna sells beans, and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic grains and groceries to increase her inventory and volume of sales, and so that in the future she can improve her humble family's economic state bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of basic grains and groceries

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.en:
“Los Emprendedores” is a communal bank formed by fourteen socios (borrowers) who reside in La Florida district. These individuals are primarily dedicated to their individual occupation: a seamstress, a baker, an artist (wood pieces), and a salesperson (sells CDs, socks and underwear).

Fabiola is the delegate of this group. In the photo she is found in the back row, second from the right, and is wearing a purple jacket. She bakes pastries, alfajores (a traditional Arabic confection) and various cookies and sells them in a stand that she has created in front of her house. She also distributes wholesale for other business to sell within the neighborhood. Fabiola learned how to make pastries from her father who was a bread-maker and pastry chef.
