With this loan, Fabiola intends to purchase the principle ingredients needed to produce these goodies. Her dream is to one day open a pastry shop in a grand location and afterwards add to it a shop that will sell these ingredients for other to make them too.

Febiola lives with her husband and 7-year-old daughter. She enjoys participating in the weekly bank meetings along with the other socias (borrowers) and the loan officer. She credits Fondo Esperanza’s weekly bank meetings with enabling her to socialize with other entrepreneurs and learn from their experiences too.

La Florida is a community located to the southeast of Santiago (the capital of Chile). The community itself is quite diverse, representing all sectors of socioeconomic levels. This area has an active commercial life which is manifested in the existence of several new shopping centers. In recent years, this sector has experienced explosive growth.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients need to produce her pastries

loans.name: Patricia Elizableth

texts.es:
Patricia de 28 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  aunque esta divorciada ella sigue trabajando para su hijo de 2 años. 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder mantener a su hijo, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. una de las preocupaciones que tiene es dejar solo a su hijo con su mama, mientras que sale a trabajar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle una buena a su hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia is 28 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil. She sells products manufactured by Yambal (a company that offers women entrepreneurs the opportunity to start their own independent sales businesses). She is divorced and continues to work to support her two year old son.

Since she works alone in order to provide for her child, Patricia begins very early offering her products to neighbors and friends. She sells perfumes ranging from $20.00 to $75.00 per unit. One of her worries is leaving her son alone with her mother while she is away working.

This loan will be used to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. In the future, Patricia wants to finish the construction of her house and provide good things for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants

loans.name: Jesus Cristobal

texts.es:
Jesús de 46 años, es mecánico y vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), tiene tres hijos y su esposa es profesora de una escuela. 

Para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar desde joven como mecánico, con esfuerzo a podido construir su casa y mantener a su familia, ahora también esta trabajando como conserje en sus ratos libes para tener mas ingresos. 

Para construir mejor su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y arena. En el futuro el quiere aumentar su casa con un segundo piso y así darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 46 years old and works as a mechanic. He lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area outside of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem). Jesús has three children and his wife works as a schoolteacher.

Due to the lack of opportunities he faced as a young man, he had to work as a mechanic in order to support his family. With effort he was able to build a house and provide what his family needed. Now he also works as a janitor in his spare time to earn additional income.

To build the best home he can, Jesús wants to buy cement and sand. In the future, he wants to expand his house by adding a second floor and hopes to provide a better life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & sand for building his house

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar C. V., tiene la edad de 38 años vive en el Barrio de la Borgoña es casado, y con su mujer tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que estudian el colegio y el mayor la universidad, ellos son agricultores tienen 12 años y fue gracias al apoyo de su padre que le cedió un lote de terreno para que lo trabajara y comenzara a encaminar su vida y la de su familia.

Ahora él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a los cultivos de la piña, este capital le beneficiara a su economía familiar y personal para futuros proyectos que tengan en mente que favorezcan a su vida profesional, y/o  familiar.
texts.en:
Mr Julio Cesar C. V., age 38, lives in the neighbourhood of la Borgona. He is married, and he and his wife have three grown children who study in high school- the oldest is in university. They have been farmers for 12 years, thanks to the help of his father who gave him a plot of land so that he could work and start his life and that of his family. He is now requesting a loan for the purchase of inputs and fertilizers which will provide a better maintenance to his pineapple crops. This capital will benefit his family's finances and his personal finances for future projects which he has in mind for his professional and/or family life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Yessenia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Yessenia Carolina B. H. tiene la corta de edad de 22 años vive en el Reparto Rigoberto Lopez Pérez, es casada y su joven esposo es vendedor de frutas y verdura  brindando un ingreso fijo a la economía de la familia. Ellos tienen una niña de 7 años, que le dificulta el dejarla sola en la casa para ir a vender por tal razón es el papa quien realiza esta labor.

Pero esperan mejorar su economía y contratar el apoyo de una  domestica que le apoye a vigilar la casa y velar por su hija, esto se lograra gracias a la mejoría continua de la economía del hogar y para esto solicitan un préstamo para la compra de mayor inventario de abarrotes que aumenten el volumen de ventas y a largo plazo permitan llevar a cabo los planes de la familia.
texts.en:
Yessenia Carolina B. H. is 22 years old. This young woman lives in Reparto Rigoberto Lopez Pérez. She is married, and her young husband is a fruit and vegetable seller, bringing in a stable income to support the family. They have a daughter who is seven years old, which makes it difficult to leave her alone in the house to go out and sell, and for this reason it is the father who does this work. But they hope to improve their economic situation and hire a domestic worker to help them watch the house and watch over their daughter. They will achieve this thanks to the continual improvement of their home's economic situation, and for this they are requesting a loan to buy a larger inventory of groceries that will increase their sales volume and will in the long term permit them to carry out their plans for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of groceries to permit increased sales

loans.name: Angela Del Pilar

texts.es: Ángela Del Pilar  tiene 32 años de edad,  hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Ya que sus inicios se dan desde hace mucho tiempo, pues poco a poco es que ha ido mejorando su negocio. Por lo que sus clientes siempre están solicitando diferentes productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas trajes y vestidos, ella con mucho esfuerzo y como toda madre luchadora ha demostrado que puede mejorar sus condiciones.  Por lo que sus 3 hijos son su mayor felicidad y siempre está buscando la amera de proporciónales lo necesario. el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Pilar is 32 years old. For more than four years, she has been in the business of selling general merchandise. Since the beginning she has gradually been able to improve her business. Ángela tries very hard to satisfy her customers since they are always requesting different products such as trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses. Like any determined mother, she has demonstrated that she is able to improve her conditions. Her three children are her greatest joy, so she is always looking to provide them with what they need.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Exito En Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO ÉXITO EN VISTA HERMOSA
LA SEÑORA FIDELINA A. D. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO , SIENDO ELLA LA PRESIDENTA  DE ELLAS.  SU NEGOCIO ES UNA TORTILLERIA LA CUAL DECEA QUE CREZCA A CADA DIA.  ESTA AL LADO DE SUS HIJOS QUIEN LA APOYAN CON SUS SUEÑOS QUE DECEA REALIZAR.  TAMBIEN SU COMPAÑERA EUFEMIA S. TIENE GRANDES SUEÑOS EN SU VIDA, VENDIENDO ORO BRASILEÑO, UN POCO DE CALZADO  ROPA VARIADA  EN MUCHOS LUGARES CON SUS CONOCIDAS.  DOÑA ELULALIA NO SE CANSA DE NEGOCIAR Y TIENE MUCHO TIEMPO VENDIENDO EN DIFERENTES LUGARES, VENDIENDO ROPA DE TELA, FALDAS, BLUSAS, VESTIDOS Y MAS.  LAS TRES TIENEN SUEÑOS MUY HERMOSOS PERO EL CAPITAL NO LES ALCANZA Y NO DEJARAN DE LUCHAR PARA ALCANZAR SUS METAS EN LA VIDA.
texts.en:
ÉXITO EN VISTA HERMOSA Solidarity Group

Sra. Fidelina A. D. is part of this solidarity group and also serves as the President. She manages a tortilla shop that continues to grow each day. Her children are by her side and support her in the dreams that she wants to fulfill.

Another member of the group is Eufemia S., who has great dreams in life. She sells Brazilian gold, shoes, and various types of clothing to her acquaintances in different places.

Doña Eulalia is not tired of her business. She spends most of her time selling in different places. She offers clothing made of fabric such as skirts, blouses, dresses, and other items.

These three ladies have very beautiful dreams, but they lack sufficient capital. They will not give up fighting in order to achieve their goals in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more clothing

loans.name: Ramona Castilla

texts.es:
Ramona Castilla L. C. tiene 46 años.  Vive soltera en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 niños de 4 a 20 anos.

Ramona es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ramona se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un pequeño terreno con maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao 2 cosechas al ano con maíz y arroz.   

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar cacao que necesita semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes químicos con la esperanza de trabajar mas y sacar mas dinero. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminan sus estudios y que sean bien preparados para la vida. La preocupación de sobrevivir se le enfrenta. 

En su tiempo libre se encarga de sus muchachos.
texts.en:
Ramona Castilla L. C. is 46 years old and single. She lives in the Chillanes Canton in the Bolívar province. She has eight children from 4 to 20 years old. Ramona is a member of the El Placer (The Delight) Communal Bank. It is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in all, and most of them grow corn and cacao. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San José. Ramona devotes herself to farming. She has a small piece of land with corn and rice. She makes her purchases and her sales in Mata de Cacoa. There are two harvests a year with corn and rice. She is requesting a loan to plant cacao, and she needs seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers. She hopes to work more and make more money. Her dream is that her children finish their education and that they are well prepared for life. The worry that she faces is survival. In her free time she takes care of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant cacao

loans.name: Amada Petita

texts.es:
Amada Petita S. V. tiene 51 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 niños, 3 estan casados y los otros tres tienen 16, 18, y 19 anos.

Amada es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Amada se dedica a caseros domesticos, a criar pollos y al cultivo de maíz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao.   

Solicita el préstamo para aumentar el negocio de pollos y para comprar las semillas y abonos para sus cultivos de maíz. Su sueño es seguir adelante y ayudar a los hijos a estudiar (2 estan en la universidad). 

En el poco tiempo libre que tiene, cuida a sus pollos, cocina en la casa, y a veces sale a fiestas.
texts.en:
Amada Petita is 51 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in the Chillanes district in the Bolivar province. She has 6 children. Three of them are married and the others are 16, 18 and 19 years old. Amada is a partner of El Placer rural loan group which is located three hours away from Chillanes. There are 19 partners total, most of them grow corn and cacao. This is their first loan with San Jose Co-op. Amada takes care of her house and housework, raises chickens and grows corn. She buys and sells her produce in Mata de Cacao. She requests the loan to increase her chicken business and to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant corn. Her dream is to move ahead and help her children, who are in school (two of them are in college). In the little free time that she has, she takes care of the chickens, cooks and sometimes goes to parties.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the chicken business and purchase corn seeds

loans.name: Greyda Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Greyda Catalina R. A., tiene la edad de 30 años vive en Santa Rosa, es casada y su esposo es mecánico y le apoya con sus ingresos a los  gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 niños que estudian primaria y el pequeño preescolar, se dedican al comercio de venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace ya más de 7 años, y se inicio gracias al apoyo de su mamá.

Los planes son el poseer su propio local en algún buen punto de venta y vender al por mayor, y por ese objetivo es que hoy en día solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo las edificaciones  de su propio  puesto de venta, tales como cemento, arena, y laminas de zinc, esta inversión les permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y la posibilidad de incursionar en otras fuentes de ingreso para la mejoría continua en la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Greyda Catalina R. A. is 30 years old and lives in Santa Rosa. She is married, and her husband is a mechanic. With his income, he helps her cover the household expenses. They have two children who are in preschool and primary school. Greyda's work is selling fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 7 years, and she started it thanks to support she received from her mother. Her plans are to have her own store in a good location and sell on a wholesale basis. Toward this aim, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build the infrastructure for her own sales stall, such as cement, sand, and metal roofing sheets. This investment will allow her to increase her income and gain opportunities for other sources of income, so she can keep improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building her own store to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria Elisa C. M. tiene 46 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 niña de 24 anos y una nieta de 4 anos. 

Maria es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maria es ama de casa y ayuda a su esposo en el campo. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao.
Solicita el préstamo para cultivar maíz con la compra de semillas y abonos para plantificar las cosechas y hacerlo bien. Su sueño es dejar algo a su hija para una casita. Regularmente tiene un gripe y este presenta en obstáculo en su trabajo y en su vida. 

Le gusta estudiar la biblia.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa C. M. is 46 years old. She lives with her common-law husband in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. She has a 24-year-old daughter and a granddaughter who is 4 years old. Maria is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, which is located three hours from Chillanes. The group has a total of 19 members, most of whom are involved in growing corn and cacao [cocoa]. This is their first loan through the San José Cooperative. Maria is a homemaker and helps her husband in the fields. She carries out her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao. She is requesting the loan to plant corn; she will buy seeds and fertilizer to plant a successful crop. Her dream is to leave something to her daughter so she can have a little house. She regularly gets the flu, and this presents a barrier to her in her work and in her life. She enjoys studying the Bible.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer to plant corn

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto Jose R. G., tienen la edad de 29 años vive en el Barrio de Santa Rosa, es casado y su esposa labora como docente, aportando al gasto del hogar, ellos tienen un hijo de 8 años el cual actualmente estudia la primaria, dentro de sus mayores necesidades esta la mejora de su vivienda. Ellos son vendedores de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Roberto Huembés, y la crisis que atraviesa el país no le ha permitido  invertir en el negocio o llevar a cabo planes de remodelación de la infraestructura del hogar es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, hierro, bloque, en si materiales  de construcción que lleven a cabo estos planes de cambio en las condiciones de su vida cotidiana.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Jose R. G. is 29 years old and lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. He is married and his wife works as a teacher in order to contribute toward the household expenses. They have an eight year old son who attends elementary school. Improving their home is among their greatest needs. They sell fruits and vegetables in the Roberto Huembés market, but the crisis facing the country has prevented them from investing into the business or from upgrading their home. It is for this reason that they are requesting this loan. They will use the money to buy cement, iron bars, cinder blocks, and building materials so that they can improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Susy Eva

texts.es:
Susy de 23 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella vende productos químicos, como shampoo, desinfectante, etc. 

Empezó con los productos químicos hace años atrás, por el consejo de uno de sus amigos el cual le enseño a preparar productos químicos desde ese tiempo a continuado con el negocio de químicos que los dos habían empezado, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Ella hace shampoo, desinfectante, aromatizante, y los llena en envases plásticos. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mas químicos para hacer sus productos, en el futuro quiere tener su propia distribuidora de químicos y terminar de construir su casa
texts.en:
Susy is 23 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants). She sells household chemical products such as shampoos, disinfectants, and other items.

She started her business several years ago after one of her friends taught her how to prepare the products. Since then she has continued the chemical business that the two of them started. Susy works from 8am to 4pm every day. She makes shampoos, disinfectants, and air fresheners and packages them in plastic containers.

Susy wants to use her loan to buy more chemicals for making her products. In the future, she wants to have her own distribution center and finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household chemicals

loans.name: Tanya Mariela

texts.es:
Tanya Mariela P. S. tiene 19 años.  Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Tanya es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Tanya se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao 2 veces al ano para el maíz y 4 veces al ano para arroz.
 
Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz, comprar abonos y semillas para el mejoramiento de los cultivos. Su sueño es ser profesional, tener una familia y una casa, y ayudar a sus padres. Se le enfrentan las enfermedades en los cultivos.  

Le gusta jugar indor futbol y basketball.
texts.en:
Tanya Mariela P. S. is 19 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes and province of Bolívar. Tanya is a member of the rural, communal bank El Placer (The Pleasure), which is located three hours from Chillanes. In total, the bank has 19 members. Their main activity is the cultivation of corn and cocoa. This is the first loan they have requested from the Cooperativa San José. Tanya works in agriculture and cultivates corn and rice. She does her buying and selling in Mata de Cacao, twice a year for corn and four times a year for rice. She requests this loan to sow corn and to purchase fertilizer and seeds so that her crops thrive. Her dream is to be professional, have a family and a house, and help her parents. She has to battle diseases in her crops. She likes to play indoor soccer and basketball.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivation of corn

loans.name: Luis Olimpo

texts.es:
Luis Olimpo F. V. tiene 36 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 niños de 14, 9, 8, 5, y 2 anos.

Luis es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura y tiene cultivos de maracuyá y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Matilde cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertir y dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao y mejor su económica personal. Su sueño es poder darles una buena educación a todos sus hijos. 

Le gusta practicar la lectura y jugar indor futbol.
texts.en:
Luis Olimpo F. V. is 36 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage in the canton of Chillanes and the province of Bolívar. He has five children aged 14, 9, 8, 5, and 2. Luis is a member of the rural, communal bank El Placer (The Pleasure), which is located three hours from Chillanes. In total, the bank has 19 members. Their main activity is the cultivation of corn and cocoa. This is the first loan they have requested from the Cooperativa San José. Luis works in agriculture and cultivates passion fruit and cocoa. He does his buying and selling every weekend in Matilde. He requests this loan to maintain his plantings of cocoa and improve his financial position. His dream is to give a good education to all his children. He likes to read and play indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain his plantings of cocoa

loans.name: Judith Erlinda

texts.es:
Judith Erlinda L. tiene 49 años, su familia la conforman su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 20 a 26 años de edad  y vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad de  Barranquilla; desde allí se dedica a la comercialización de varios productos alimenticios y no alimenticios como suero, queso, abarcas, mochilas, suéter y ropa interior. Ella proveniente de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar,  desde sus 24 años se vino a Barranquilla y como si quisiera trasladar a esta ciudad  su historia, se trajo en su mente y en su corazón  un poco de su pueblo natal y por eso inició su negocio vendiendo los productos autóctonos de su pueblo: productos no alimenticios bolsos, abarcas y mochilas y alimenticios suero y queso. Hoy después de tanto tiempo recuerda el momento en que llegó de su pueblo buscando nuevos horizontes por eso empezó a trabajar en la  panadería de su tío, pero al casarse se dedicó completamente a su hogar, pero con su capacidad  emprendedora logra desarrollar sus potencialidades mediante su negocio, hasta lo que hoy es y lo que ella proyecta que en un futuros sea.  

Este es el primer crédito que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el planea continuar conectada a  su ciudad de origen San Jacinto, lugar desde donde comprará  bolsos y mochilas que tiene encargados por los clientes en Barranquilla  y llevará a este mismo pueblo  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su meta es acceder a varios créditos de la Fundación que le faciliten aumentar sus inventarios para apoyar mucho más los gastos del hogar, así mismo generar mayores utilidades que le permitan ayudar a que su hija termine la universidad  y que su hijo que ya tiene familia construya su hogar de manera  independiente.
texts.en:
Judith Erlinda L. is 49 years old. Her family consists of her husband and three children who are between the ages of 20 and 26. She lives in the April 7th neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. Judith sells various types of food and merchandise such as whey, cheese, sandals, backpacks, sweaters, and undergarments. She is from San Jacinto in the Department of Bolívar, but when she was 24, she moved to Barranquilla because of the city’s history. Thoughts of her hometown remained in her mind and her heart, so she began selling products made by its people such as non-food bags, sandals, backpacks, and foods such as cheese and whey. Even though it has been a long time since she first moved to Barranquilla, Judith still remembers the moment when she arrived in search of new horizons. She began working at uncle’s bakery. After getting married, she became a full-time homemaker but her enterprising spirit pushed her to develop her potential by starting a business. At the moment, Judith intends to keep her business running into the future.

This is the first loan she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Judith plans to remain connected with her birth city of San Jacinto by purchasing bags and backpacks that are manufactured there and bringing them to her customers in Barranquilla. In addition she will bring back with her clothing for women, men, and children.

Her goal is to obtain several loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase her inventory, which will be a great help in paying the household expenses. At the same time, she will be able to generate more income that will allow her daughter to finish university and enable her son to build a home so that his family can live independently.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags, backpacks, and clothing

loans.name: Julieth Cecilia

texts.es:
Julieth Cecilia L. es una joven mujer  que tiene 27 años y vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de Barranquilla, donde realiza apoyada por su madre una serie de actividades que le producen dinero como son  la confección de uniformes,  venta de carnes frías como salchichas y también comercializa mercancías entre sabanas, ropa, calzado, cosmético estos últimos a crédito, mientras trabaja como empleada ejerciendo la actividad técnica que aprendió en la universidad.

Vive con su cónyuge y su único hijo de 5 años  a quien desea enseñarle los valores con los que sus padres la educaron: la estabilidad familiar, el amor al trabajo y la responsabilidad, con la que parametriza su vida;  se inició trabajando desde muy joven y estudió a su vez técnica en sistemas de información; y fue  precisamente desde la universidad donde inició su negocio comercializando productos, como sabanas, toallas, accesorios femeninos entre sus compañeros de  estudio y con la ayuda de su madre; Al terminar sus estudios empezó a trabajar en una empresa privada donde encuentró oportunidades de aumentar su clientela  de mercancía y simultáneamente se inició en la confección de uniformes, realizando negociaciones que le permiten adicionar un nuevo ingreso, porque aunque no es ella la que realiza las operaciones de la confección,  en la actualidad gestiona contratos con organizaciones educativas y le paga la mano de obra  a una señora  que trabaja en la máquina de Julieth en su casa con la supervisión de su madre. 

Este es su tercer crédito con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la  ha apoyado en el desarrollo de su creatividad emprendedora, porque teniendo esos recursos de crédito  siempre  está pensando en oportunidades de negocios para invertirle un capital que aumente sus ingresos, otro de los aspectos que ha mejorado es que con sus ingresos, procedentes del negocio, ha podido pagar los estudios de su hijo en un colegio bilingüe y además ha comprado de contado a un mejor precio, para vender estas mercancias a un precio competitivo.  

Como negociante aun se encuentra perfeccionando sus posibilidades, mientras también trabaja como empleada desde que salio de la universidad y  todo esto para ofrecerle un futuro mejor a su familia. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva que lo invertirá en  la compra de telas con las que responderá a contratos con un colegio y mercancías varias como ropa, toallas, accesorios y calzados.
texts.en:
Julieth Cecilia L. is a young woman who is 27 years of age and lives in the April 7th neighborhood of Barranquilla. She and her mother engage in a series of income-generating activities such as making uniforms, selling fried meats such as “salchichas” (sausages), and selling merchandise on credit such as bed linens, clothing, shoes, and the latest cosmetics. Julieth also works as an employee at a job where she exercises the technical skills she learned while attending university.

She lives with her husband and five year old son. Julieth wants to teach her child the values that defined her life and were instilled in her by her parents such as family stability, love of work, and responsibility. She began working at a young age while studying for her technical degree in information systems. It was while she was at university that she began her business selling products such as bed linens, towels, and women’s accessories to her classmates with the help of her mother. Upon finishing her degree, she began working at a private company where she found opportunities to increase her customer base for selling merchandise. At the same time, she became involved in producing uniforms. Since she was not directly responsible for the sewing, Julieth began initiating negotiations to create new sources of income and now has contracts with educational organizations. A woman uses the machine in Julieth’s home to do all the sewing under the supervision of her mother.

This is her third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has supported the development of her entrepreneurial creativity. These available credit resources have provided her with opportunities to invest in her businesses and have the capital to increase her earnings. Another aspect that has improved is her income since she can pay for her son’s studies at a bilingual school. In addition, she is able to make business purchases in cash so that she can get a better price, which makes her more competitive when selling her products.

As a businesswoman, she is still refining her abilities while working at the job she obtained upon finishing university. She does all this so that she can provide a better future for her family. At the moment, Julieth is requesting a Kiva loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics so that she can fulfill her school contracts. She will also buy different types of merchandise such as clothing, towels, accessories, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for her sewing business & merchandise to sell through her retail business

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es:
Felix Angel A. G. tiene 34 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 niños de 10 y 9 anos. 

Felix es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, arroz, y cacao. Realiza sus compras de productos en Mata de Cacao cada 2 meses y se realiza la venta de sus productos en Matilde. 

El préstamo será invertido en la siembra de maíz y para la compra de abonos para mejorar la ida en el económico. Su sueño es tener buena vivencia y dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
 
Le gusta jugar indor futbol, boly, y salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Felix Angel A. G. is 34 years old. He lives in a common law relationship in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province. He has two children, ages 10 and 9.

Felix is a member of the El Placer (The Pleasure) rural communal bank, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in all, with the majority engaged in raising corn and cacao. This is the first loan that they have taken out with the Cooperativa San José.

Felix works as a farmer raising corn, rice and cacao. He purchases supplies in Mata de Cacao every two months and sells his products in Matilde. The loan will be invested in seed corn and in the purchase of fertilizer in order to improve his standard of living. His dream is to have a good livelihood and to give a good education to his children. He likes playing indoor soccer, bowling, and going for walks.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed corn and fertilizer

loans.name: Dina Magdalena

texts.es:
Dina tiene 20 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de Usulutan, es casada y vive con el esposo y su pequeño hijo de 8 meses de edad, ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
El negocio lo inicio hace 5 años con venta de productos lácteos y actualmente tiene una variedad de productos que ofrece a los clientes, el negocio esta ubicado en la casa de habitación y lo atiende de 6:00 am- 8:00pm, es una persona emprendedora y con experiencia en el negocio, actualmente  solicita un préstamo para compra de productos como son: queso, crema y cuajada, esto ayudara a incrementar los productos para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar las ventas.
Los sueños son manejar un negocio fuerte, atraer clientes, ser una buena empresaria que le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Dina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Jucuapa, within the Usulutan department. She is married and lives with her husband and eight month old son. She has a store where she sells basic need products. She started the business by selling milk products five years ago. Now she has a variety of products to offer her customers. The business is located within her home and she works from 6:00AM to 8:00PM. She is a very enterprising woman with lots of experience. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy products such as cheese, cream, and milk curd. This will help her increase her inventory so that she can have more to offer her customers and also increase her sales. She dreams of being able to manage a strong business, attract customers, and be a good entrepreneur in order to improve her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jenny Fernanda

texts.es:
Jenny Fernanda V. B. tiene 29 años.  Vive soltera en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos de 14-4 anos. 

Jenny es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jenny se dedica a la casa, cuidando a los animales y los pollos. Las personas vienen a su casa para comprar. 
Solicita el préstamo para criar cerdos, pollos, y alimentos para animales. Su sueño poner una tienda en la casa y darles estudios a sus hijos. 

Le gusta conversar con su vecina en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Jenny Fernanda V. B. is 29 years old and lives in the Chillanes hamlet, within the Bolívar province. She is a single mother with seven children, ranging in ages from 4 to 14. Jenny is an associate of " La Ventanilla Rural El Placer" (The Pleasure Rural Window), located three hours from Chillanes. There are a total of 19 members, most of whom raise corn and cacao. This will be the first loan that they request through the San José cooperative. Jenny raises animals and chickens and people visit her home to buy them. She is asking for this loan so that she can raise hogs, chickens, and buy animal feed. She wants to eventually open a store within her home and be able to give her children a good education. She enjoys talking to her neighbor in her spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hogs, chickens, and feed

loans.name: Carlos Hipolito

texts.es:
Carlos Hipolito M. C. tiene 52 años.  Vive soltero en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura y a la cultivo de cacao, maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao, Matilde, y Bucay cada 4 o 5 días.  

Solicita el préstamo para la maíz, las semillas, y los fertilizantes para mejorar su situación económico. Su sueño es vivir un poco mejor y tener una profesión abogado. A veces el tiempo, las plagas, y las enfermedades afectan a su agricultura.  

Es fanático de lectura, las políticas y la biblia.
texts.en:
Carlos Hipolito M. C. is 52 years old and lives in the Chillanes hamlet, within the Bolívar province. He is an associate of " La Ventanilla Rural El Placer" (The Pleasure Rural Window), located three hours from Chillanes. There are a total of 19 members, most of whom raise corn and cacao. This will be the first loan that they request through the San José cooperative. Carlos is a farmer who raises cacao, corn, and rice. He buys and sells his products every four or five days in Mata de Cacao, Matilde, and Bucay. He is asking for this loan so that she can buy seeds and fertilizer so that he can improve his economic situation. He wants to better his life and become an attorney. At times the weather, blights, and diseases affect his crops. He loves to read and enjoys politics and the bible.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana tiene 46 años de edad reside en el municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos de las edades de 17 y 19 años , ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla de maíz. 
El negocio lo inicio hace 6 años, ella comienza a elaborar las tortillas de 10:00 am- 3:00pm, dicho negocio está ubicado en la casa de habitación.
Ella necesita invertir en compra de maíz, leña, cal, que son productos necesarios para elaborar las tortillas, por cual está solicitando el préstamo que le ayudara para seguir con el negocio y así solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia.
Los sueños de Ana mantener el negocio, continuar con su espíritu empresarial para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and lives in the town of Chinameca, within the San Miguel department. She is married and lives with her husband. Her business is the sale of corn tortillas. She started her business six years ago and works out of her home, making tortillas from 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. She needs to buy dried corn, firewood, and salt, which she needs to make tortillas. She is asking for this loan in order to continue the business and be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Ana wants to maintain her business and continue with her entrepreneurial spirit in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients
